English: Now Solomon the son of David was strengthened in his kingdom, and the LORD his God was with him and exalted him exceedingly.
Bahnar: Sôlômôn, kon drŏ-nglo Đawit pơgơ̆r dêh char pơtao sư pran kơjăp; Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei oei hơdai sư ăn kơ sư pran kơjăp tih dêh tơpă.

English: And Solomon spoke to all Israel, to the captains of thousands and of hundreds, to the judges, and to every leader in all Israel, the heads of the fathers’ houses.
Bahnar: Sôlômôn pơma hăm đĭ-đăng bơngai Isơrael: Lu yŏng pơgơ̆r minh-rơbâu 'nu linh yŏng pơgơ̆r minh-hrĕng 'nu linh, lu 'bok sek tơlang păng lu yŏng kơdră lăm adrĕch bơngai Isơrael

English: Then Solomon, and all the assembly with him, went to the high place that was at Gibeon; for the tabernacle of meeting with God was there, which Moses the servant of the LORD had made in the wilderness.
Bahnar: Sôlômôn păng đĭ-đăng Kon pơlei năm hơdai tŏk tơ anih kơjung tơ pơlei Gibeôn, yua kơ Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm Môis đĭch đam Kră Yang đei pơm pơdơ̆ng tơ char glă oei tơ noh.

English: But David had brought up the ark of God from Kirjath Jearim to the place David had prepared for it, for he had pitched a tent for it at Jerusalem.
Bahnar: Đawit đei chĕp ba bơih Hom tơdrong pơgơ̆p Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei đơ̆ng Kiriat. Jêarim ba tơ anih Đawit đei hơmet bơih wă dan Hom noh, yua kơ Đawit đei pơm bơih bơsŭn wă dan Hom Pơgơ̆p noh tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem.

English: Now the bronze altar that Bezalel the son of Uri, the son of Hur, had made, he put before the tabernacle of the LORD; Solomon and the assembly sought Him there.
Bahnar: Gah chơnang soi păng kong mă Bêsalel, kon drŏ-nglo Uri, sâu Hur pơm boih dan 'bơ̆t anăp Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm Kră Yang; Sôlômôn hăm lu tơpôl akŭm chă Kră Yang tơ noh.

English: And Solomon went up there to the bronze altar before the LORD, which was at the tabernacle of meeting, and offered a thousand burnt offerings on it.
Bahnar: Sôlômôn tŏk tơ anih chơnang soi kong dan 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang, tơ Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm; na sư pơyơ̆r minh-rơbâu tŏ tơmam soi 'buh tơ kơpal chơnang soi noh.

English: On that night God appeared to Solomon, and said to him, “Ask! What shall I give you?”
Bahnar: Lăm măng noh, Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei tơ'bôh kơ Sôlômôn păng khan: “Ih wă kơ Inh ăn kơ ih kiơ? Apinh bĕ.”

English: And Solomon said to God: “You have shown great mercy to David my father, and have made me king in his place.
Bahnar: Sôlômôn tơl Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei khan: “Ih đei tơ'bôh boih tơdrong 'mêm tih kơ 'bă inh Đawit păng kư̆m ăn kơ inh pơm pơtao pơtrơp sư.

English: Now, O LORD God, let Your promise to David my father be established, for You have made me king over a people like the dust of the earth in multitude.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, apinh Ih pơsĭt bĕ nơ̆r Ih đei pơkă pơ'ngam hăm 'bă inh Đawit, gơh jing yua kơ Ih đei pôk inh pơm pơtao boih wă wei pơgơ̆r lu adrĕch adrung lơ kơdrâ̆m thoi 'mui teh âu.

English: Now give me wisdom and knowledge, that I may go out and come in before this people; for who can judge this great people of Yours?”
Bahnar: Thoi ei, apinh Ih ăn kơ inh gơh hơgei đei đon hlôh wao wă kơ inh gơh pơgơ̆r kon pơlei pơla 'nâu yua kơ bu kĕ wei-lăng pơgơ̆r kon pơlei Ih lơ kơdrơ̆m dêh thoi âu?”

English: Then God said to Solomon: “Because this was in your heart, and you have not asked riches or wealth or honor or the life of your enemies, nor have you asked long life—but have asked wisdom and knowledge for yourself, that you may judge My people over whom I have made you king
Bahnar: Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei khan kơ Sôlômôn: “Yua kơ ih đei boih jơhngơ̆m thoi noh, ưh kơ apinh ôh tơdrong mơdrŏng mơng, đe pơyom, dah tơdrong wă pơrăm lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆ kơ ih păng kư̆m ưh apinh wă kơ arih sot, mă-lei apinh tơdrong gơh hơgei đei đon hlôh wao wă kơ wei-lăng pơgơ̆r kon pơlei pơla Inh; kon pơlei mă Inh ăn kơ ih pơm pơtao

English: wisdom and knowledge are granted to you; and I will give you riches and wealth and honor, such as none of the kings have had who were before you, nor shall any after you have the like.”
Bahnar: Lei Inh ăn boih tơdrong gơh hơgei đei đon hlôh wao kơ ih: Inh kư̆m gô ăn kơ ih đei mŭk tơmam mơdrŏng tih, đe pơyom dĭng mah lu pơtao mă adrol dah đơ̆ng rŏng kơ ih kư̆m ưh kơ đei bu thoi noh.

English: So Solomon came to Jerusalem from the high place that was at Gibeon, from before the tabernacle of meeting, and reigned over Israel.
Bahnar: Thoi noh Sôlômôn wih đơ̆ng anih kơjung tơ Gibeôn, dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t anăp Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm, wih brŏk tơ pơlei Jêrusalem. Păng sư pơgơ̆r hloi bơngai Isơrael.

English: And Solomon gathered chariots and horsemen; he had one thousand four hundred chariots and twelve thousand horsemen, whom he stationed in the chariot cities and with the king in Jerusalem.
Bahnar: Sôlômôn akŭm lu gre aseh păng aseh, đei minh-rơbâu puăn-hrĕng tŏ gre aseh păng mơjĭt-'bar rơbâu tŏ aseh; 'măn lê̆ lăm pơlei tah gre aseh kư̆m hơdai hăm pơtao lăm Pơlei Jêrusalem.

English: Also the king made silver and gold as common in Jerusalem as stones, and he made cedars as abundant as the sycamores which are in the lowland.
Bahnar: Pơtao akŭm mong lu hu maih lăm Pơlei Jêrusalem lơ thoi tơmo hơga păng akŭm 'măn 'long hơngo lơ thoi 'long hơra bri lăm thŭng dơnă.

English: And Solomon had horses imported from Egypt and Keveh; the king’s merchants bought them in Keveh at the current price.
Bahnar: Sôlômôn răt lơ aseh đơ̆ng dêh char Êyiptơ păng char Kue đơ̆ng lu bơngai mơdro kơ pơtao răt, 'long sư hơnơ̆ng kơ đe.

English: They also acquired and imported from Egypt a chariot for six hundred shekels of silver, and a horse for one hundred and fifty; thus, through their agents, they exported them to all the kings of the Hittites and the kings of Syria.
Bahnar: Lu Sư răt ba đơ̆ng dêh char Êyiptơ lu gre aseh minh pôm gre dang tơdrâu-hrĕng sêikơl jên hu, lu aseh minh pôm minh-hrĕng pơđăm-jĭt sêikơl jên hu; lu đe âu kư̆m tĕch dơ̆ng kơ lu pơtao đe Hêtit păng pơtao dêh Siri.

English: Then Solomon determined to build a temple for the name of the LORD, and a royal house for himself.
Bahnar: Sôlômôn krao wơh pơm Hnam akŭm kơ Anăn Kră Yang păng pơm minh pôm hnam pơtao kơ sư.

English: Solomon selected seventy thousand men to bear burdens, eighty thousand to quarry stone in the mountains, and three thousand six hundred to oversee them.
Bahnar: Sôlômôn krao pơtơm đei tơpơh hơngan 'nu bơngai wă kơ tung tơ'mơn, tơhngam hơngan thơ̆ teh blah tơmo kơpal kông păng pêng-rơbâu tơdrâu-hrĕng 'nu bơngai lăng wơh đe jang.

English: Then Solomon sent to Hiram king of Tyre, saying: As you have dealt with David my father, and sent him cedars to build himself a house to dwell in, so deal with me.
Bahnar: Sôlômôn gơih nơ̆r kơ Hiram pơtao dêh Tirơ khan: “Ih đei tơgŭm bơih 'bă inh, Đawit, ăn boih, 'long hơngo wă pơm hnam pơtao sư; apinh ih kư̆m tơgŭm inh thoi noh.

English: Behold, I am building a temple for the name of the LORD my God, to dedicate it to Him, to burn before Him sweet incense, for the continual showbread, for the burnt offerings morning and evening, on the Sabbaths, on the New Moons, and on the set feasts of the LORD our God. This is an ordinance forever to Israel.
Bahnar: Dang ei inh wă pơm hnam kơ Anăn Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei inh, wă 'măn lê̆ Hnam noh kơ Sư, wă soh 'long 'bâu phu 'bơ̆t anăp Sư, dan 'bĕng rơgoh ling-lang, pơyơ̆r tơmam soi 'buh kiơ̆ pơgê păng gah kơsơ̆, păng lăm năr Sa'bat, năr Khei Tơ'bang blŭng-a Khei Tơ'bang, păng lăm lu năr giĕng Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei nhôn; noh bơih minh tơdrong pơkă kơ lu bơngai Isơrael athei kiơ̆ ling-lang hloi.

English: And the temple which I build will be great, for our God is greater than all gods.
Bahnar: Hnam mă inh wă pơm tih dêh tơpă. Yua kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu nhôn tih dêh hloh kơ lu yang nai.

English: But who is able to build Him a temple, since heaven and the heaven of heavens cannot contain Him? Who am I then, that I should build Him a temple, except to burn sacrifice before Him?
Bahnar: Lei na bu kĕ pơm ăn hnam kơ Kră Yang? Mă lu plĕnh, plĕnh kơ lu tăl plĕnh kư̆m ưh kơ gơh 'măn kơ Sư mơ̆n! Lei inh âu bu, mă gơh pơm hnam ăn kơ Kră Yang? Pơm hnam lăp wă soh 'long 'bâu phu 'bơ̆t anăp Sư.

English: Therefore send me at once a man skillful to work in gold and silver, in bronze and iron, in purple and crimson and blue, who has skill to engrave with the skillful men who are with me in Judah and Jerusalem, whom David my father provided.
Bahnar: Na dang ei pơtao athei chă gơih ăn kơ inh lu bơngai hơgei gơh hling maih, hu, kong, mam, bơngai tanh brai che 'brê hơhĭm, jơk 'brê gôh, kư̆m gơh chrek chhơ̆, wă kơ bơ̆jang hăm lu bơngai thơ̆ hơgei inh, tơ dêh Juđa păng pơlei Jêrusalem, mă 'bă inh Đawit đei ăn boih sơ̆.

English: Also send me cedar and cypress and algum logs from Lebanon, for I know that your servants have skill to cut timber in Lebanon; and indeed my servants will be with your servants
Bahnar: Kŭm athei gơih ăn kơ inh 'long hơngo, 'long hơngo hla iĕ, 'long kơte đơ̆ng char Liban, yua kơ inh băt lu bơngai jang kơ ih juăt kơ kăl 'long đơ̆ng char Liban, lu bơngai jang kơ inh gô jang hơdai lu bơngai bơ̆jang đơ̆ng ih.

English: to prepare timber for me in abundance, for the temple which I am about to build shall be great and wonderful.
Bahnar: Wă kơ lu sư kăl 'long mă lơ; yua kơ Hnam akŭm inh wă pơm gô tih păng rŏ tơpă.

English: And indeed I will give to your servants, the woodsmen who cut timber, twenty thousand kors of ground wheat, twenty thousand kors of barley, twenty thousand baths of wine, and twenty thousand baths of oil.
Bahnar: Inh gô ăn lu bơngai jang, kăl 'long đơ̆ng ih, 'bar-jĭt rơbâu kôr (dang 'bar-hrĕng puăn-jĭt kĭ) 'ba tơ'bâu, 'bar-jĭt rơbâu kôr 'ba mi, 'bar-jĭt rơbâu lit sik hơmu păng 'bar-jĭt rơbâu lit đak rơmă ôliwơ.”

English: Then Hiram king of Tyre answered in writing, which he sent to Solomon: Because the LORD loves His people, He has made you king over them.
Bahnar: Hiram, pơtao Tirơ, chih hla bơar tơl Sôlômôn: Yua kơ Kră Yang 'mêm mơnat kơ kon pơlei Sư, lei na pôk ih pơm pơtao lu sư.

English: Hiram also said: Blessed be the LORD God of Israel, who made heaven and earth, for He has given King David a wise son, endowed with prudence and understanding, who will build a temple for the LORD and a royal house for himself!
Bahnar: Hiram khan dơ̆ng: “Bơnê kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Isơrael, Kră Yang Tơ'ngla pơjing kơ plĕnh teh, Sư đei ăn boih kơ pơtao Đawit minh 'nu kon drŏ-nglo gơh hơgei, hlôh wao wă pơm hnam kơ Kră Yang păng wă pơm minh pôm hnam pơtao kơ sư.

English: And now I have sent a skillful man, endowed with understanding, Huram my master craftsman
Bahnar: Dang ei, inh gơih ăn kơ ih Huram Abi, sư bơngai hơgei dêh gơh pơm tôm.

English: (the son of a woman of the daughters of Dan, and his father was a man of Tyre), skilled to work in gold and silver, bronze and iron, stone and wood, purple and blue, fine linen and crimson, and to make any engraving and to accomplish any plan which may be given to him, with your skillful men and with the skillful men of my lord David your father.
Bahnar: Mĕ sư đơ̆ng adrĕch Đan, 'bă sư bơngai đơ̆ng Pơlei Tirơ. Sư bơngai hơgei gơh hơjơ̆m hling hu, maih, kong, mam blah tơmo, traih 'long, gơh tanh brai 'brê hơhĭm, jơk 'brê gôh hăm che kok se, chhơ̆ chrek păng hơgei gơh pơm tôm, kiơ̆ kơ đe chă wơh athei sư pơm. Sư gô jang hơdai lu bơngai hơgei ih kư̆m thoi mă jang kơ 'bă ih 'bok Đawit yŏng inh.

English: Now therefore, the wheat, the barley, the oil, and the wine which my lord has spoken of, let him send to his servants.
Bahnar: Thoi ei na apinh ih gơih ăn kơ lu đĭch đam ih 'ba tơ'bâu, 'ba mi, đak rơmă păng sik đak hơmu, thoi ih yŏng inh đei khan boih.

English: And we will cut wood from Lebanon, as much as you need; we will bring it to you in rafts by sea to Joppa, and you will carry it up to Jerusalem.
Bahnar: Na lu nhôn gô năm kăl 'long đơ̆ng char Liban kiơ̆ dôm yơ ih kăl wă, chô̆ pơm hơkĭ pơđông rok đak trong dơsĭ truh tơ Pơlei Jôpa, đơ̆ng noh ih gô iŏk hơtŏk ba tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem.”

English: Then Solomon numbered all the aliens who were in the land of Israel, after the census in which David his father had numbered them; and there were found to be one hundred and fifty-three thousand six hundred.
Bahnar: Sôlômôn chih jô̆ đĭ-đăng lu bơngai tơmoi oei lăm char Isơrael ki thoi kơ Đawit, 'bă sư đei chih jô̆ boih, đei minh-hrĕng pơđăm-jĭt pêng-rơbâu tơdrâu-hrĕng 'nu

English: And he made seventy thousand of them bearers of burdens, eighty thousand stonecutters in the mountain, and three thousand six hundred overseers to make the people work.
Bahnar: Lăm noh đei jao ăn kơ tơpơh-jĭt rơbâu 'nu bơngai tung tôi 'long, tơhngam-jĭt rơbâu 'nu blah teh tơmo tơ kơpal kông păng đei pêng-rơbâu tơdrâu-hrĕng 'nu bơngai wei wơh kon pơlei jang.

English: Now Solomon began to build the house of the LORD at Jerusalem on Mount Moriah, where the LORD had appeared to his father David, at the place that David had prepared on the threshing floor of Ornan the Jebusite.
Bahnar: Sôlômôn pơtơm pơm hnam akŭm kơ Kră Yang lăm pơlei Jêrusalem, kơpal kông Môria, anih mă Kră Yang đei jur tơ'bôh kơ Đawit, 'bă sư, tơ anih mă Đawit đei rơ̆ng hơmet, 'bơ̆t anih pơjuă 'ba Arauna, bơngai Jêbus.

English: And he began to build on the second day of the second month in the fourth year of his reign.
Bahnar: Sôlômôn pơtơm pơm hnam akŭm năr mă 'bar khei 'bar, sơnăm mă puăn lăm chăl sư pơgơ̆r.

English: This is the foundation which Solomon laid for building the house of God: The length was sixty cubits (by cubits according to the former measure) and the width twenty cubits.
Bahnar: 'Nâu hơnă mă Sôlômôn đei man wă pơm hnam Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei: Să, kiơ̆ kơ hơgăt sơ̆, tor Sư tơdrâu-jĭt hơgăt; wơ̆l 'bar-jĭt hơgăt.

English: And the vestibule that was in front of the sanctuary was twenty cubits long across the width of the house, and the height was one hundred and twenty. He overlaid the inside with pure gold.
Bahnar: Kơdeng gah anăp, tor să 'bar-jĭt hơgăt, hơtŏ kơ wơ̆l hnam akŭm; kơjung 'bar-jĭt hơgăt. Sư lom klơ̆p hăm maih se tơ lăm.

English: The larger room he paneled with cypress which he overlaid with fine gold, and he carved palm trees and chainwork on it.
Bahnar: Tơnăr hnam akŭm, đe pĕng păng tơ̆r 'long hơngo lom hăm maih se, chhơ̆ rup 'long gol păng chhơ̆ rup glang tơ noh.

English: And he decorated the house with precious stones for beauty, and the gold was gold from Parvaim.
Bahnar: Đe pơgong hăm tơmo rang gĭt wă pơhrôp sư; maih noh maih đơ̆ng char Parwai

English: He also overlaid the house—the beams and doorposts, its walls and doors—with gold; and he carved cherubim on the walls.
Bahnar: Hnam akŭm sư lom hăm maih, tơ̆r roh hơdrông, không 'măng, tơnăr păng 'măng hnam akŭm, 'bơ̆t tơnăr đe chhơ̆ rup chêrubim.

English: And he made the Most Holy Place. Its length was according to the width of the house, twenty cubits, and its width twenty cubits. He overlaid it with six hundred talents of fine gold.
Bahnar: Sư kư̆m man anih Rơgoh 'lơ̆ng Hloh tor sư 'bar-jĭt hơgăt wơ̆l sư 'bar-jĭt hơgăt, pơtao lom klơ̆p anih noh hăm maih se; maih noh kŏng đei 21tân.

English: The weight of the nails was fifty shekels of gold; and he overlaid the upper area with gold.
Bahnar: Lu kơđĭnh maih kŏng trăp đei 1kĭ 1gram 5; sư kư̆m lom maih tơ anih kơpal.

English: In the Most Holy Place he made two cherubim, fashioned by carving, and overlaid them with gold.
Bahnar: Tơ lăm anih 'lơ̆ng Rơgoh Hloh, sư 'bok pơm kơtă 'bar tŏ chêrubim, lom hăm maih.

English: The wings of the cherubim were twenty cubits in overall length: one wing of the one cherub was five cubits, touching the wall of the room, and the other wing was five cubits, touching the wing of the other cherub
Bahnar: Pơnăr chêrubim să 'bar-jĭt hơgăt; minh hlak pơnăr kơ minh pôm chêrubim gah 'ma kơjung pơđăm hơgăt, hơtŭt kơ tơnăr hnam akŭm; pơnăr minh pah kư̆m kơjung pơđăm hơgăt păng hơtŭt kơ pơnăr gah 'ngiĕo chêrubim mă 'bar.

English: one wing of the other cherub was five cubits, touching the wall of the room, and the other wing also was five cubits, touching the wing of the other cherub.
Bahnar: Minh pah pơnăr chêrubim mă 'bar kư̆m pơđăm hơgăt kơjung, hơtŭt kơ tơnăr hnam akŭm gah to; pơnăr minh pah dơ̆ng kư̆m kơjung pơđăm hơgăt, tơ'bưh hơtŭt kơ pơnăr chêrubim mă mônh.

English: The wings of these cherubim spanned twenty cubits overall. They stood on their feet, and they faced inward.
Bahnar: Pơnăr 'bar tŏ chêrubim bơyar ngăl kơjung sư đei 'bar-jĭt hơgăt; 'bar tŏ chêrubim dang dơ̆ng tơwih măt tơ gah tơnăr Anih 'lơ̆ng Rơgoh.

English: And he made the veil of blue, purple, crimson, and fine linen, and wove cherubim into it.
Bahnar: Sư kư̆m pơm che pĕng iŏk brai jơk 'brê hơhĭm, 'brê gôh, tơ kơpal che 'bui se noh sĭt dônh pơm rup chêrubim.

English: Also he made in front of the temple two pillars thirty-five cubits high, and the capital that was on the top of each of them was five cubits.
Bahnar: Gah anăp hnam akŭm, sư man 'bar tŏ jrăng, kơjung pêng-jĭt pơđăm hơgăt, kơ̆l jrăng pơđăm hơgăt minh pôm jrăng.

English: He made wreaths of chainwork, as in the inner sanctuary, and put them on top of the pillars; and he made one hundred pomegranates, and put them on the wreaths of chainwork.
Bahnar: Sư kư̆m pơm glang thoi rơbưn, đăng tơ kơpal kơ̆l jrăng păng pơm minh-hrĕng tŏ plei gărnăt man klep tơ glang noh.

English: Then he set up the pillars before the temple, one on the right hand and the other on the left; he called the name of the one on the right hand Jachin, and the name of the one on the left Boaz.
Bahnar: Sư pơdơ̆ng jrăng noh 'bơ̆t anăp Hnam akŭm, minh pôm jrăng gah gơal, minh pôm jrăng gah yă-nơ̆m; anăn jrăng gah gơal noh Jakin păng jrăng gah yă-nơ̆m noh krao anăn Bôas.

English: Moreover he made a bronze altar: twenty cubits was its length, twenty cubits its width, and ten cubits its height.
Bahnar: Sư pơm chơnang soi hăm kong, tor kơjung 'bar-jĭt hơgăt, wơ̆l 'bar-jĭt hơgăt, kơjung mơjĭt hơgăt.

English: Then he made the Sea of cast bronze, ten cubits from one brim to the other; it was completely round. Its height was five cubits, and a line of thirty cubits measured its circumference.
Bahnar: Sư hling minh pôm Bơng hăm kong, wĭl hơpôm dang ăi đơ̆ng âu truh tơ to mơjĭt hơgăt, jrŭ sư pơđăm hơgăt; sư pơtŏ tăp dăr pêng-jĭt hơgăt.

English: And under it was the likeness of oxen encircling it all around, ten to a cubit, all the way around the Sea. The oxen were cast in two rows, when it was cast.
Bahnar: Ala gơnăp bơng đei rup rơmo tơno, rim kơ minh hơgăt đei rup rơmo mơjĭt tŏ hling 'bar trong, hling kơtă hơdai bơng

English: It stood on twelve oxen: three looking toward the north, three looking toward the west, three looking toward the south, and three looking toward the east; the Sea was set upon them, and all their back parts pointed inward.
Bahnar: Bơng dan kơpal mơjĭt-'bar tŏ rup rơmo, pêng tŏ tơwih muh măt tơ gah yă-nơ̆m, pêng tŏ tơwih muh măt tơ gah bơmơ̆t, pêng tŏ tơwih muh măt tơ gah gơal păng pêng tŏ rup rơmo noh tơwih muh măt tơ gah hơlĕch rŏng tơwih tơ lăm.

English: It was a handbreadth thick; and its brim was shaped like the brim of a cup, like a lily blossom. It contained three thousand baths.
Bahnar: Hơ'bơ̆l sư tŏ pah, 'bơ̆r sư thoi 'bơ̆r kơchŏk, thoi pơkao tŏng-mŏng 'nao tơlang; bơng mong đak dang tơdrâu-jĭt tơdrâu-rơbâu lit.

English: He also made ten lavers, and put five on the right side and five on the left, to wash in them; such things as they offered for the burnt offering they would wash in them, but the Sea was for the priests to wash in.
Bahnar: Sư kư̆m đei pơm mơjĭt tŏ bơng iĕ, wă ôp hơrao dan pơđăm tŏ gah gơal, pơđăm tŏ gah yă-nơ̆m, wă ôp dôm lu tơmam soi 'buh; bơng tih wă lê̆ kơ lu 'bok soi ôp hơrao tơ noh

English: And he made ten lampstands of gold according to their design, and set them in the temple, five on the right side and five on the left.
Bahnar: Sư pơm mơjĭt tŏ jơ̆ng kơđeng hăm maih kiơ̆ kơ đei pơkă; na tah sư tơ lăm hnam akŭm, pơđăm tŏ gah gơal, pơđăm tŏ gah yă-nơ̆m.

English: He also made ten tables, and placed them in the temple, five on the right side and five on the left. And he made one hundred bowls of gold.
Bahnar: Sư kư̆m pơm mơjĭt tŏ gơ'bang, tah lăm hnam akŭm, pơđăm tŏ gah gơal, pơđăm tŏ gah yă-nơ̆m, kư̆m đei pơm minh-hrĕng tŏ kơlăm păng maih wă mong pham.

English: Furthermore he made the court of the priests, and the great court and doors for the court; and he overlaid these doors with bronze.
Bahnar: Sư kư̆m đei man cham ăn kơ 'bok soi păng cham să, lu 'măng kơ cham să na lôm hăm kong rim kơ 'măng noh.

English: He set the Sea on the right side, toward the southeast.
Bahnar: Sư lê̆ bơng tih gah gơal 'bơ̆t mum gah tơklă hơlĕch gơal.

English: Then Huram made the pots and the shovels and the bowls. So Huram finished doing the work that he was to do for King Solomon for the house of God
Bahnar: Huram kư̆m man gŏ tah ngar, gơ'bênh păng pơnhan tô. Huram pơm keh tôm dôm tơdrong mă đơ̆ng pơtao Sôlômôn jao ăn kơ sư lăm hnam Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei

English: the two pillars and the bowl-shaped capitals that were on top of the two pillars; the two networks covering the two bowl-shaped capitals which were on top of the pillars
Bahnar: Đei 'bar tŏ jrăng păng đei 'bar tŏ pơnhan pơkao tŏng-mŏng kơpal kơ 'bar tŏ kơ̆l jrăng, đei lu hơdrao klơ̆p lê̆ kơpal kơ̆l jrăng

English: four hundred pomegranates for the two networks (two rows of pomegranates for each network, to cover the two bowl-shaped capitals that were on the pillars)
Bahnar: đei puăn-hrĕng tŏ plei gărnăt pơklep tơ 'bar tŏ glang dăng tăp kơ pơnhan pơkao, đei 'bar trong plei gărnăt wăn dăr kơpal kơ̆l jrăng

English: he also made carts and the lavers on the carts
Bahnar: sư kư̆m pơm jơ̆ng tơjră păng dan bơng iĕ kơpal jơ̆ng tơjră noh

English: one Sea and twelve oxen under it
Bahnar: bơng tih dan kơpal rup mơjĭt-'bar tŏ rơmo

English: also the pots, the shovels, the forks—and all their articles Huram his master craftsman made of burnished bronze for King Solomon for the house of the LORD.
Bahnar: pơm gŏ mong ngar, gơ'bênh, pơnai hrêu păng đĭ-đăng tơmam yua lăm noh: Huram Abi pơm ăn kơ pơtao Sôlômôn hling hăm kong iel rang wă yua lăm hnam Kră Yang.

English: In the plain of Jordan the king had them cast in clay molds, between Succoth and Zeredah.
Bahnar: Pơtao athei pơm không hăm teh man hling lu tơmam noh tơ tơmăn glă đak Krong Jôrđăn, sơlam pơlei Sukôt hăm pơlei Sêrêda.

English: And Solomon had all these articles made in such great abundance that the weight of the bronze was not determined.
Bahnar: Pơtao Sôlômôn man pơm đĭ-đăng lu tơmam noh lơ tơpă yua kong pơm pă kĕ jô̆ dôm yơ.

English: Thus Solomon had all the furnishings made for the house of God: the altar of gold and the tables on which was the showbread
Bahnar: Sôlômôn pơm đĭ-đăng lu tơmam yua lăm hnam Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei; chơnang soi maih, lu gơ'bang yua wă dan 'bĕng rơgoh

English: the lampstands with their lamps of pure gold, to burn in the prescribed manner in front of the inner sanctuary
Bahnar: jơ̆ng kơđeng, akâu kơđeng păng maih se rơgoh wă soh tơ̆k ŭnh 'bơ̆t anăp Anih 'lơ̆ng Rơgoh hloh, kiơ̆ thoi đei pơkă

English: with the flowers and the lamps and the wick-trimmers of gold, of purest gold
Bahnar: lu pơkao ŭnh kơđeng păng, chơkep tơpăt pơm ham maih se rơgoh

English: the trimmers, the bowls, the ladles, and the censers of pure gold. As for the entry of the sanctuary, its inner doors to the Most Holy Place, and the doors of the main hall of the temple, were gold.
Bahnar: Săng chơkep kăt brai kơlăm mong pham, pơnhan, bô̆i tah tơmam 'bâu phu, kư̆m pơm hăm maih se; lu măng hnam akŭm, lu tơnang 'măng lăm anih 'lơ̆ng Rơgoh Hloh păng lu 'măng hnam Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei tă kơ pơm păng maih se ngăl.

English: So all the work that Solomon had done for the house of the LORD was finished; and Solomon brought in the things which his father David had dedicated: the silver and the gold and all the furnishings. And he put them in the treasuries of the house of God.
Bahnar: Lăp, dôm tơdrong jang Sôlômôn pơm hnam Kră Yang đang keh boih, Sôlômôn iŏk tơmơ̆t dôm tơmam mă 'bă sư Đawit pơyơ̆r: Hu, maih păng đĭ-đăng tơmam yua, tah lăm hnam mong tơmam hnam Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: Now Solomon assembled the elders of Israel and all the heads of the tribes, the chief fathers of the children of Israel, in Jerusalem, that they might bring the ark of the covenant of the LORD up from the City of David, which is Zion.
Bahnar: Sôlômôn krao akŭm đĭ-đăng lu kră bơngai Isơrael, lu yŏng kơdră lăm rim adrĕch 'bă Sư păng lu kră pơgơ̆r kon pơlei Isơrael tơ pơlei Jêrusalem wă tung tơmơ̆t Hom tơdrong pơgơ̆p Kră Yang đơ̆ng Siôn, noh pơlei Đawit.

English: Therefore all the men of Israel assembled with the king at the feast, which was in the seventh month.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng lu drŏ-nglo bơngai Isơrael akŭm năm tơ pơtao wă pơm giĕng trŏ lăm khei tơpơh.

English: So all the elders of Israel came, and the Levites took up the ark.
Bahnar: Wă đĭ-đăng lu kră bơngai Isơrael truh na lu bơngai Lêwi tung ba Hom Pơgơ̆p noh.

English: Then they brought up the ark, the tabernacle of meeting, and all the holy furnishings that were in the tabernacle. The priests and the Levites brought them up.
Bahnar: Lu 'bok soi bơngai Lêwi năm tung ba Hom Pơgơ̆p păng Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm hăm đĭ dôm tơmam rơgoh yua lăm noh.

English: Also King Solomon, and all the congregation of Israel who were assembled with him before the ark, were sacrificing sheep and oxen that could not be counted or numbered for multitude.
Bahnar: Pơtao Sôlômôn păng đĭ-đăng lu bơngai Isơrael akŭm hơdai pơtao dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t anăp Hom Pơgơ̆p, lu sư pơyơ̆r triu, rơmo wă pơm tơmam soi lơ dêh, ưh pă kĕ chih jô̆.

English: Then the priests brought in the ark of the covenant of the LORD to its place, into the inner sanctuary of the temple, to the Most Holy Place, under the wings of the cherubim.
Bahnar: Lu 'bok soi tung tơmơ̆t Hom Pơgơ̆p Kră Yang tơ lăm anih 'măn lê̆ kơ Hom Pơgơ̆p, tơ anih 'Lơ̆ng Rơgoh Hloh lăm hnam Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, tơ ala lu pơnăr rup chêrubim.

English: For the cherubim spread their wings over the place of the ark, and the cherubim overshadowed the ark and its poles.
Bahnar: Chêrubim bơyar pơnăr sư kơpal kơ Hom Pơgơ̆p, gom klơ̆p Hom Pơgơ̆p păng đĭ 'long tơnung tung Hom.

English: The poles extended so that the ends of the poles of the ark could be seen from the holy place, in front of the inner sanctuary; but they could not be seen from outside. And they are there to this day.
Bahnar: 'Long tơnung tung Hom Pơgơ̆p kơjung, na đơ̆ng anăp lăm anih 'Lơ̆ng Rơgoh lăng 'bôh, mă-lei lăng đơ̆ng 'nguaih ưh kơ 'bôh; Hom Pơgơ̆p noh oei đei tơ lăm noh dĭng truh tơ dang ei.

English: Nothing was in the ark except the two tablets which Moses put there at Horeb, when the LORD made a covenant with the children of Israel, when they had come out of Egypt.
Bahnar: Lăm Hom Pơgơ̆p ưh kơ đei kiơ, 'nguaih kơ 'bar tŏ gô 'bang khôi juăt mă Môis đei tah lăm noh tơ Kông Hôrêp, kơplah Kră Yang pơgơ̆p hăm kon pơlei Isơrael, 'bơ̆t lu sư 'nao lĕch đơ̆ng char Êyiptơ.

English: And it came to pass when the priests came out of the Most Holy Place (for all the priests who were present had sanctified themselves, without keeping to their divisions)
Bahnar: Lu 'bok soi kơdŭn lĕch đơ̆ng anih 'Lơ̆ng rơgoh, đĭ-đăng lu 'bok soi lu sư athei hơmet kơdih rơgoh, mă khan lu sư khŭl ayơ.

English: and the Levites who were the singers, all those of Asaph and Heman and Jeduthun, with their sons and their brethren, stood at the east end of the altar, clothed in white linen, having cymbals, stringed instruments and harps, and with them one hundred and twenty priests sounding with trumpets
Bahnar: Lu bơngai Lêwi hơri, noh Asap, Hêman păng Jêđuthun, lu kon drŏ-nglo sư lu 'nhŏng oh sư hrŭk hơbĕn ao che 'bui se rơmuăn, preh chhar, reh brŏ dung, tĭng-nĭng đĭ-đăng lu sư dơ̆ng gah hơlĕch kơ chơnang soi hơdai hăm minh-hrĕng 'bar-jĭt 'nu 'bok soi hlôm keng.

English: indeed it came to pass, when the trumpeters and singers were as one, to make one sound to be heard in praising and thanking the LORD, and when they lifted up their voice with the trumpets and cymbals and instruments of music, and praised the LORD, saying: “For He is good, For His mercy endures forever,” that the house, the house of the LORD, was filled with a cloud
Bahnar: Lu bơngai hlôm keng hăm lu bơngai hơri hơdai minh pôm nơ̆r tơ'nguơ̆ hrơ̆p hrơ̆p, na hơri bơnê ư-ang kơ Kră Yang, lu sư hơri hơdai hăm re keng, ot preh chhar reh brŏ dung hăm lu brŏ nai hơri ư-ang kơ Kră Yang khan: “Sư 'lơ̆ng 'mêm mơnat iơ̆m dim Sư oei oei ling-lang,” Kơplah noh hnam Kră Yang đei hơmơ̆l gom

English: so that the priests could not continue ministering because of the cloud; for the glory of the LORD filled the house of God.
Bahnar: dĭng mah lu 'bok soi ưh kơ kĕ dơ̆ng wă bơ̆jang yua kơ hơmơ̆l jur tơdrong ư-ang rang mơnhal đơ̆ng Kră Yang mơ̆t 'bĕnh-'bang jơ̆p-jang kơ hnam akŭm 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: Then Solomon spoke: “The LORD said He would dwell in the dark cloud.
Bahnar: Pơtao Sôlômôn khan: “Kră Yang khan Ih khan gô oei lăm hơmơ̆l găm hơ'bơ̆l

English: I have surely built You an exalted house, And a place for You to dwell in forever.”
Bahnar: Dang ei inh đei pơm boih minh pôm hnam ăn kơ Ih oei, anih mă Ih gô oei ling-lang.”

English: Then the king turned around and blessed the whole assembly of Israel, while all the assembly of Israel was standing.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh pơtao hue tơ rŏng sơkat pŭn hiôk ăn kơ đĭ-đăng kon pơlei Isơrael akŭm oei dơ̆ng tơ noh.

English: And he said: “Blessed be the LORD God of Israel, who has fulfilled with His hands what He spoke with His mouth to my father David, saying
Bahnar: Sư khan: “Kơkuh bơnê tơpă kơ Kră Yang, 'Bok Kei-Dei Isơrael, tơ'ngla mă pơkă pơ'ngam hăm Đawit, 'bă inh iŏk ti Sư gô pơm keh dôm nơ̆r đêl Sư pơkă noh. Sư khan

English: ‘Since the day that I brought My people out of the land of Egypt, I have chosen no city from any tribe of Israel in which to build a house, that My name might be there, nor did I choose any man to be a ruler over My people Israel.
Bahnar: ‘Đơ̆ng năr Inh chông tơlĕch kon pơlei pơla inh đơ̆ng dêh char Êyiptơ, Inh ưh tam mă đei rơih iŏk ôh pơlei ayơ đơ̆ng lăm lu adrĕch Isơrael wă pơm hnam kơ Anăn Inh tơ noh păng Inh kư̆m tam mă đei rơih bu pơm pơtao pơgơ̆r lu bơngai Isơrael Inh

English: Yet I have chosen Jerusalem, that My name may be there, and I have chosen David to be over My people Israel.’
Bahnar: Mă-lei Inh đei rơih boih Jêrusalem, wă kơ Anăn Inh tơ noh păng rơih Đawit wă pơgơ̆r kon pơlei pơla Inh Isơrael.’ ”

English: Now it was in the heart of my father David to build a temple for the name of the LORD God of Israel.
Bahnar: Lăm jơhngơ̆m 'bă inh Đawit đei boih đon tơchĕng wă pơm hnam ăn kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei bơngai Isơrael.

English: But the LORD said to my father David, ‘Whereas it was in your heart to build a temple for My name, you did well in that it was in your heart.
Bahnar: Mă-lei Kră Yang khan kơ 'bă inh Đawit: “Yua kơ lăm jơhngơ̆m Ih đei boih khan wă 'maih pơm hnam ăn kơ Anăn Inh, ih tơchĕng 'lơ̆ng tơpă boih.

English: Nevertheless you shall not build the temple, but your son who will come from your body, he shall build the temple for My name.’
Bahnar: Lei ră ih ưh kơ pơm hnam ăn kơ Anăn Inh ôh, mă-lei kon drŏ-nglo ih gô pơm hnam noh ăn kơ Anăn Inh,”

English: So the LORD has fulfilled His word which He spoke, and I have filled the position of my father David, and sit on the throne of Israel, as the LORD promised; and I have built the temple for the name of the LORD God of Israel.
Bahnar: “Kră Yang pơsĭt pơkeh boih đêl nơ̆r Sư pơkă, ăn kơ inh wă pơtrơp ioi Đawit, 'bă inh, pơm pơtao pơgơ̆r bơngai Isơrael, thoi nơ̆r Kră Yang đei pơkă, na inh tơiung pơdơ̆ng pơm boih hnam ăn kơ Anăn Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei bơngai Isơrael

English: And there I have put the ark, in which is the covenant of the LORD which He made with the children of Israel.”
Bahnar: Tơ hnam noh inh đei tah boih Hom Pơgơ̆p đơ̆ng Kră Yang mă đei pơgơ̆p hăm bơngai Isơrael.”

English: Then Solomon stood before the altar of the LORD in the presence of all the assembly of Israel, and spread out his hands
Bahnar: Sôlômôn oei dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t anăp chơnang soi Kră Yang, anăp kon pơlei oei akŭm, sư yơ̆r ti.

English: (for Solomon had made a bronze platform five cubits long, five cubits wide, and three cubits high, and had set it in the midst of the court; and he stood on it, knelt down on his knees before all the assembly of Israel, and spread out his hands toward heaven)
Bahnar: Sư pơm boih minh pôm hơdrơ̆l hăm kong, tor sư pơđăm hơgăt, wơ̆l pơđăm hơgăt, kơjung pêng hơgăt, dan 'bơ̆t tŏk-bŏk cham; sư dơ̆ng tơ noh sơtơ̆p kŭl-tăng 'bơ̆t anăp lu bơngai Isơrael akŭm, yơ̆r ti tơ plĕnh.

English: and he said: “LORD God of Israel, there is no God in heaven or on earth like You, who keep Your covenant and mercy with Your servants who walk before You with all their hearts.
Bahnar: Sư khan: “Bơnê kơkuh kơ Ih Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Isơrael kơpal plĕnh păng ala teh ưh kơ đei yang kiơ nai mă thoi Ih wei răk dôm nơ̆r đêl pơkă wă 'mêm mơnat kơ đĭch đam Ih, mưh lu sư đĭ jơhngơ̆m năm kiơ̆ Ih.

English: You have kept what You promised Your servant David my father; You have both spoken with Your mouth and fulfilled it with Your hand, as it is this day.
Bahnar: Hăm đĭch đam Ih Đawit, 'bă inh, Ih oei răk dôm nơ̆r mă Ih đei pơkăm hăm sư sĭt tơpă đơ̆ng nơ̆r Ih đei pơkă hăm ti Ih pơm pơkeh hloi thoi mă đei boih dang ei.

English: Therefore, LORD God of Israel, now keep what You promised Your servant David my father, saying, ‘You shall not fail to have a man sit before Me on the throne of Israel, only if your sons take heed to their way, that they walk in My law as you have walked before Me.’
Bahnar: Dang ei, ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Isơrael răk bĕ nơ̆r Ih đei pơkă boih hăm 'bă inh, Đawit đĭch đam Ih, thoi âu: “'Bơ̆t anăp Inh ưh kơ đei khăi ôh kơ bơngai pơtrơp pơm pơtao pơgơ̆r lu bơngai Isơrael tơdah kon sâu ih mă pơ'lơ̆ng trong lu sư yak, wei răk khôi juăt Inh, thoi ih đei pơm boih 'bơ̆t anăp Inh.”

English: And now, O LORD God of Israel, let Your word come true, which You have spoken to Your servant David.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Isơrael ăn tơdrong mă Ih đei pơkă hăm Đawit đĭch đam Ih gơh jing.

English: “But will God indeed dwell with men on the earth? Behold, heaven and the heaven of heavens cannot contain You. How much less this temple which I have built!
Bahnar: Hăm tơpă Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei oei hơdai hăm kon bơngai tơ ala teh âu? Tơ plĕnh mă đĭ hơtăl plĕnh, kư̆m ưh kơmah kơ Ih, pơma kiơ hnam mă inh pơm boih 'nâu!

English: Yet regard the prayer of Your servant and his supplication, O LORD my God, and listen to the cry and the prayer which Your servant is praying before You
Bahnar: Mă khan lei ră, ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei inh apinh Ih mơ̆ng nơ̆r krao khan apinh đơ̆ng inh đĭch đam ih, mơ̆ng nơ̆r apinh hơdrĭ đơ̆ng đĭch đam Ih hơpơi apinh 'bơ̆t anăp Ih.

English: that Your eyes may be open toward this temple day and night, toward the place where You said You would put Your name, that You may hear the prayer which Your servant makes toward this place.
Bahnar: Apinh măt Ih lăng păng wei hnam âu măng păng năr, hnam âu Ih đei khan boih ih gô 'măn Anăn Ih tơ noh. Apinh Ih mơ̆ng lu đĭch đam Ih krao apinh Ih tơ gah anih âu.

English: And may You hear the supplications of Your servant and of Your people Israel, when they pray toward this place. Hear from heaven Your dwelling place, and when You hear, forgive.
Bahnar: Apinh Ih mơ̆ng lu đĭch đam Ih păng kon pơlei Ih Isơrael krao apinh Ih tơ gah anih 'nâu, apinh Ih mơ̆ng đơ̆ng plĕnh anih mă Ih oei tơl tơwih nơ̆r apinh păng mơnat ăn.

English: “If anyone sins against his neighbor, and is forced to take an oath, and comes and takes an oath before Your altar in this temple
Bahnar: Tơdah đei bơngai pơm yoch hăm lu rông 'bôt sư păng đe athei Sư khŏm pơkă, bơngai noh năm dơ̆ng pơkă 'bơ̆t anăp chơnang soi Ih lăm hnam âu

English: then hear from heaven, and act, and judge Your servants, bringing retribution on the wicked by bringing his way on his own head, and justifying the righteous by giving him according to his righteousness.
Bahnar: apinh Kră Yang đơ̆ng kơpal plĕnh ti mơ̆ng nơ̆r sư păng pơm. Sek tơlang kơ lu đĭch đam Ih, pơm tơwih bĕ kơ bơngai pơm kơnê̆, kiơ̆ thoi tơdrong kơnê̆ sư đei pơm, ăn kơ tơdrong yoch sư pơm noh tuh tơ kơpal kơ̆l sư kơdih. Pơm mă hơdah kơ bơngai tơpăt kiơ̆ kơ tơdrong tơpăt sư pơm.

English: “Or if Your people Israel are defeated before an enemy because they have sinned against You, and return and confess Your name, and pray and make supplication before You in this temple
Bahnar: Tơdah adrĕch Isơrael Ih pơm yoch hăm Ih, lu ayăt blah lu sư thuơ, na sư wih brŏk tơ Ih, băt kơ tơbral krao chă anăn Ih păng krao apinh Ih tơ hnam akŭm 'nâu

English: then hear from heaven and forgive the sin of Your people Israel, and bring them back to the land which You gave to them and their fathers.
Bahnar: lei apinh Ih đơ̆ng kơpal plĕnh ti mơ̆ng păng mơnat ăn kơ tơdrong yoch lu adrĕch Isơrael kon pơlei Ih păng ăn kơ lu sư wih brŏk tơ teh đak mă Ih đei ăn boih kơ lu sư păng yă 'bok lu sư sơ̆.

English: “When the heavens are shut up and there is no rain because they have sinned against You, when they pray toward this place and confess Your name, and turn from their sin because You afflict them
Bahnar: Mưh plĕnh tang đĭ ưh kơ đei 'mi, yua kơ đơ̆ng kon pơlei Isơrael pơm yoch hăm Ih na lu sư tơkan tơ hnam âu krao pôk anăn Ih tơbral yoch kơdih yua kơ Ih phak lu sư pơmat-tat boih.

English: then hear in heaven, and forgive the sin of Your servants, Your people Israel, that You may teach them the good way in which they should walk; and send rain on Your land which You have given to Your people as an inheritance.
Bahnar: Lei apinh Ih Kră Yang oei kơpal plĕnh mơ̆ng bĕ păng mơnat ăn kơ tơdrong yoch lu đĭch đam Ih bơngai Isơrael Ih. Tơpă Ih đei bơtho tơ'bôh ăn boih trong 'lơ̆ng wă kơ lu sư yak kiơ̆, ăn 'mi jur tơ teh mă Ih đei ăn kơ kon pơlei Ih jang sa.

English: “When there is famine in the land, pestilence or blight or mildew, locusts or grasshoppers; when their enemies besiege them in the land of their cities; whatever plague or whatever sickness there is
Bahnar: Tơdah lăm char đei tơdrong pơngot rơwĕt lôch hơbuh, phang-ang hơ'bo 'ba ôm phơ̆k, lep 'ba lep tung-nut; kăp pơrăm dah đei lu ayăt wang dăr lu pơlei tih dah đei tơdrong gleh, jĭ jăn truh.

English: whatever prayer, whatever supplication is made by anyone, or by all Your people Israel, when each one knows his own burden and his own grief, and spreads out his hands to this temple
Bahnar: Dah đei bơngai bu dah đĭ-đăng kon pơlei bơngai Isơrael Ih rim 'nu băt hlôh kơ tơdrong gleh pơmat păng jĭ jăn kơdih, na yơ̆r ti tơ gah hnam 'nâu, krao apinh

English: then hear from heaven Your dwelling place, and forgive, and give to everyone according to all his ways, whose heart You know (for You alone know the hearts of the sons of men)
Bahnar: apinh Kră Yang đơ̆ng kơpal plĕnh anih Ih oei, mơ̆ng, mơnat ăn păng pơdrâu tơwih kơ lu sư rim 'nu kiơ̆ thoi lu sư đei tơbral Ih băt nhen kơ jơhngơ̆m klơm klak lu sư; tơpă lăp minh 'nu Ih đĕch băt hơđăl kơ jơhngơ̆m klơm klak kon bơngai

English: that they may fear You, to walk in Your ways as long as they live in the land which You gave to our fathers.
Bahnar: Wă kơ lu sư hli yom kơ Ih, kiơ̆ trong Ih đĭ chăl arih oei lăm ala teh mă Ih đei ăn boih kơ lu 'bok yă lu nhôn.

English: “Moreover, concerning a foreigner, who is not of Your people Israel, but has come from a far country for the sake of Your great name and Your mighty hand and Your outstretched arm, when they come and pray in this temple
Bahnar: Kŭm thoi noh mơ̆n gah lu bơngai tơmoi, ưh kơ trŏ kơ adrĕch bơngai Isơrael Ih ôh, mă-lei yua kơ anăn Ih kơkŏng ti mơsêh mơyang Ih, mưh lu sư krao khan tơ gah hnam âu

English: then hear from heaven Your dwelling place, and do according to all for which the foreigner calls to You, that all peoples of the earth may know Your name and fear You, as do Your people Israel, and that they may know that this temple which I have built is called by Your name.
Bahnar: apinh Ih Kră Yang đơ̆ng kơpal plĕnh, anih Ih oei, mơ̆ng bĕ păng pơm ăn bĕ kiơ̆ kơ tơdrong lu Sư hơpơi apinh Ih wă kơ đĭ-đăng kon bơngai oei kơpal teh âu băt ư-ang kơ Ih băt hli yom kơ Ih kư̆m thoi lu bơngai Isơrael Ih păng băt kơ hnam âu mă inh đei pơm krao anăn Ih.

English: “When Your people go out to battle against their enemies, wherever You send them, and when they pray to You toward this city which You have chosen and the temple which I have built for Your name
Bahnar: Mưh kon pơlei Ih năm tơblah hăm lu bơngai ayăt mă tơ yơ yơ Ih wơh, tơdah lu sư krao apinh 'blŏk kơ pơlei tih mă Ih đei rơih iŏk păng gah hnam mă inh đei pơm hăm anăn Ih 'nâu.

English: then hear from heaven their prayer and their supplication, and maintain their cause.
Bahnar: Lei apinh Ih đơ̆ng kơpal plĕnh mơ̆ng bĕ nơ̆r lu sư krao Ih tơgŭm bĕ tơdrong lu sư apinh.

English: “When they sin against You (for there is no one who does not sin), and You become angry with them and deliver them to the enemy, and they take them captive to a land far or near
Bahnar: Mưh lu sư pơm yoch hăm Ih yua kơ ưh kơ đei bu mă huay kơ pơm yoch păng Ih hil mĭl jao lu sư tơ lu ayăt kơ lu sư, lu bơngai ayăt rôp lu sư pơm bơnă chông tơ dêh char nai ataih dah jê̆

English: yet when they come to themselves in the land where they were carried captive, and repent, and make supplication to You in the land of their captivity, saying, ‘We have sinned, we have done wrong, and have committed wickedness’
Bahnar: tơdah lăm char mă lu sư pơm bơnă, na tơbral păng krao khan apinh Ih thoi âu: ‘Lu nhôn pơm yoch, pơm tơdrong kơnê̆ păng kư̆ kă,’

English: and when they return to You with all their heart and with all their soul in the land of their captivity, where they have been carried captive, and pray toward their land which You gave to their fathers, the city which You have chosen, and toward the temple which I have built for Your name
Bahnar: tơdah lăm char mă lu sư pơm bơnă, lu sư đĭ jơhngơ̆m đĭ đon wih brŏk tơ Ih, krao khan apinh Ih păng 'blŏk kơ dêh char mă Ih đei ăn boih kơ 'bok yă lu sư, pơlei tih mă Ih đei rơih, păng hnam mă inh đei pơm hăm anăn Ih 'nâu

English: then hear from heaven Your dwelling place their prayer and their supplications, and maintain their cause, and forgive Your people who have sinned against You.
Bahnar: lei na apinh ih đơ̆ng kơpal plĕnh ti anih mă Ih oei, mơ̆ng bĕ nơ̆r lu sư krao apinh, dŏng tơgŭm lu sư păng mơnat ăn lê̆ pă jô̆ yo kơ tơdrong yoch mă kon pơlei pơla đei pơm hăm Ih.

English: Now, my God, I pray, let Your eyes be open and let Your ears be attentive to the prayer made in this place.
Bahnar: Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei inh! Inh krao apinh Ih lăng păng mơ̆ng nơ̆r krao apinh Ih đơ̆ng anih 'nâu.

English: “Now therefore, Arise, O LORD God, to Your resting place, You and the ark of Your strength. Let Your priests, O LORD God, be clothed with salvation, And let Your saints rejoice in goodness.
Bahnar: Dang ei, ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, apinh Ih păng Hom Pơgơ̆p mơsêh mơyang Ih mơ̆t lăm anih pơdơh âu, Apinh Ih ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei! Hơpơi kơ lu 'bok soi đei hrŭk iŏk tơdrong dŏng pơklaih. Ăn kơ lu bơngai 'lơ̆ng rơgoh Ih chơt hiôk lăm tơdrong Ih 'mêm mơnat!

English: “O LORD God, do not turn away the face of Your Anointed; Remember the mercies of Your servant David.”
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, apinh Ih 'nĕ achăng lê̆ bơngai mă Ih rơih đe tuh đak rơmă; 'blŏk bĕ tơdrong Ih pơkă 'mêm mơnat kơ pơtao Đawit, đĭch đam Ih.”

English: When Solomon had finished praying, fire came down from heaven and consumed the burnt offering and the sacrifices; and the glory of the LORD filled the temple.
Bahnar: Đang kơ Sôlômôn krao khan Kơplah noh đei ŭnh đơ̆ng plĕnh jruh soh sa tơmam soi 'buh păng lu tơmam soi pơyơ̆r; tơdrong ư-ang rang mơnhal Kră Yang jur mơ̆t 'bĕnh kơ hnam akŭm.

English: And the priests could not enter the house of the LORD, because the glory of the LORD had filled the LORD’s house.
Bahnar: Lu 'bok soi ưh kơ gơh kơ mơ̆t tơ lăm hnam akŭm Kră Yang, yua kơ tơdrong ư-ang mơsêh mơyang rang mơnhal mơ̆t 'bĕnh jơ̆p-jang kơ hnam akŭm Kră Yang hloi.

English: When all the children of Israel saw how the fire came down, and the glory of the LORD on the temple, they bowed their faces to the ground on the pavement, and worshiped and praised the LORD, saying: “For He is good, For His mercy endures forever.”
Bahnar: Lăp đĭ-đăng kon pơlei Isơrael 'bôh ŭnh păng mơsêh mơyang rang mơnhal Kră Yang jur tơ hnam; na lu Sư drap bon tơ teh kơkuh kơ Kră Yang khan: “Tơpă Sư 'lơ̆ng, tơdrong Sư 'mêm mơnat oei oei ling-lang!

English: Then the king and all the people offered sacrifices before the LORD.
Bahnar: Na pơtao păng đĭ đang kon pơlei pơyơ̆r tơmam soi 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang.

English: King Solomon offered a sacrifice of twenty-two thousand bulls and one hundred and twenty thousand sheep. So the king and all the people dedicated the house of God.
Bahnar: Pơtao Sôlômôn pơyơ̆r tơmam soi 'bar-jĭt 'bar-rơbâu tŏ rơmo păng minh-hrĕng 'bar-jĭt rơbâu tŏ triu păng bơbe, thoi noh pơtao Sôlômôn păng đĭ-đăng kon pơlei pơyơ̆r pơih hloi hnam akŭm 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: And the priests attended to their services; the Levites also with instruments of the music of the LORD, which King David had made to praise the LORD, saying, “For His mercy endures forever,” whenever David offered praise by their ministry. The priests sounded trumpets opposite them, while all Israel stood.
Bahnar: Lu 'bok soi dơ̆ng kơtă 'bơ̆t anih kơdih; lu bơngai Lêwi chĕp brŏ hơri bơnê kơ Kră Yang, mă đơ̆ng Đawit pơm sơ̆ wă kơkuh bơnê kơ Kră Yang păng hơri ư-ang kơ Sư: “Tơpă tơdrong Sư 'mêm mơnat oei oei ling-lang.” Lu 'bok soi hlôm keng dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t anăp bơngai Lêwi păng đĭ-đăng kon pơlei bơngai Isơrael iung dang dơ̆ng.

English: Furthermore Solomon consecrated the middle of the court that was in front of the house of the LORD; for there he offered burnt offerings and the fat of the peace offerings, because the bronze altar which Solomon had made was not able to receive the burnt offerings, the grain offerings, and the fat.
Bahnar: Sôlômôn 'măn lê̆ minh anih tŏk-bŏk cham 'bơ̆t anăp hnam akŭm Kră Yang; tơ noh boih mă sư pơyơ̆r tơmam soi 'buh păng rơmă pơm tơmam soi kơ tơdrong hiôk-hian, yua kơ lu chơnang soi păng kong mă đêl Sôlômôn pơm noh ưh kơ mah wă dan đĭ lu tơmam soi 'buh, tơmam soi phe 'ba păng rơmă.

English: At that time Solomon kept the feast seven days, and all Israel with him, a very great assembly from the entrance of Hamath to the Brook of Egypt.
Bahnar: Kơplah noh Sôlômôn păng đĭ-đăng kon pơlei Isơrael, lu sư minh tơpôl lơ tơpă năm đơ̆ng tơring Lêbô Hamat truh tơ thong Êyiptơ, pơm giĕng lăm tơpơh năr.

English: And on the eighth day they held a sacred assembly, for they observed the dedication of the altar seven days, and the feast seven days.
Bahnar: Truh năr mă tơhngam, lu sư akŭm tih dêh, yua kơ lu sư pơm giĕng pơyơ̆r chơnang soi lăm tơpơh năr păng pơm giĕng hmă kư̆m tơpơh năr.

English: On the twenty-third day of the seventh month he sent the people away to their tents, joyful and glad of heart for the good that the LORD had done for David, for Solomon, and for His people Israel.
Bahnar: Năr 'bar-jĭt pêng khei tơpơh, sư ăn kơ kon pơlei wih brŏk tơ anih kơdih, jơhngơ̆m lu sư chơt hiôk păng 'nă hal, yua kơ Kră Yang đei ăn boih tơdrong 'lơ̆ng kơ Đawit, kơ Sôlômôn păng ăn kơ kon pơlei pơla Isơrael Sư.

English: Thus Solomon finished the house of the LORD and the king’s house; and Solomon successfully accomplished all that came into his heart to make in the house of the LORD and in his own house.
Bahnar: Lăp Sôlômôn pơm keh hnam Kră Yang păng hnam pơtao; mă tôm tơdrong jang kiơ Sôlômôn hơmet wă pơm lăm hnam Kră Yang păng lăm hnam pơtao sư, sư pơm keh đang đĭ boih.

English: Then the LORD appeared to Solomon by night, and said to him: “I have heard your prayer, and have chosen this place for Myself as a house of sacrifice.
Bahnar: Lăm măng noh Kră Yang pơdah Sư kơ Sôlômôn păng khan: “Inh kơtơ̆ng boih nơ̆r ih krao khan păng Inh kư̆m rơih boih anih 'nâu wă pơm hnam pơyơ̆r tơmam soi kơ Inh.

English: When I shut up heaven and there is no rain, or command the locusts to devour the land, or send pestilence among My people
Bahnar: Mưh Inh tang đĭ plĕnh ti, ưh kơ ăn 'mi jur, dah ăn kơ lep 'ba truh kăp sa lu hơnik hơnan păng dah ăn tơdrong lôch hơbuh truh tơ kon pơlei Inh

English: if My people who are called by My name will humble themselves, and pray and seek My face, and turn from their wicked ways, then I will hear from heaven, and will forgive their sin and heal their land.
Bahnar: Tơdah kon pơlei pơla Inh, đe krao lu sư kon Inh, drap bon kơkuh, krao khan, chơchă Inh păng tơbral achăng lê̆ trong kơnê̆ lei Inh oei kơpal plĕnh ti gô mơ̆ng, mơnat ăn huay pă jô̆ yoch lu sư păng ăn teh lu sư thoi đêl.

English: Now My eyes will be open and My ears attentive to prayer made in this place.
Bahnar: Măt Inh gô lăng păng đon Inh gô pơgling mơ̆ng nơ̆r krao khan đơ̆ng anih 'nâu.

English: For now I have chosen and sanctified this house, that My name may be there forever; and My eyes and My heart will be there perpetually.
Bahnar: Inh rơih iŏk boih păng ăn kơ hnam âu jing rơgoh ăn kơ anăn Inh oei ling-lang; măt păng jơhngơ̆m đon Inh kư̆m gô oei mơ̆ng lăng tơ noh khŏm khŏm.

English: As for you, if you walk before Me as your father David walked, and do according to all that I have commanded you, and if you keep My statutes and My judgments
Bahnar: Bĕ ih, tơdah ih yak năm 'bơ̆t anăp Inh rok thoi 'bă ih, Đawit đei pơm, pơm kiơ̆ dôm tơdrong Inh athei pơkă kơ sư, wei răk khôi juăt păng nơ̆r Inh tơtă

English: then I will establish the throne of your kingdom, as I covenanted with David your father, saying, ‘You shall not fail to have a man as ruler in Israel.’
Bahnar: na Inh gô ăn kơ dêh char pơtao Ih pran kơjăp thoi nơ̆r Inh pơkă pơgơ̆p hăm 'bă ih, Đawit thoi âu: Lăm adrĕch Isơrael ưh kơ'bah bơngai pơgơ̆r Isơrael.

English: “But if you turn away and forsake My statutes and My commandments which I have set before you, and go and serve other gods, and worship them
Bahnar: “Mă-lei tơdah iĕm weh trong plơ̆ng, achăng lê̆ tơdrong juăt păng nơ̆r Inh tơtă mă đei ăn kơ lu iĕm, na jang păng kơkuh kơ yang kơnê̆

English: then I will uproot them from My land which I have given them; and this house which I have sanctified for My name I will cast out of My sight, and will make it a proverb and a byword among all peoples.
Bahnar: lei Inh gô buch hŭt lê̆ lu iĕm đơ̆ng lăm teh đak mă Inh đei ăn kơ lu iĕm; Inh gô achăng lê̆ hnam akŭm âu đơ̆ng anăp Inh, hnam mă Inh 'măn lê̆ 'lơ̆ng rơgoh kơ Anăn Inh boih, Inh gô ăn kơ sư jing nơ̆r đe pơđơ̆k pơjăm pơjuă lăm kon pơlei nai.

English: “And as for this house, which is exalted, everyone who passes by it will be astonished and say, ‘Why has the LORD done thus to this land and this house?’
Bahnar: Hnam 'nâu mă khan kơjung rŏ dang yơ, dah đei bu yak rok noh 'bôh hlĭch na jet! “Yua kơ kiơ Kră Yang pơm kơ char 'nâu păng hnam 'nâu thoi noh?”

English: Then they will answer, ‘Because they forsook the LORD God of their fathers, who brought them out of the land of Egypt, and embraced other gods, and worshiped them and served them; therefore He has brought all this calamity on them.’ ”
Bahnar: Na đe tơl thoi âu: ‘Yua kơ lu sư achăng lê̆ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei 'bok yă lu sư, Tơ'ngla mă chông tơlĕch lu sư đơ̆ng dêh char Êyiptơ păng yua kơ lu sư kiơ̆ yang nai, kơkuh păng jang ăn kơ lu yang noh, lei na Kră Yang ăn tơdrong truh răm 'nâu tơ lu sư.’ ”

English: It came to pass at the end of twenty years, when Solomon had built the house of the LORD and his own house
Bahnar: Kơtĕch kơ 'bar-jĭt sơnăm đơ̆ng rŏng kơ Sôlômôn pơm man hnam Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei păng hnam pơtao sư kơdih keh đang boih

English: that the cities which Hiram had given to Solomon, Solomon built them; and he settled the children of Israel there.
Bahnar: na Sôlômôn kư̆m pơdơ̆ng ming lu pơlei mă Hiram pơtao đe Tirơ đei asong ăn boih kơ sư păng sư ăn kơ lu kon pơlei Isơrael oei pơm pơlei tơ noh.

English: And Solomon went to Hamath Zobah and seized it.
Bahnar: Sôlômôn năm blah pơlei Hamat Sôba jei sư.

English: He also built Tadmor in the wilderness, and all the storage cities which he built in Hamath.
Bahnar: Sư pơm pơlei Tatmôr lăm char glă păng pơm pơjing lu pơlei wă pơm anih mong tah tơmam lăm Hamat.

English: He built Upper Beth Horon and Lower Beth Horon, fortified cities with walls, gates, and bars
Bahnar: Sư kư̆m pơm pơjing ming pơlei Bêt Hôron Kơpơ̆ng păng Bêt Hôrôn Ala, Pơm kơđông đei dur man kơjăp đei 'măng jang păng đei chơkăl

English: also Baalath and all the storage cities that Solomon had, and all the chariot cities and the cities of the cavalry, and all that Solomon desired to build in Jerusalem, in Lebanon, and in all the land of his dominion.
Bahnar: pơjing dơ̆ng pơlei Balat păng pơm lu pơlei đei hnam mong mŭk tơmam păng lu pơlei wă tah gre păng pơlei ăn kơ lu aseh, tơdrong kiơ Sôlômôn wă 'maih pơm, Sư pơm tơ pơlei Jêrusalem, lăm char Liban, dah tơ lăm rim dêh char ayơ mă sư pơgơ̆r.

English: All the people who were left of the Hittites, Amorites, Perizzites, Hivites, and Jebusites, who were not of Israel
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng bơngai mă oei arih răi lăm lu kon pơlei Hêtit, Amôrit, Pêrisit, Hêwit păng Jêbus, ưh kơ trŏ kơ adrĕch Isơrael

English: that is, their descendants who were left in the land after them, whom the children of Israel did not destroy—from these Solomon raised forced labor, as it is to this day.
Bahnar: lu adrĕch adrung lu đe âu lu sư oei arih răi lăm char mă lu bơngai Isơrael tim mă pơlôch đĭ, na Sôlômôn rôp lu sư pơm đĭch dĭng truh dang ei.

English: But Solomon did not make the children of Israel servants for his work. Some were men of war, captains of his officers, captains of his chariots, and his cavalry.
Bahnar: Mă-lei lu bơngai Isơrael, Sôlômôn ưh kơ đei rôp bu pơm đĭch, lu sư pơm linh, pơm yŏng pơgơ̆r, wei-lăng gre aseh păng lu linh hao aseh.

English: And others were chiefs of the officials of King Solomon: two hundred and fifty, who ruled over the people.
Bahnar: Pơtao Sôlômôn kư̆m đei minh-hrĕng pơđăm-jĭt 'nu bơngai bơ̆jang, wei-lăng pơgơ̆r lu kon pơlei jang

English: Now Solomon brought the daughter of Pharaoh up from the City of David to the house he had built for her, for he said, “My wife shall not dwell in the house of David king of Israel, because the places to which the ark of the LORD has come are holy.”
Bahnar: Sôlômôn ba kon adruh pơtao Pharaôn đơ̆ng pơlei Đawit năm oei tơ hnam pơtao mă sư đei pơm ăn boih; yua kơ sư khan: Akăn inh ưh kơ oei lăm hnam pơtao Đawit, pơtao đe Isơrael yua kơ tơ anih ayơ Hom Kră Yang truh jing anih 'lơ̆ng rơgoh.

English: Then Solomon offered burnt offerings to the LORD on the altar of the LORD which he had built before the vestibule
Bahnar: Sôlômôn pơyơ̆r tơmam soi 'buh ăn kơ Kră Yang tơ kơpal chơnang soi Kră Yang mă sư đei pơm 'bơ̆t kơdeng anăp 'măng hnam akŭm.

English: according to the daily rate, offering according to the commandment of Moses, for the Sabbaths, the New Moons, and the three appointed yearly feasts—the Feast of Unleavened Bread, the Feast of Weeks, and the Feast of Tabernacles.
Bahnar: Sư pơyơ̆r rim năr kiơ̆ kơ Môis pơkă boih pơyơ̆r lăm năr giĕng Sa'bat, năr khei tơ'bang păng pêng kơ̆m giĕng lăm sơnăm noh lu năr giĕng sa 'bĕng ưh kơ đei 'Buih pông, kơ̆m giĕng phĕ kĕch, năr giĕng Bơsŭn.

English: And, according to the order of David his father, he appointed the divisions of the priests for their service, the Levites for their duties (to praise and serve before the priests) as the duty of each day required, and the gatekeepers by their divisions at each gate; for so David the man of God had commanded.
Bahnar: Kiơ̆ thoi Đawit 'bă sư, tơtă, sư asong tơdrong jang ăn kơ lu 'bok soi kiơ̆ kơ tơdrong jang khŭl lu sư, jao kơ khŭl bơngai Lêwi hat hơri ư-ang păng bơ̆jang tơgŭm lu 'bok soi, jang kiơ̆ tơdrong jang rim năr; tơ rim kơ 'măng jang Sư kư̆m đei ăn kơ khŭl bơngai gak 'măng jang, yua kơ 'nâu nơ̆r Đawit tơtă, bơngai Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: They did not depart from the command of the king to the priests and Levites concerning any matter or concerning the treasuries.
Bahnar: Nơ̆r pơtao đei tơtă kơ lu 'bok soi bơngai Lêwi gah tôm tơdrong jang mă khan tơ hnam mong mŭk tơmam athei jang mă 'lơ̆ng.

English: Now all the work of Solomon was well-ordered from the day of the foundation of the house of the LORD until it was finished. So the house of the LORD was completed.
Bahnar: Thoi noh đĭ-đăng tơdrong jang Sôlômôn đei pơm boih, đơ̆ng pơm tơiung hnam Kră Yang dĭng keh đang; pơm hnam Kră Yang keh đang boih.

English: Then Solomon went to Ezion Geber and Elath on the seacoast, in the land of Edom.
Bahnar: Na Sôlômôn năm tơ pơlei Êsiôn Gêber păng pơlei Êlat tơ cheng đak dơsĭ, lăm dêh char Eđôm.

English: And Hiram sent him ships by the hand of his servants, and servants who knew the sea. They went with the servants of Solomon to Ophir, and acquired four hundred and fifty talents of gold from there, and brought it to King Solomon.
Bahnar: Hiram gơih ăn bơngai jang sư chĕp ba duk hăm bơngai juăt kơ wơ̆r duk lăm đak dơsĭ; lu sư năm hơdai bơngai jang Sôlômôn năm tơ Ôphir, đơ̆ng noh lu sư chĕp ba ăn kơ Sôlômôn mơjĭt-tơdrâu tâna maih.

English: Now when the queen of Sheba heard of the fame of Solomon, she came to Jerusalem to test Solomon with hard questions, having a very great retinue, camels that bore spices, gold in abundance, and precious stones; and when she came to Solomon, she spoke with him about all that was in her heart.
Bahnar: Wă pơtao drŏ-kăn dêh char Seba kơtơ̆ng đe ư-ang kơ Sôlômôn, na sư năm truh tơ Jêrusalem, wă pơpơn pơlong lăng Sôlômôn; yă pơtao chông lu đĭch đam bơngai awih awăn lơlap, đei lu lăk-đa chơ pơgang 'bâu phu, đei maih lơ păng tơno gĭt; sư năm tơ Sôlômôn, roi tôm dôm tơdrong mă sư đei tơchĕng lăm kơ̆l sư kơdih.

English: So Solomon answered all her questions; there was nothing so difficult for Solomon that he could not explain it to her.
Bahnar: Sôlômôn tơl tơwih đĭ dôm tơdrong yă pơtao jet, ưh kơ đei nơ̆r jet ayơ mă hlơp tơnat mă ưh kơ gơh tơl kơ yă.

English: And when the queen of Sheba had seen the wisdom of Solomon, the house that he had built
Bahnar: Yă pơtao Seba 'bôh tơdrong hơgei Sôlômôn, lăng hnam sư đei pơm boih

English: the food on his table, the seating of his servants, the service of his waiters and their apparel, his cupbearers and their apparel, and his entryway by which he went up to the house of the LORD, there was no more spirit in her.
Bahnar: lu tơmam sa tơ gơ'bang, tang-dŏ lu yŏng pơgơ̆r sư hơ-oei, lu bơngai awih awăn sư hơbĕn ao lu sư hrŭk, lu bơngai awih awăn ăn đak nhă hơbĕn ao tai lu sư hrŭk păng dôm lu tơmam soi 'buh pơyơ̆r lăm hnam Kră Yang, na yă pơtao Seba lăng hlĭch ưh pă băt pơma liơ.

English: Then she said to the king: “It was a true report which I heard in my own land about your words and your wisdom.
Bahnar: Yă pơtao khan kơ pơtao: Tơdrong inh kơtơ̆ng đe roi gah ih lăm char nhôn tơdrong nơ̆r ih pơma hơgei păng tơdrong jang ih hơgei tơpă.

English: However I did not believe their words until I came and saw with my own eyes; and indeed the half of the greatness of your wisdom was not told me. You exceed the fame of which I heard.
Bahnar: Mă-lei adrol kơ inh tam mă truh tơ âu tam mă 'bôh tơm măt dôm tơdrong 'nâu, lei inh ưh kơ lui ôh kơ nơ̆r lu sư roi noh; lei na, 'nâu đe roi kơ inh băt ưh tam mă đei minh puăt ôh tơdrong ih hơgei; sĭt tơpă tơdrong hơgei ih tih hloh kơ inh kơtơ̆ng.

English: Happy are your men and happy are these your servants, who stand continually before you and hear your wisdom!
Bahnar: Pŭn hiôk dêh kơ lu bơngai pơgơ̆r oei hăm ih, lu đam ih, rim năr jang 'bơ̆t anăp ih, mơ̆ng nơ̆r 'bơ̆r đon hơgei ih

English: Blessed be the LORD your God, who delighted in you, setting you on His throne to be king for the LORD your God! Because your God has loved Israel, to establish them forever, therefore He made you king over them, to do justice and righteousness.”
Bahnar: Trŏ bơnê ư-ang tơpă kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ih, Sư lăp đon kơ ih, ăn kơ ih pơm pơtao hơ-oei 'bơ̆t tang-dŏ pơtao Sư wă pơm pơtao ăn kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ih! Yua kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ih 'mêm kơ bơngai Isơrael, wă pơm ăn kơ lu sư kơjăp ling-lang, lei na ăn kơ ih pơm pơtao lu sư wă pơm tơdrong 'lơ̆ng păng tơdrong tơpăt.

English: And she gave the king one hundred and twenty talents of gold, spices in great abundance, and precious stones; there never were any spices such as those the queen of Sheba gave to King Solomon.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh sư ăn kơ pơtao minh-hrĕng 'bar-jĭt talâng maih, tơmam 'bâu phu lơ tơpă păng tơmo gĭt, tam biơh đei tơmam 'bâu phu thoi noh đơ̆ng sơ̆ thoi tơmam 'bâu phu đơ̆ng thoi yă pơtao char Seba ăn kơ pơtao Sôlômôn.

English: Also, the servants of Hiram and the servants of Solomon, who brought gold from Ophir, brought algum wood and precious stones.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai đơ̆ng Hiram păng lu bơngai đơ̆ng Sôlômôn wơh kư̆m đei chơ 'long kơte păng chơ tơmo gĭt đơ̆ng char Ôphir.

English: And the king made walkways of the algum wood for the house of the LORD and for the king’s house, also harps and stringed instruments for singers; and there were none such as these seen before in the land of Judah.
Bahnar: Pơtao yua 'long kơte noh pơm kung lăm hnam akŭm Kră Yang păng lăm hnam pơtao, hăm pơm brŏ dung, tĭng-nĭng reh ăn kơ khŭl hơri; đơ̆ng sơ̆ đe ưh tam 'bôh ôh tơ lăm dêh char Juđa đei thoi noh.

English: Now King Solomon gave to the queen of Sheba all she desired, whatever she asked, much more than she had brought to the king. So she turned and went to her own country, she and her servants.
Bahnar: Pơtao Sôlômôn ăn kơ yă pơtao char Seba tơmam kiơ̆ thoi sư apinh hơpơi wă, lơ hloh kơ tơmam sư đei pơyơ̆r ăn kơ pơtao Sôlômôn, đơ̆ng noh yă pơtao păng lu đĭch đam sư wih brŏk tơ dêh char sư kơdih.

English: The weight of gold that came to Solomon yearly was six hundred and sixty-six talents of gold
Bahnar: Maih mă pơtao Sôlômôn đei iŏk lăm rim sơnăm tơdrâu-hrĕng tơdrâu-jĭt tơdrâu talâng.

English: besides what the traveling merchants and traders brought. And all the kings of Arabia and governors of the country brought gold and silver to Solomon.
Bahnar: Ưh kơ jô̆ lu maih mă đơ̆ng lu mơdro pơyơ̆r, mă hu maih đơ̆ng pơtao Arâp dah đơ̆ng lu yŏng pơgơ̆r char năm ba ăn kơ pơtao Sôlômôn.

English: And King Solomon made two hundred large shields of hammered gold; six hundred shekels of hammered gold went into each shield.
Bahnar: Pơtao Sôlômôn tơtang maih noh pơm 'bar-hrĕng hlak khêl tih, minh hlak khêl trăp tơdrâu-hrĕng beka maih.

English: He also made three hundred shields of hammered gold; three hundred shekels of gold went into each shield. The king put them in the House of the Forest of Lebanon.
Bahnar: Păng pêng-hrĕng tŏ khêl iĕ hăm maih, minh hlak khêl trăp pêng-hrĕng beka maih; na pơtao 'măn khêl noh tơ lăm hnam Bri kơdrơ̆ng char Liban.

English: Moreover the king made a great throne of ivory, and overlaid it with pure gold.
Bahnar: Pơtao kư̆m pơm minh pôm tang-dŏ tih hăm bơla đơ̆ng noh bah hăm maih rơgoh.

English: The throne had six steps, with a footstool of gold, which were fastened to the throne; there were armrests on either side of the place of the seat, and two lions stood beside the armrests.
Bahnar: Tang-dŏ noh đei tơdrâu kơnao păng jơ̆ng juă tơklep hăm tang-dŏ; kư̆m đei anih hơgơn ti pah âu pah to kơ anih hơ-oei, cheng noh đei man 'bar tŏ rup dăm-brang.

English: Twelve lions stood there, one on each side of the six steps; nothing like this had been made for any other kingdom.
Bahnar: Kŭm đei man mơjĭt-'bar tŏ dăm-brang 'bơ̆t tơdrâu kơnao gah 'ma păng gah 'ngiĕo; ưh kơ đei dêh char ayơ mă pơm tang-dŏ thoi noh.

English: All King Solomon’s drinking vessels were gold, and all the vessels of the House of the Forest of Lebanon were pure gold. Not one was silver, for this was accounted as nothing in the days of Solomon.
Bahnar: Lu kơchŏk pơnhan yua wă huch nhă tă kơ pơm hăm maih ngăl păng đĭ lu tơmam yua lăm hnam pơtao Bri kơdrơ̆ng char Liban kư̆m pơm hăm maih rơgoh; lăm chăl Sôlômôn, đe ưh kơ gĭt ôh hu

English: For the king’s ships went to Tarshish with the servants of Hiram. Once every three years the merchant ships came, bringing gold, silver, ivory, apes, and monkeys.
Bahnar: yua kơ pơtao đei khŭl duk tŏk tơ Tarêsis, hơdai hăm đĭch đam Hiram; păng pêng sơnăm minh wơ̆t duk juăt kơ chơ ba hu maih, bơla, kuĕnh păng 'bok bul.

English: So King Solomon surpassed all the kings of the earth in riches and wisdom.
Bahnar: Thoi noh boih na pơtao Sôlômôn đe ang hloh kơ lu pơtao kơpal teh âu kơ tơdrong sư mơdrŏng păng tơdrong sư hơgei.

English: And all the kings of the earth sought the presence of Solomon to hear his wisdom, which God had put in his heart.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng lu pơtao lăm teh 'maih tơ'bơ̆p pơtao Sôlômôn, wă mơ̆ng đon gơh hơgei đei đơ̆ng Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn lăm kơ̆l đon tơchĕng sư.

English: Each man brought his present: articles of silver and gold, garments, armor, spices, horses, and mules, at a set rate year by year.
Bahnar: Lăm rim sơnăm, lu sư năm tơ'bơ̆p chĕp ba tơmam pơyơ̆r, tơmam đe pơm păng hu maih, hơbĕn ao, tơmam tơblah tơmam 'bâu phu, aseh păng aseh iĕ.

English: Solomon had four thousand stalls for horses and chariots, and twelve thousand horsemen whom he stationed in the chariot cities and with the king at Jerusalem.
Bahnar: Pơtao Sôlômôn đei puăn-rơbâu tŏ hơdrong aseh păng hnam tah gre aseh, kư̆m đei mơjĭt-'bar rơbâu aseh, tơ lăm lu pơlei tah gre aseh păng tah hơdai hăm sư tơ lăm pơlei tih Jêrusalem.

English: So he reigned over all the kings from the River to the land of the Philistines, as far as the border of Egypt.
Bahnar: Sư pơgơ̆r lu pơtao, iŏk đơ̆ng đak Krong Ơphrat truh tơ char Philistin păng dĭng truh tơ hơdral hăm char Êyiptơ.

English: The king made silver as common in Jerusalem as stones, and he made cedar trees as abundant as the sycamores which are in the lowland.
Bahnar: Lăm pơlei Jêrusalem pơtao lăng kơ hu thoi tơmo hơga păng 'long hơngo hla iĕ lơ thoi 'long kơphŏk chăt lăm groi Sephela.

English: And they brought horses to Solomon from Egypt and from all lands.
Bahnar: Pơtao Sôlômôn răt aseh đơ̆ng dêh Êyiptơ păng đơ̆ng dêh char nai.

English: Now the rest of the acts of Solomon, first and last, are they not written in the book of Nathan the prophet, in the prophecy of Ahijah the Shilonite, and in the visions of Iddo the seer concerning Jeroboam the son of Nebat?
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng tơdrong jang Sôlômôn pơm pơjing đơ̆ng blŭng truh tơ tôch đei chih tơ lăm sơ̆p hla bơar hơ'mon Nathan bơngai khan lê̆ adrol, lăm hla bơar Ahija bơngai khan lê̆ adrol, bơngai Silô, chih lăm sơ̆p hla bơar Iđô, 'bok mă đei khan lê̆ adrol gah tơdrong Jêrôbôam, kon drŏ-nglo Nêbat.

English: Solomon reigned in Jerusalem over all Israel forty years.
Bahnar: Sôlômôn pơgơ̆r đĭ-đăng bơngai Isơrael lăm pơlei tih Jêrusalem lăm puăn-jĭt sơnăm.

English: Then Solomon rested with his fathers, and was buried in the City of David his father. And Rehoboam his son reigned in his place.
Bahnar: Sôlômôn lôch oei hơdai hăm lu 'bok sư, đe 'bŭ lăm pơlei Đawit, 'bă sư; Rêhôbôam, kon drŏ-nglo sư iung pơm pơtao pơgơ̆r pơtrơp sư.

English: And Rehoboam went to Shechem, for all Israel had gone to Shechem to make him king.
Bahnar: Rêhôbôam năm tơ pơlei Sichem, yua kơ đĭ-đăng lu bơngai Isơrael truh boih tơ Pơlei Sichem wă pôk sư pơm pơtao.

English: So it happened, when Jeroboam the son of Nebat heard it (he was in Egypt, where he had fled from the presence of King Solomon), that Jeroboam returned from Egypt.
Bahnar: Lăp Jêrôbôam, kon drŏ-nglo Nêbat kơtơ̆ng tơdrong noh, sư oei oei lăm dêh char Êyiptơ yua kơ sư kơdâu ôn kơ Sôlômôn, na sư wih brŏk đơ̆ng char Êyiptơ.

English: Then they sent for him and called him. And Jeroboam and all Israel came and spoke to Rehoboam, saying
Bahnar: Đe wơh bơngai năm krao sư; na Jêrôbôam păng lu bơngai Isơrael năm khan kơ Rêhôbôam.

English: “Your father made our yoke heavy; now therefore, lighten the burdensome service of your father and his heavy yoke which he put on us, and we will serve you.”
Bahnar: “'Bă ih tơpŭ ăn kơ lu nhôn tơdrong jang 'long ăt trăp dêh, dang ei ăn kơ lu nhôn pŭ 'long ăt phiơl 'biơ̆ bĕ, na lu nhôn gô bơ̆jang kơ ih.”

English: So he said to them, “Come back to me after three days.” And the people departed.
Bahnar: Sư tơl đe noh khan: “Pă pêng năr, lu iĕm năm hơlơ̆k tơ inh dơ̆ng.” Lu kon pơlei wih brŏk.

English: Then King Rehoboam consulted the elders who stood before his father Solomon while he still lived, saying, “How do you advise me to answer these people?”
Bahnar: Pơtao Rêhôbôam khan pơđâu hăm lu kră bơngai mă juăt kơ jang hăm 'bă sư Sôlômôn kơplah oei arih: “Lu iĕm tơchĕng inh athei pơma păng drơ̆ng lu kon pơlei âu thoi yơ?”

English: And they spoke to him, saying, “If you are kind to these people, and please them, and speak good words to them, they will be your servants forever.”
Bahnar: Lu kră bơngai wei-lăng kon pơlei khan kơ pơtao thoi âu: “Tơdah ih pơm hiôk kơ kon pơlei pơla, oei sa 'lơ̆ng hơiă hăm lu sư, đei jơhngơ̆m hiôk pơma drơ̆ng rơngơp hăm lu sư, lei lu kon pơlei pơla âu bơ̆jang awih awăn kơ ih ling-lang.”

English: But he rejected the advice which the elders had given him, and consulted the young men who had grown up with him, who stood before him.
Bahnar: Mă-lei Rêhôbôam ưh kơ kiơ̆ ôh nơ̆r lu kră đei pơđâu, na chă đon pơđâu hăm lu bơngai kră mơlôh 'lŏ sư pơhnŏng kơchŏng sư bơhnơr, mă oei bơ̆jang kơ sư.

English: And he said to them, “What advice do you give? How should we answer this people who have spoken to me, saying, ‘Lighten the yoke which your father put on us’?”
Bahnar: Pơtao jet: “Lu kon pơlei âu apinh ăn kơ lu nhôn tôi 'long ăt phiơl 'biơ̆ đơ̆ng 'bă inh ăn kơ lu nhôn trăp dêh; lei na iĕm tơchĕng lăng ăn kơ inh wă pơm liơ tơl hăm lu sư?”

English: Then the young men who had grown up with him spoke to him, saying, “Thus you should speak to the people who have spoken to you, saying, ‘Your father made our yoke heavy, but you make it lighter on us’—thus you shall say to them: ‘My little finger shall be thicker than my father’s waist!
Bahnar: Lu kră mơlôh, 'lơ̆p 'lŏ sư hơdai tơl sư: “Ih athei tơl lu kon pơlei lu bơngai mă apinh ih khan: “'Bă ih ăn kơ lu nhôn jang thoi tôi 'long ăt trăp dêh, apinh Ih ăn kơ lu nhôn tôi phiơl 'biơ̆; ih tơl lu sư. Hơnglâu dĕng inh tih hloh kơ kơiĕng 'bă inh.

English: And now, whereas my father put a heavy yoke on you, I will add to your yoke; my father chastised you with whips, but I will chastise you with scourges!’ ”
Bahnar: Na, 'bă inh ăn kơ lu iĕm tôi 'long ăt trăp dang noh boih, na inh gô ăn kơ iĕm tôi trăp hloh kơ noh dơ̆ng; 'bă inh đei teh phak lu iĕm hăm sơnguĕt, inh gô phak lu iĕm hăm hơguăt.

English: So Jeroboam and all the people came to Rehoboam on the third day, as the king had directed, saying, “Come back to me the third day.”
Bahnar: Pêng năr đơ̆ng rŏng, Jêrôbôam păng đĭ kon pơlei năm dơ̆ng tơ Rêhôbôam kiơ̆ thoi pơtao đei pơkă pă pêng năr athei năm hơlơ̆k tơ inh âu dơ̆ng.

English: Then the king answered them roughly. King Rehoboam rejected the advice of the elders
Bahnar: Pơtao Rêhôbôam tơl kon pơlei hăm nơ̆r arăng, ưh pă wă kiơ̆ boih kơ nơ̆r lu kră pơđâu

English: and he spoke to them according to the advice of the young men, saying, “My father made your yoke heavy, but I will add to it; my father chastised you with whips, but I will chastise you with scourges!”
Bahnar: Kiơ̆ kơ nơ̆r lu kră mơlôh pơđâu, na pơtao khan kơ lu kon pơlei: 'Bă inh ăn kơ lu iĕm tôi 'long ăt trăp dang noh, inh gô ăn kơ lu iĕm tôi 'long ăt trăp hloh kơ noh dơ̆ng, 'bă inh teh phak lu iĕm hăm sơnguĕt, inh gô teh phak iĕm hăm hơguăt.”

English: So the king did not listen to the people; for the turn of events was from God, that the LORD might fulfill His word, which He had spoken by the hand of Ahijah the Shilonite to Jeroboam the son of Nebat.
Bahnar: Thoi noh, pơtao ưh kơ wă mơ̆ng kiơ̆ kon pơlei, yua kơ tơdrong noh trŏ thoi Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei khan wă kơ pơsĭt kơ nơ̆r Kră Yang đei khan kơ Ahija bơngai pơlei Silô khan kơ Jêrôbôam kon drŏ-nglo Nêbat.

English: Now when all Israel saw that the king did not listen to them, the people answered the king, saying: “What share have we in David? We have no inheritance in the son of Jesse. Every man to your tents, O Israel! Now see to your own house, O David!” So all Israel departed to their tents.
Bahnar: Wă đĭ-đăng kon pơlei Isơrael 'bôh pơtao Rêhôbôam ưh pă iŏk nơ̆r lu sư boih, lu sư tơl pơtao. “Lu nhôn hăm đei kiơ lăm Đawit? Lu nhôn hăm đei kiơ hăm kon drŏ-nglo Jese Ơ kon pơlei Isơrael wih brŏk bĕ tơ hnam lu iĕm. Ơ Đawit lăng bĕ hnam ih kơdih,” Na đĭ-đăng kon pơlei wih đĭ tơ hnam lu sư.

English: But Rehoboam reigned over the children of Israel who dwelt in the cities of Judah.
Bahnar: Mă-lei kon pơlei Isơrael mă oei lăm lu pơlei Juđa, Rêhôbôam oei pơgơ̆r lu sư.

English: Then King Rehoboam sent Hadoram, who was in charge of revenue; but the children of Israel stoned him with stones, and he died. Therefore King Rehoboam mounted his chariot in haste to flee to Jerusalem.
Bahnar: Pơtao Rêhôbôam wơh Adôniram, bơngai wei-lăng pơgŏ lu bơngai jang trăp, năm tơ kon pơlei Isơrael. Kon pơlei Isơrael klơ̆m tơmo pơlôch Sư. Pơtao Rêhôbôam kơdâu iŏk gre aseh năm kơdâu ôn tơ pơlei Jêrusalem.

English: So Israel has been in rebellion against the house of David to this day.
Bahnar: Lei na adrĕch Isơrael areh blah hăm adrĕch Đawit dĭng truh tơ dang ei.

English: Now when Rehoboam came to Jerusalem, he assembled from the house of Judah and Benjamin one hundred and eighty thousand chosen men who were warriors, to fight against Israel, that he might restore the kingdom to Rehoboam.
Bahnar: Rêhôbôam wih brŏk tơ Jêrusalem, akŭm pơđĭ lu linh bơngai Juđa păng Bênjamin, đei minh-hrĕng tơhngam-jĭt rơbâu 'nu wă tơblah hăm lu bơngai Isơrael, wă kơ pơdrâu iŏk dêh char ăn kơ Rêhôbôam dơ̆ng.

English: But the word of the LORD came to Shemaiah the man of God, saying
Bahnar: Mă-lei đei nơ̆r Kră Yang khan kơ Sêmaia, bơngai Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: “Speak to Rehoboam the son of Solomon, king of Judah, and to all Israel in Judah and Benjamin, saying
Bahnar: “Khan bĕ kơ Rêhôbôam kon drŏ-nglo Sôlômôn pơtao đe Juđa păng đĭ-đăng lu bơngai Isơrael oei lăm dêh char Juđa hăm Bênjamin.

English: ‘Thus says the LORD: “You shall not go up or fight against your brethren! Let every man return to his house, for this thing is from Me.” ’ ” Therefore they obeyed the words of the LORD, and turned back from attacking Jeroboam.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan thoi âu: Lu iĕm lê̆ kơ năm tơblah hăm lu 'nhŏng oh iĕm ôh, wih brŏk tơ hnam iĕm bĕ, yua kơ tơdrong 'nâu lĕch đơ̆ng Inh.” Thoi noh lu sư chu kơ nơ̆r Kră Yang khan, wih brŏk kơdih ưh kơ đei năm tơblah hăm Jêrôbôam ôh.

English: So Rehoboam dwelt in Jerusalem, and built cities for defense in Judah.
Bahnar: Rêhôbôam oei lăm pơlei Jêrusalem pơdơ̆ng pơjing pơlei tih kơjăp lăm char Juđa.

English: And he built Bethlehem, Etam, Tekoa
Bahnar: Sư man pơdơ̆ng pơlei Betlehem, Êtam, Têkôa

English: Beth Zur, Sochoh, Adullam
Bahnar: pơlei Bêt Sur, Sôkô, Ađulam

English: Gath, Mareshah, Ziph
Bahnar: pơlei Gat Marêsa, pơlei Sip

English: Adoraim, Lachish, Azekah
Bahnar: pơlei Adôraim, Lakis, Asêka

English: Zorah, Aijalon, and Hebron, which are in Judah and Benjamin, fortified cities.
Bahnar: Pơlei Sôra, Aijalôn păng pơlei Hêbrôn. Lu pơlei mă đei kơđông linh kơjăp lăm char Juđa păng lăm char Bênjamin.

English: And he fortified the strongholds, and put captains in them, and stores of food, oil, and wine.
Bahnar: Sư pơm kơđông rai kơjăp tơ noh, ăn kơ lu yŏng linh oei lăm noh, tah mong tơmam sa phe 'ba, đak rơmă ôliwơ păng đak sik plei hơmu

English: Also in every city he put shields and spears, and made them very strong, having Judah and Benjamin on his side.
Bahnar: Tơ lăm rim pơlei sư đei tah đao hơlă, khêl wă pơm ăn kơ pơlei noh kơjăp tơpă, lei sư wei pơgơ̆r char Juđa hăm char Bênjamin.

English: And from all their territories the priests and the Levites who were in all Israel took their stand with him.
Bahnar: Lu 'bok soi hăm lu bơngai Lêwi đơ̆ng jơ̆p-jang lăm char Isơrael, wih brŏk kiơ̆ Rêhôbôam

English: For the Levites left their common-lands and their possessions and came to Judah and Jerusalem, for Jeroboam and his sons had rejected them from serving as priests to the LORD.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai Lêwi mă achăng lê̆ pơlei hăm teh jang sa lu sư năm oei tơ char Juđa păng pơlei tih Jêrusalem, yua kơ Jêrôbôam hăm lu kon drŏ-nglo sư pơpuh lu sư, ưh pă ăn kơ lu sư pơm 'bok soi jang kơ Kră Yang dơ̆ng.

English: Then he appointed for himself priests for the high places, for the demons, and the calf idols which he had made.
Bahnar: Jêrôbôam chă pôk pơjing lu 'bok soi sư kơdih tơ lu anih kơjung, kơ lu rup yang sư man noh bơbe tơno păng kon rơmo

English: And after the Levites left, those from all the tribes of Israel, such as set their heart to seek the LORD God of Israel, came to Jerusalem to sacrifice to the LORD God of their fathers.
Bahnar: Lăm adrĕch bơngai Isơrael, bu đei jơhngơ̆m chă Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Isơrael, lu sư kiơ̆ lu bơngai Lêwi, năm tơ Jêrusalem wă pơyơ̆r tơmam soi ăn kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu 'bok sư.

English: So they strengthened the kingdom of Judah, and made Rehoboam the son of Solomon strong for three years, because they walked in the way of David and Solomon for three years.
Bahnar: Lăm pêng sơnăm sư bơwei char Juđa kơjăp tơgŭm Rêhôbôam, kon drŏ-nglo Sôlômôn, jing pran kơtang; tơpă lăm pêng sơnăm noh lu sư kiơ̆ trong Đawit păng Sôlômôn.

English: Then Rehoboam took for himself as wife Mahalath the daughter of Jerimoth the son of David, and of Abihail the daughter of Eliah the son of Jesse.
Bahnar: Rêhôbôam oei kơ Mahalat kon adruh Jêrimôt, sâu Đawit; sư kư̆m oei dơ̆ng kơ Abihai, kon adruh Êliap, sâu Jese.

English: And she bore him children: Jeush, Shamariah, and Zaham.
Bahnar: Akăn sư tơpŭ ăn kơ sư lu kon drŏ-nglo, Jêrus, Sêmaria păng Saham.

English: After her he took Maachah the granddaughter of Absalom; and she bore him Abijah, Attai, Ziza, and Shelomith.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng rŏng, sư kư̆m rôp oei dơ̆ng Maaka kon adruh Apsalôm, akăn sư tơpŭ ăn kơ sư lu kon drŏ-nglo noh Abija, Attai, Sisa păng Sêlômit.

English: Now Rehoboam loved Maachah the granddaughter of Absalom more than all his wives and his concubines; for he took eighteen wives and sixty concubines, and begot twenty-eight sons and sixty daughters.
Bahnar: Rêhôbôam 'mêm kơ Maaka kon adruh Apsalôm hloh kơ lu akăn sư nai; sư đei mơjĭt-tơhngam 'nu akăn tơm păng tơdrâu-jĭt 'nu akăn kơnhŏng, Sư đei 'bar-jĭt tơhngam 'nu kon drŏ-nglo păng tơdrâu-jĭt 'nu kon drŏ-kăn.

English: And Rehoboam appointed Abijah the son of Maachah as chief, to be leader among his brothers; for he intended to make him king.
Bahnar: Rêhôbôam pôk ăn Abija kon drŏ-nglo Maaka pơm yŏng kơdră kơ lu 'nhŏng oh sư, rơih wă ăn Abija pơtrơp pơm pơtao.

English: He dealt wisely, and dispersed some of his sons throughout all the territories of Judah and Benjamin, to every fortified city; and he gave them provisions in abundance. He also sought many wives for them.
Bahnar: Rêhôbôam sư hơgei klah song ăn kơ lu kon drŏ-nglo sư oei tơ jơ̆p-jang kơ char Juđa păng char Bênjamin, tơ lăm lu pơlei kơjăp, asong ăn kơ lu sư tơmam sa rơkah rơkai; chă ăn kơ lu sư akăn lơ.

English: Now it came to pass, when Rehoboam had established the kingdom and had strengthened himself, that he forsook the law of the LORD, and all Israel along with him.
Bahnar: Wă Rêhôbôam pơgơ̆r dêh char sư pran kơjăp boih, na sư păng lu bơngai Isơrael kiơ̆ Sư achăng lê̆ ưh pă kiơ̆ khôi juăt Kră Yang.

English: And it happened in the fifth year of King Rehoboam that Shishak king of Egypt came up against Jerusalem, because they had transgressed against the LORD
Bahnar: Lăm sơnăm mă pơđăm lăm chăl pơtao Rêhôbôam, yua kơ lu sư đei pơm yoch hăm Kră Yang, na Sisăk, pơtao đe Êyiptơ, tŏk blah Jêrusalem
