English: with twelve hundred chariots, sixty thousand horsemen, and people without number who came with him out of Egypt—the Lubim and the Sukkiim and the Ethiopians.
Bahnar: chĕp ba minh-rơbâu 'bar-hrĕng gre aseh păng tơdrâu-jĭt rơbâu 'nu linh hao aseh; kư̆m đei lu linh đơ̆ng char Libia, Sukki păng char Êthiôpi tŏk hơdai đơ̆ng Êyiptơ, lơ tơpă.

English: And he took the fortified cities of Judah and came to Jerusalem.
Bahnar: Sisăk đei blah iŏk lu pơlei tih kơjăp lăm char Juđa dĭng truh tơ pơlei tih Jêrusalem.

English: Then Shemaiah the prophet came to Rehoboam and the leaders of Judah, who were gathered together in Jerusalem because of Shishak, and said to them, “Thus says the LORD: ‘You have forsaken Me, and therefore I also have left you in the hand of Shishak.’ ”
Bahnar: Sêmaia 'bok khan lê̆ adrol năm tơ Rêhôbôam păng lu bơngai pơgơ̆r char Juđa oei akŭm lăm pơlei Jêrusalem wă kơdâu ôn hli kơ Sisăk păng khan: Kră Yang khan thoi âu: “Lu iĕm achăng lê̆ Inh, lei na Inh kư̆m achăng lê̆ lu iĕm lăm ti Sisăk,”

English: So the leaders of Israel and the king humbled themselves; and they said, “The LORD is righteous.”
Bahnar: Kră pơgơ̆r bơngai Isơrael păng pơtao lu sư tơjur akâu tơbral păng khan: “Kră Yang 'lơ̆ng tơpăt.”

English: Now when the LORD saw that they humbled themselves, the word of the LORD came to Shemaiah, saying, “They have humbled themselves; therefore I will not destroy them, but I will grant them some deliverance. My wrath shall not be poured out on Jerusalem by the hand of Shishak.
Bahnar: Wă Kră Yang 'bôh lu sư tơbral đei hloi nơ̆r Kră Yang khan kơ Samaia thoi âu: “Yua kơ lu sư tơjur akâu tơbral boih, Inh ưh pă pơlôch lu sư; mă-lei wă jah tơgŭm dŏng lu sư Inh ưh pă yua ti Sisăk tuh tơdrong Inh hil tơ pơlei Jêrusalem dơ̆ng.

English: Nevertheless they will be his servants, that they may distinguish My service from the service of the kingdoms of the nations.”
Bahnar: Ăn kơ lu sư chu Sisăk, wă kơ lu Sư băt chu yom kơ Inh pha kơ chu kơ lu pơtao kơpal teh âu.

English: So Shishak king of Egypt came up against Jerusalem, and took away the treasures of the house of the LORD and the treasures of the king’s house; he took everything. He also carried away the gold shields which Solomon had made.
Bahnar: Sisăk pơtao đe Êyiptơ, tŏk blah Jêrusalem, iŏk đĭ tơmam gĭt đơ̆ng lăm hnam Kră Yang păng đơ̆ng lăm hnam pơtao; kư̆m iŏk lu khêl maih đơ̆ng Sôlômôn pơm.

English: Then King Rehoboam made bronze shields in their place, and committed them to the hands of the captains of the guard, who guarded the doorway of the king’s house.
Bahnar: Pơtao Rêhôbôam pơm dơ̆ng khêl hăm kong păng pơjao ăn kơ lu yŏng pơgơ̆r gak wei-lăng 'măng jang hnam pơtao.

English: And whenever the king entered the house of the LORD, the guard would go and bring them out; then they would take them back into the guardroom.
Bahnar: Rim wơ̆t mưh pơtao wă mơ̆t lăm hnam Kră Yang, na lu linh gah 'măng năm sơng chĕp khêl noh, đang boih tah pơdrâu lê̆ khêl noh tơ anih lu bơngai gak 'măng.

English: When he humbled himself, the wrath of the LORD turned from him, so as not to destroy him completely; and things also went well in Judah.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng pơtao băt tơjur akâu tơbral, na Kră Yang, ưh pă hil ưh kơ đei pơrăm đĭ; tơpă kư̆m đei tơdrong 'lơ̆ng mơ̆n lăm char Juđa.

English: Thus King Rehoboam strengthened himself in Jerusalem and reigned. Now Rehoboam was forty-one years old when he became king; and he reigned seventeen years in Jerusalem, the city which the LORD had chosen out of all the tribes of Israel, to put His name there. His mother’s name was Naamah, an Ammonitess.
Bahnar: Thoi noh pơtao Rêhôbôam pơm kơ sư kơdih kơjăp oei lăm pơlei Jêrusalem, Rêhôbôam 'nao puăn-jĭt mônh sơnăm kơplah sư pơm pơtao, sư pơgơ̆r lăm mơjĭt-tơpơh sơnăm lăm pơlei Jêrusalem, pơlei mă Kră Yang đei rơih iŏk đơ̆ng lăm adrĕch Isơrael, wă 'măn anăn Sư tơ noh; mĕ Rêhôbôam anăn Naama, bơngai Ammôn.

English: And he did evil, because he did not prepare his heart to seek the LORD.
Bahnar: Rêhôbôam pơm kơnê̆, yua kơ sư ưh kơ chơchă Kră Yang ôh lăm jơhngơ̆m sư.

English: The acts of Rehoboam, first and last, are they not written in the book of Shemaiah the prophet, and of Iddo the seer concerning genealogies? And there were wars between Rehoboam and Jeroboam all their days.
Bahnar: Dôm tơdrong jang Rêhôbôam pơm đơ̆ng blŭng-a truh tơ tôch đei chih lăm sơ̆p hla bơar Sêmaia bơngai khan lê̆ adrol păng Iđô bơngai roi lê̆ adrol chih, gah adrĕch 'bok sư Rêhôbôam păng Jêrôbôam tơblah băl hơnơ̆ng đĭ chăl bre sư pơgơ̆r.

English: So Rehoboam rested with his fathers, and was buried in the City of David. Then Abijah his son reigned in his place.
Bahnar: Rêhôbôam lôch pơdơh hăm lu 'bok yă sư, 'bŭ lăm pơlei Đawit; Abija kon drŏ-nglo sư pơm pơtao pơgơ̆r pơtrơp đơ̆ng sư.

English: In the eighteenth year of King Jeroboam, Abijah became king over Judah.
Bahnar: Lăm sơnăm mă mơjĭt-tơhngam chăl pơtao Jêrôbôam, Abija pơm pơtao char Juđa.

English: He reigned three years in Jerusalem. His mother’s name was Michaiah the daughter of Uriel of Gibeah. And there was war between Abijah and Jeroboam.
Bahnar: Sư pơgơ̆r pêng sơnăm lăm pơlei tih Jêrusalem. Mĕ sư anăn Maaka kon drŏ-kăn Uriel đơ̆ng pơlei Gibêah. Đei tơdrong tơblah Abija hăm Jêrôbôam.

English: Abijah set the battle in order with an army of valiant warriors, four hundred thousand choice men. Jeroboam also drew up in battle formation against him with eight hundred thousand choice men, mighty men of valor.
Bahnar: Abija năm tơblah chĕp ba linh, puăn-hrĕng rơbâu linh nuih pran kơtang; gah Jêrôbôam năm tơblah hăm sư chĕp ba tơhngam-hrĕng rơbâu linh, 'nâu lu linh nuih pran kơtang

English: Then Abijah stood on Mount Zemaraim, which is in the mountains of Ephraim, and said, “Hear me, Jeroboam and all Israel
Bahnar: Abija sư dơ̆ng tơ kơpal Kông Sêmaraim lăm tơring kông groi Êphraim, na khan: “Ơ Jêrôbôam păng đĭ-đăng bơngai Isơrael mơ̆ng bĕ!

English: Should you not know that the LORD God of Israel gave the dominion over Israel to David forever, to him and his sons, by a covenant of salt?
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng tơdrong pơgơ̆p 'boh, Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Isơrael đei jao boih dêh char Isơrael kơ Đawit păng lu kon drŏ-nglo sư ling-lang hlŏng hloi boih, lu iĕm ưh kơ băt hă?

English: Yet Jeroboam the son of Nebat, the servant of Solomon the son of David, rose up and rebelled against his lord.
Bahnar: Mă-lei Jêrôbôam kon drŏ-nglo Nêbat bơngai jang kơ Sôlômôn, kon drŏ-nglo Đawit, iung tơblah hăm yŏng tơ'ngla sư kơdih

English: Then worthless rogues gathered to him, and strengthened themselves against Rehoboam the son of Solomon, when Rehoboam was young and inexperienced and could not withstand them.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai kơnê̆ kư̆ kă năm kiơ̆ ih; tơblah hăm Rêhôbôam, kon drŏ-nglo Sôlômôn; Rêhôbôam; sư oei mơlôh, ưh kơ kĕ tơblah hăm ih.

English: And now you think to withstand the kingdom of the LORD, which is in the hand of the sons of David; and you are a great multitude, and with you are the gold calves which Jeroboam made for you as gods.
Bahnar: Na dang ei lu iĕm tơchĕng khan kĕ mơ̆n hă tơblah hăm char mă Kră Yang đei jao ăn boih kơ lu kon Đawit? Mă khan lu iĕm đei linh lơ chĕp ba rup man rơmo hăm maih mă Jêrôbôam đei man pơm yang iĕm.

English: Have you not cast out the priests of the LORD, the sons of Aaron, and the Levites, and made for yourselves priests, like the peoples of other lands, so that whoever comes to consecrate himself with a young bull and seven rams may be a priest of things that are not gods?
Bahnar: Hăm trŏ lu iĕm pơpuh boih lu 'bok soi Kră Yang, kon sâu Arôn păng lu bơngai Lêwi? Lu iĕm pôk pơjing lu 'bok soi kơdih iĕm kiơ̆ thoi lu dêh char nai pơm; kư̆ kơ bơngai bu rôp minh pôm rơmo dăm păng tơpơh tŏ bơbe tơno pơyơ̆r wă apinh pơm 'bok soi na gơh pơm 'bok soi hloi soi kơ yang kư̆ kă.

English: But as for us, the LORD is our God, and we have not forsaken Him; and the priests who minister to the LORD are the sons of Aaron, and the Levites attend to their duties.
Bahnar: Gah lu nhôn, Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu bơ̆n, lu nhôn ưh kơ đei achăng lê̆ Sư; lu 'bok soi bơ̆jang kơ Kră Yang tă kơ kon sâu Arôn păng lu bơngai Lêwi bơ̆jang tơdrong jang lu sư.

English: And they burn to the LORD every morning and every evening burnt sacrifices and sweet incense; they also set the showbread in order on the pure gold table, and the lampstand of gold with its lamps to burn every evening; for we keep the command of the LORD our God, but you have forsaken Him.
Bahnar: Rim pơgê hrôih păng kơsơ̆ lu sư soh pơyơ̆r tơmam soi 'buh păng pơgang 'bâu phu ăn kơ Kră Yang; lu sư kư̆m dan 'bĕng 'lơ̆ng rơgoh kơpal gơ'bang rơgoh păng kư̆m tơ̆k ŭnh kơđeng tơ rim jơ̆ng kơđeng maih wă kơ sư khơ̆ng kiơ̆ kơmăng. Lu nhôn pơm kiơ̆ nơ̆r Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu bơ̆n bơtho khan, gah lu iĕm achăng lê̆ Sư boih.

English: Now look, God Himself is with us as our head, and His priests with sounding trumpets to sound the alarm against you. O children of Israel, do not fight against the LORD God of your fathers, for you shall not prosper!”
Bahnar: Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei oei hơdai nhôn, pơgơ̆r lu nhôn, lu 'bok soi Kră Yang chĕp keng hlôm re wă lĕch tơblah hăm lu iĕm. Ơ lu kon sâu Isơrael! 'Nĕ kơ tơblah hăm Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu 'bok yă iĕm, ưh kơ kĕ jei iĕm ôh”

English: But Jeroboam caused an ambush to go around behind them; so they were in front of Judah, and the ambush was behind them.
Bahnar: Jêrôbôam ăn boih linh sư răp wă blah tơ gah rŏng; thoi noh lu sư dơ̆ng gah anăp lu linh Juđa, mơ'nah răp blah tơ gah rŏng lu linh Juđa.

English: And when Judah looked around, to their surprise the battle line was at both front and rear; and they cried out to the LORD, and the priests sounded the trumpets.
Bahnar: Wă lu linh Juđa 'bôh đei lu linh ayăt tơ gah anăp păng tơ gah rŏng, na lu sư ôr krao Kră Yang. Lu 'bok soi hlôm keng.

English: Then the men of Judah gave a shout; and as the men of Judah shouted, it happened that God struck Jeroboam and all Israel before Abijah and Judah.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai Juđa jreo năm tơ anăp tơblah. Kơplah lu kon pơlei Juđa jreo năm tơblah, Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei blah pơrăm Jêrôbôam păng đĭ-đăng linh Isơrael 'bơ̆t anăp pơtao Abija păng bơngai Juđa.

English: And the children of Israel fled before Judah, and God delivered them into their hand.
Bahnar: Kon pơlei Isơrael kơdâu kơ kon pơlei Juđa păng Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei jao lu kon pơlei Isơrael lăm ti lu kon pơlei Juđa.

English: Then Abijah and his people struck them with a great slaughter; so five hundred thousand choice men of Israel fell slain.
Bahnar: Abija păng lu linh sư blah pơrăm đĭ lu bơngai Isơrael tih dêh đei pơđăm-hrĕng rơbâu linh nuih kơtang Isơrael lôch

English: Thus the children of Israel were subdued at that time; and the children of Judah prevailed, because they relied on the LORD God of their fathers.
Bahnar: Thoi noh, kơplah noh, lu linh Isơrael thuơ răm, jei lu linh păng kon pơlei Juđa, yua kơ lu sư gơnang kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei yă 'bok lu sư.

English: And Abijah pursued Jeroboam and took cities from him: Bethel with its villages, Jeshanah with its villages, and Ephrain with its villages.
Bahnar: Abija druh blah Jêrôbôam păng blah iŏk lu pơlei tih Bethel păng lu pơlei iĕ sư pơlei Jesana păng lu pơlei iĕ sư, pơlei tih Êphrôn păng lu pơlei iĕ sư.

English: So Jeroboam did not recover strength again in the days of Abijah; and the LORD struck him, and he died.
Bahnar: Kơplah chăl Abija oei arih, Jêrôbôam ưh pă đei pran dơ̆ng boih; Kră Yang pơrăm sư, na sư lôch.

English: But Abijah grew mighty, married fourteen wives, and begot twenty-two sons and sixteen daughters.
Bahnar: Gah Abija rai pran kơtang ling-lang, sư oei kơ mơjĭt-puăn 'nu akăn, tơpŭ kơ sư đei 'bar-jĭt 'bar 'nu kon drŏ-nglo păng mơjĭt-tơdrâu 'nu kon drŏ-kăn.

English: Now the rest of the acts of Abijah, his ways, and his sayings are written in the annals of the prophet Iddo.
Bahnar: Lu tơdrong jang nai mă Abija jang, lu tơdrong sư pơm păng nơ̆r sư pơma, đei chih răk lăm sơ̆p hla bơar hơ'mon Iđô bơngai khan lê̆ adrol.

English: So Abijah rested with his fathers, and they buried him in the City of David. Then Asa his son reigned in his place. In his days the land was quiet for ten years.
Bahnar: Abija lôch pơdơh oei hơdai hăm lu 'bok yă sư đe 'bŭ sư lăm pơlei Đawit, Asa kon drŏ-nglo sư iung pơgơ̆r pơtrơp sư. Lăm chăl Asa pơgơ̆r char sư đei hiôk-hian mơjĭt sơnăm.

English: Asa did what was good and right in the eyes of the LORD his God
Bahnar: Asa oei arih 'lơ̆ng păng pơm tơpăt 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei sư

English: for he removed the altars of the foreign gods and the high places, and broke down the sacred pillars and cut down the wooden images.
Bahnar: Sư yuih hŭt lê̆ đĭ chơnang soi kơkuh kơ lu yang bơngai tơmoi păng tơ lăm anih kơjung, sư teh pơchah đĭ lu jrăng gơ̆ng soi păng kăl tơlơ̆ lê̆ rup yang drŏ-kăn Asêra.

English: He commanded Judah to seek the LORD God of their fathers, and to observe the law and the commandment.
Bahnar: Sư athei bơngai Juđa chă bĕ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei 'bok yă lu sư, kư̆m athei pơm kiơ̆ khôi juăt păng nơ̆r Kră Yang tơtă.

English: He also removed the high places and the incense altars from all the cities of Judah, and the kingdom was quiet under him.
Bahnar: Sư kư̆m hŭt lê̆ đĭ lu jrăng gơ̆ng soi kơkuh kơ yang tơ anih kơjung păng chơnang soi đơ̆ng rim pơlei lăm char Juđa; dêh char sư pơgơ̆r đei hiôk-hian.

English: And he built fortified cities in Judah, for the land had rest; he had no war in those years, because the LORD had given him rest.
Bahnar: Sư đei man pơjing lu pơlei kơjăp lăm char Juđa, yua kơ lăm dôm sơnăm sư pơgơ̆r dêh char sư đei hiôk-hian ưh kơ đei tơblah, Kră Yang ăn hiôk-hian kơ sư.

English: Therefore he said to Judah, “Let us build these cities and make walls around them, and towers, gates, and bars, while the land is yet before us, because we have sought the LORD our God; we have sought Him, and He has given us rest on every side.” So they built and prospered.
Bahnar: Sư khan kơ kon pơlei Juđa: “Bĕ bơ̆n pơdơ̆ng tơiung pơlei tih kơjăp, man dur tăp dăr, pơm hnam thôt gak, pơm 'măng jang, 'long chơkăl; char 'nâu oei dêh char bơ̆n, yua kơ lu bơ̆n chă Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu bơ̆n; lu bơ̆n chă boih Sư, na Sư ăn kơ bơ̆n đei hiôk-hian tăp dăr.” Lu sư tơiung pơdơ̆ng pơlei keh păng arih sa jơnap.

English: And Asa had an army of three hundred thousand from Judah who carried shields and spears, and from Benjamin two hundred and eighty thousand men who carried shields and drew bows; all these were mighty men of valor.
Bahnar: Asa đei pêng-hrĕng rơbâu linh đơ̆ng bơngai Juđa đei khêl tih păng tơju; đei 'bar-rơbâu 'nu linh đơ̆ng bơngai Bênjamin chĕp khêl iĕ păng hră; đĭ-đăng lu sư tă kơ linh nuih kơtang ngăl.

English: Then Zerah the Ethiopian came out against them with an army of a million men and three hundred chariots, and he came to Mareshah.
Bahnar: Sêra, bơngai Êthiôpi năm blah bơngai Juđa chông ba minh-rơbâu rơbâu linh păng pêng-hrĕng tŏ gre aseh, lu sư năm truh tơ pơlei Marêsa.

English: So Asa went out against him, and they set the troops in battle array in the Valley of Zephathah at Mareshah.
Bahnar: Asa năm sơng tơ'bơ̆p sư, săp linh năm tơblah tơ lăm thŭng Sêphatha jê̆ pơlei Marêsa.

English: And Asa cried out to the LORD his God, and said, “LORD, it is nothing for You to help, whether with many or with those who have no power; help us, O LORD our God, for we rest on You, and in Your name we go against this multitude. O LORD, You are our God; do not let man prevail against You!”
Bahnar: Asa krao apinh Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei sư khan: “Ơ Kră Yang, ưh kơ đei bu thoi Ih tơgŭm lu bơngai tơrăn kĕ jei đơ̆ng bơngai pran; Ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei nhôn, apinh Ih dŏng tơgŭm lu nhôn, lu nhôn gơnang kơ Ih; nhôn yua hăm anăn Ih na năm blah lu bơngai linh lơ âu. Ơ Kră Yang! Ih boih Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu nhôn; 'nĕ ăn kơ kon bơngai jei hloh kơ Ih”

English: So the LORD struck the Ethiopians before Asa and Judah, and the Ethiopians fled.
Bahnar: Kră Yang blah pơrăm kon pơlei Êthiôpi 'bơ̆t anăp kon pơlei Juđa păng pơtao Asa; khŭl linh Êthiôpi kơdâu đĭ.

English: And Asa and the people who were with him pursued them to Gerar. So the Ethiopians were overthrown, and they could not recover, for they were broken before the LORD and His army. And they carried away very much spoil.
Bahnar: Asa păng lu linh kiơ̆ sư, druh lu linh Êthiôpi truh tơ Gêrar; linh Êthiôpi lôch lơ tơpă, ưh pă đei bu arih, lu sư thuơ 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang hăm lu linh Sư. Lu bơngai blah iŏk đei lơ tơmam.

English: Then they defeated all the cities around Gerar, for the fear of the LORD came upon them; and they plundered all the cities, for there was exceedingly much spoil in them.
Bahnar: Linh Juđa kư̆m đei blah lu pơlei tăp dăr kơ pơlei tih Gêrar, yua kơ đei tơdrong hli krưp dêh đơ̆ng Kră Yang pơm kơ lu pơlei tih noh; păng lu linh Asa blah iŏk đĭ mŭk tơmam đơ̆ng pơlei noh, yua kơ tơ lăm pơlei noh đei mŭk tơmam lơ dêh.

English: They also attacked the livestock enclosures, and carried off sheep and camels in abundance, and returned to Jerusalem.
Bahnar: Kŭm đei blah tơgar iŏk lu anih wei sem dơrong, rôp ba triu păng lăk-đa lơ tơpă, đơ̆ng noh lu sư wih brŏk tơ pơlei Jêrusalem.

English: Now the Spirit of God came upon Azariah the son of Oded.
Bahnar: Yang Bơhngol đơ̆ng Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei tơbăt ăn kơ Asaria, kon drŏ-nglo Ôđet

English: And he went out to meet Asa, and said to him: “Hear me, Asa, and all Judah and Benjamin. The LORD is with you while you are with Him. If you seek Him, He will be found by you; but if you forsake Him, He will forsake you.
Bahnar: Sư năm tơ'bơ̆p Asa păng khan: “Ơ Asa, păng đĭ bơngai Juđa hăm bơngai Bênjamin, mơ̆ng bĕ nơ̆r inh; lu iĕm oei hơdai hăm Kră Yang dang yơ, Kră Yang oei hơdai iĕm dang noh. Tơdah lu iĕm chă Sư lu iĕm gô tơ'bơ̆p, mă-lei tơdah lu iĕm achăng lê̆ Sư, na Sư kư̆m gô achăng lê̆ lu iĕm.

English: For a long time Israel has been without the true God, without a teaching priest, and without law
Bahnar: Đunh boih lu bơngai Isơrael ưh kơ đei Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei sĭt tơpă. Ưh pă đei 'bok soi bơtho tơ'bôh, kư̆m ưh pă đei khôi juăt

English: but when in their trouble they turned to the LORD God of Israel, and sought Him, He was found by them.
Bahnar: Mă-lei mưh đei tơdrong gleh pơmat-tat truh lu sư wih tơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Isơrael păng krao chă Kră Yang na Sư ăn tơ'bơ̆p tơpă.

English: And in those times there was no peace to the one who went out, nor to the one who came in, but great turmoil was on all the inhabitants of the lands.
Bahnar: Kơplah noh kon pơlei Isơrael ưh kơ đei rơnŭk ôh, chă nơnăm mơ̆t lĕch, yua kơ đĭ-đăng bơngai đei tơdrong rŭng răng tih tơpă.

English: So nation was destroyed by nation, and city by city, for God troubled them with every adversity.
Bahnar: Dêh char 'nâu blah pơjuă dêh char nai, pơlei âu blah pơlei to yua kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn đei lơ tơdrong gleh pơmat wă pơrŭng lu sư.

English: But you, be strong and do not let your hands be weak, for your work shall be rewarded!”
Bahnar: Mă-lei lu iĕm athei đei jơhngơ̆m nuih pran, ti lu iĕm 'nĕ pă rơdu achăng, yua kơ dôm tơdrong jang iĕm pơm gô đei yua.”

English: And when Asa heard these words and the prophecy of Oded the prophet, he took courage, and removed the abominable idols from all the land of Judah and Benjamin and from the cities which he had taken in the mountains of Ephraim; and he restored the altar of the LORD that was before the vestibule of the LORD.
Bahnar: Wă Asa kơtơ̆ng boih nơ̆r 'nâu păng nơ̆r khan lê̆ adrol đơ̆ng Asaria kon drŏ-nglo Ôdet, jơhngơ̆m sư hiôk na sư nuih pơ̆n pơrăm lê̆ đĭ lu rup yang kơnê̆ đơ̆ng lăm jơ̆p kơ Juđa păng Bênjamin, hăm đơ̆ng lăm lu pơlei mă đêl lu sư 'nao blah iŏk tơ kơpal kông groi Êphraim; sư pơdơ̆ng hơmet chơnang soi Kră Yang 'bơ̆t anăp kơdeng hnam Kră Yang.

English: Then he gathered all Judah and Benjamin, and those who dwelt with them from Ephraim, Manasseh, and Simeon, for they came over to him in great numbers from Israel when they saw that the LORD his God was with him.
Bahnar: Sư akŭm đĭ bơngai Juđa, lu bơngai Bênjamin păng lu bơngai lăm Êphraim, Manase păng adrĕch Simêôn, mă oei oei hơdai lu sư; đei lơ bơngai Isơrael năm mơ̆t oei tơ gah sư, yua kơ 'bôh đei Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei tơgŭm păng oei hơdai Asa.

English: So they gathered together at Jerusalem in the third month, in the fifteenth year of the reign of Asa.
Bahnar: Lăm khei pêng sơnăm mơjĭt-pơđăm lăm chăl Asa, lu sư akŭm lăm pơlei Jêrusalem

English: And they offered to the LORD at that time seven hundred bulls and seven thousand sheep from the spoil they had brought.
Bahnar: Lăm năr noh lu sư iŏk tơpơh-hrĕng tŏ rơmo tơno păng tơpơh-rơbâu tŏ triu hăm bơbe, lu kon sem dơrong mă đơ̆ng lu sư blah iŏk, pơyơ̆r pơm tơmam soi bơnê kơ Kră Yang.

English: Then they entered into a covenant to seek the LORD God of their fathers with all their heart and with all their soul
Bahnar: Lu sư pơgơ̆p pơkă băl rim 'nu athei chă Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei 'bok yă lu sư hăm đĭ jơhngơ̆m klơm klak.

English: and whoever would not seek the LORD God of Israel was to be put to death, whether small or great, whether man or woman.
Bahnar: Bu mă ưh kơ chă Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Isơrael gô pơlôch, mă 'lơ̆p mă jŏ, drŏ-nglo dah drŏ-kăn.

English: Then they took an oath before the LORD with a loud voice, with shouting and trumpets and rams’ horns.
Bahnar: Lu sư ôr jreo re pơkă pơkăm hăm Kră Yang, chơt hiôk tơkĕch, jreo, hlôm keng, hlôm tơgiĕp.

English: And all Judah rejoiced at the oath, for they had sworn with all their heart and sought Him with all their soul; and He was found by them, and the LORD gave them rest all around.
Bahnar: Đĭ kơ bơngai Juđa chơt hiôk dêh kơ nơ̆r pơkă pơkăm noh, yua kơ lu sư đĭ jơhngơ̆m pơkă păng đĭ jơhngơ̆m krao chă Kră Yang na Sư ăn tơ'bơ̆p păng ăn kơ lu sư rơnŭk rơnua hiôk-hian rim pah.

English: Also he removed Maachah, the mother of Asa the king, from being queen mother, because she had made an obscene image of Asherah; and Asa cut down her obscene image, then crushed and burned it by the Brook Kidron.
Bahnar: Pơtao Asa ưh pă ăn kơ yă sư Maaka jang dơ̆ng yua kơ sư pơm gơ̆ng kơkuh kơ rup yang Asêra. Pơtao Asa teh pơrăm lê̆ gơ̆ng rup yang noh teh pơchah hĕch hoch đĭ păng soh lê̆ tơ thŭng Kidrôn.

English: But the high places were not removed from Israel. Nevertheless the heart of Asa was loyal all his days.
Bahnar: Mă lu anih tơ kơpal kơjung lu bơngai Isơrael sư ưh kơ đei pơrăm ôh; lei ră, jơhngơ̆m Asa oei arih 'lơ̆ng hăm Kră Yang lăm đĭ chăl arih sư.

English: He also brought into the house of God the things that his father had dedicated and that he himself had dedicated: silver and gold and utensils.
Bahnar: Sư tah tơmam rơgoh lăm hnam Kră Yang tơmam noh đơ̆ng 'bă sư păng tơmam đơ̆ng sư kơdih mă đei klah 'măn lê̆ pha 'lơ̆ng rơgoh, maih, hu păng dôm pơnhan kơchŏk.

English: And there was no war until the thirty-fifth year of the reign of Asa.
Bahnar: Ưh pă đei tơblah boih dĭng truh tơ sơnăm mă pêng-jĭt pơđăm lăm chăl sư pơgơ̆r.

English: In the thirty-sixth year of the reign of Asa, Baasha king of Israel came up against Judah and built Ramah, that he might let none go out or come in to Asa king of Judah.
Bahnar: Lăm sơnăm mă pêng-jĭt tơdrâu chăl Asa pơgơ̆r, Baasa pơtao Isơrael, năm blah lu bơngai Juđa păng pơjing pơlei Rama kơjăp, wă găn ưh kơ ăn bu mơ̆t lĕch ôh tơ lăm teh đak Asa pơtao đe Juđa.

English: Then Asa brought silver and gold from the treasuries of the house of the LORD and of the king’s house, and sent to Ben-Hadad king of Syria, who dwelt in Damascus, saying
Bahnar: Asa iŏk hu maih đơ̆ng lăm hnam mong tơmam hnam Kră Yang păng đơ̆ng lăm hnam mong tơmam pơtao, gơih ăn kơ Ben Hadat, pơtao Siri, oei lăm pơlei Đamas păng khan

English: “Let there be a treaty between you and me, as there was between my father and your father. See, I have sent you silver and gold; come, break your treaty with Baasha king of Israel, so that he will withdraw from me.”
Bahnar: “Bĕ ba pơgơ̆p hơdai ih hăm inh thoi bre 'bă ih hăm 'bă inh sơ̆. 'Nâu, inh gơih ăn kơ ih hu, maih. Apinh ih 'nĕ pă pơgơ̆p hăm Baasa pơtao Isơrael dơ̆ng, wă kơ sư weh đơ̆ng char inh.”

English: So Ben-Hadad heeded King Asa, and sent the captains of his armies against the cities of Israel. They attacked Ijon, Dan, Abel Maim, and all the storage cities of Naphtali.
Bahnar: Ben Hadat mơ̆ng kiơ̆ pơtao Asa na wơh lu yŏng linh năm blah iŏk lu pơlei tih bơngai Isơrael; lu sư blah iŏk lu pơlei Ijôn, pơlei Đan, pơlei Abel Maim păng lu pơlei đei hnam mong tơmam char Naptali.

English: Now it happened, when Baasha heard it, that he stopped building Ramah and ceased his work.
Bahnar: Wă Baasa kơtơ̆ng tơdrong noh, sư pơdơh ưh pă pơm pơjing pơlei Rama.

English: Then King Asa took all Judah, and they carried away the stones and timber of Ramah, which Baasha had used for building; and with them he built Geba and Mizpah.
Bahnar: Pơtao Asa akŭm đĭ bơngai Juđa; lu sư năm iŏk đĭ lu tơmo, tơ̆r 'long mă đêl Baasa đei pơm pơjing pơlei Rama; na Asa iŏk dôm lu tơmam noh pơdơ̆ng pơjing pơlei Gêba păng pơlei Mispa.

English: And at that time Hanani the seer came to Asa king of Judah, and said to him: “Because you have relied on the king of Syria, and have not relied on the LORD your God, therefore the army of the king of Syria has escaped from your hand.
Bahnar: Kơplah noh Hanani bơngai khan lê̆ adrol năm tơ Asa pơtao đe Juđa na khan kơ sư: “Yua kơ ih gơnang dêh kơ pơtao Siri, ưh kơ gơnang kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ih ôh, na lu linh pơtao Siri kơdâu klaih boih đơ̆ng ti ih.

English: Were the Ethiopians and the Lubim not a huge army with very many chariots and horsemen? Yet, because you relied on the LORD, He delivered them into your hand.
Bahnar: Lu linh Êthiôpi păng linh Libyan hăm trŏ nuih kơtang đei gre aseh păng lu linh hao aseh lơ dêh? Lei ră, pơtao gơnang kơ Kră Yang boih, na Sư jao lu linh noh lăm ti ih.

English: For the eyes of the LORD run to and fro throughout the whole earth, to show Himself strong on behalf of those whose heart is loyal to Him. In this you have done foolishly; therefore from now on you shall have wars.”
Bahnar: Măt Kră Yang lăng jơ̆p kơ teh đak, wă tơgŭm jơhngơ̆m pran kơ lu đe bu mă đei jơhngơ̆m gơnang kơ Sư. Tơpă lăm tơdrong 'nâu ih đei pơm kư̆ kă, na đơ̆ng âu tơ anăp ih gô đei tơ'bơ̆p tơdrong tơblah hơnơ̆ng.”

English: Then Asa was angry with the seer, and put him in prison, for he was enraged at him because of this. And Asa oppressed some of the people at that time.
Bahnar: Asa sư hil kơ bơngai khan lê̆ adrol noh dêh na rôp phak. Kơplah noh Asa kư̆m pơm kơnê̆ kơ lu kon pơlei hai.

English: Note that the acts of Asa, first and last, are indeed written in the book of the kings of Judah and Israel.
Bahnar: Tơdrong jang Asa iŏk đơ̆ng blŭng-a truh tơ tôch đei chih răk lê̆ tơ lăm sơ̆p hla bơar lu pơtao đe Juđa păng bơngai Isơrael.

English: And in the thirty-ninth year of his reign, Asa became diseased in his feet, and his malady was severe; yet in his disease he did not seek the LORD, but the physicians.
Bahnar: Lăm sơnăm mă pêng-jĭt tơsĭn chăl Asa pơgơ̆r, Asa sư đei jĭ jơ̆ng sư jĭ krưp dêh; kơplah sư jĭ jơ̆ng 'nâu sư ưh kơ chơchă Kră Yang, mă-lei sư chă 'bok pơgang wă ming mang.

English: So Asa rested with his fathers; he died in the forty-first year of his reign.
Bahnar: Asa lôch năm kiơ̆ 'bok sư, sư lôch sơnăm mă puăn-jĭt mônh lăm chăl sư pơgơ̆r.

English: They buried him in his own tomb, which he had made for himself in the City of David; and they laid him in the bed which was filled with spices and various ingredients prepared in a mixture of ointments. They made a very great burning for him.
Bahnar: Đe 'bŭ sư lăm bơsat mă anih sư đei sir boih kơ sư kơdih lăm pơlei Đawit, đe tơ'bĭch lăm bong mă đe đei tah 'bĕnh kơ pơgang 'bâu phu, đe đei hơmet boih kiơ̆ kơ juăt pơm soh, đe soh 'long pơgang 'bâu phu tih dêh lăm năr grong noh.

English: Then Jehoshaphat his son reigned in his place, and strengthened himself against Israel.
Bahnar: Jêhôsaphat kon drŏ-nglo Asa iung pơm pơtao pơgơ̆r pơtrơp kơ 'bă sư, sư pơgơ̆r dêh char sư kơjăp wă tơblah hăm bơngai Isơrael.

English: And he placed troops in all the fortified cities of Judah, and set garrisons in the land of Judah and in the cities of Ephraim which Asa his father had taken.
Bahnar: Sư chă dan lê̆ lu linh tơ lăm rim pơlei mă đei pơm kơjăp lăm char Juđa, pơm kơđông kơjăp lăm char Juđa păng lăm pơlei char Êphraim mă pơtao Asa 'bă sư đei blah iŏk.

English: Now the LORD was with Jehoshaphat, because he walked in the former ways of his father David; he did not seek the Baals
Bahnar: Kră Yang oei hơdai hăm Jêhôsaphat, yua kơ sư yak kiơ̆ trong 'bok Đawit, ưh kơ kiơ̆ yang Baal ôh

English: but sought the God of his father, and walked in His commandments and not according to the acts of Israel.
Bahnar: mă-lei chơchă Kră Yang 'bă sư pơm kiơ̆ wei răk nơ̆r Kră Yang tơtă, ưh kơ pơm kiơ̆ ôh thoi lu bơngai Isơrael pơm.

English: Therefore the LORD established the kingdom in his hand; and all Judah gave presents to Jehoshaphat, and he had riches and honor in abundance.
Bahnar: Thoi ei na Kră Yang ăn kơ dêh char sư kơjăp lăm ti sư; đĭ-đăng bơngai Juđa ra pơyơ̆r ăn kơ Jêhôsaphat tơmam, sư mơdrŏng tih tơpă păng đe ư-ang.

English: And his heart took delight in the ways of the LORD; moreover he removed the high places and wooden images from Judah.
Bahnar: Sư đei jơhngơ̆m hiôk kơjăp kiơ̆ trong Kră Yang; kư̆m oei đei pơrăm lê̆ lu anih kơjung păng lu rup yang Asêra lăm char Juđa.

English: Also in the third year of his reign he sent his leaders, Ben-Hail, Obadiah, Zechariah, Nethanel, and Michaiah, to teach in the cities of Judah.
Bahnar: Sơnăm mă pêng lăm chăl Jêhôsaphat pơgơ̆r, sư wơh lu yŏng kơiĕng sư Bênhail, Ôbadia, Sachari, Nêthanel păng Mikaia lu sư năm chă bơtho tơ'bôh tơ jơ̆p pơlei lăm char Juđa

English: And with them he sent Levites: Shemaiah, Nethaniah, Zebadiah, Asahel, Shemiramoth, Jehonathan, Adonijah, Tobijah, and Tobadonijah—the Levites; and with them Elishama and Jehoram, the priests.
Bahnar: Kŭm đei lu bơngai Lêwi kiơ̆ lu sư noh. Sêmaia, Nêthania, Sebadia, Asahel, Sêmiramôt, Jêhônathan, Adonija, Tôbija păng Tôpadônija; kư̆m đei lu 'bok soi Êlisama păng Jêhôram kư̆m năm kiơ̆ hơdai.

English: So they taught in Judah, and had the Book of the Law of the LORD with them; they went throughout all the cities of Judah and taught the people.
Bahnar: Lu sư năm chĕp hla bơar khôi juăt Kră Yang năm tơ jơ̆p lu pơlei bơtho tơbăt ăn kơ kon pơlei pơla lăm char Juđa

English: And the fear of the LORD fell on all the kingdoms of the lands that were around Judah, so that they did not make war against Jehoshaphat.
Bahnar: Kră Yang ăn kơ đĭ-đăng dêh char tăp dăr kơ dêh char Juđa hli kơ Kră Yang, pơm kơ lu sư ưh kơ pơ̆n tơblah hăm Jêhôsaphat.

English: Also some of the Philistines brought Jehoshaphat presents and silver as tribute; and the Arabians brought him flocks, seven thousand seven hundred rams and seven thousand seven hundred male goats.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai Philistin chĕp jên hu tơmam năm ba pơyơ̆r ăn kơ Jêhôsaphat, lu bơngai Arâp kư̆m lei-lăi năm ba pơyơ̆r ăn tơpơh-rơbâu tơpơh-hrĕng tŏ triu tơno păng tơpơh-rơbâu tơpơh-hrĕng tŏ bơbe tơno.

English: So Jehoshaphat became increasingly powerful, and he built fortresses and storage cities in Judah.
Bahnar: Jêhôsaphat jing rai tih rai pran tŏk ling-lang, sư pơm anih kơđông linh kơjăp păng đei lu hnam mong tơmam tơ lu pơlei lăm char Juđa.

English: He had much property in the cities of Judah; and the men of war, mighty men of valor, were in Jerusalem.
Bahnar: Sư đei mong mŭk tơmam lơ lăm char Juđa, sư đei lu linh nuih pran kơtang lăm pơlei tih Jêrusalem.

English: These are their numbers, according to their fathers’ houses. Of Judah, the captains of thousands: Adnah the captain, and with him three hundred thousand mighty men of valor
Bahnar: 'Nâu đe chih jô̆ kiơ̆ kơ hnam dơnŏ 'bă sư: Đơ̆ng adrĕch Juđa, lu yŏng pơgơ̆r rơbâu rơbâu 'nu linh: Noh đei Atnah yŏng pơgơ̆r kơ pêng-hrĕng rơbâu 'nu linh nuih pran kơtang hơdai hăm sư

English: and next to him was Jehohanan the captain, and with him two hundred and eighty thousand
Bahnar: yŏng mă 'bar noh Jêhôhanan sư pơgơ̆r 'bar-hrĕng tơhngam-jĭt rơbâu 'nu linh hơdai hăm Sư

English: and next to him was Amasiah the son of Zichri, who willingly offered himself to the LORD, and with him two hundred thousand mighty men of valor.
Bahnar: yŏng mă pêng noh Amasia kon drŏ-nglo Sikri, minh 'nu bơngai bơ̆jang kơ Kră Yang hăm jơhngơ̆m hiôk, sư pơgơ̆r 'bar-hrĕng rơbâu 'nu linh nuih kơtang hơdai hăm sư.

English: Of Benjamin: Eliada a mighty man of valor, and with him two hundred thousand men armed with bow and shield
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng adrĕch Bênjamin: Đei Êliađa minh 'nu linh nuih kơtang sư pơgơ̆r 'bar-hrĕng rơbâu 'nu linh chĕp hră hăm khêl hơdai hăm Sư

English: and next to him was Jehozabad, and with him one hundred and eighty thousand prepared for war.
Bahnar: yŏng mă 'bar noh Jêhôsabat sư pơgơ̆r đei minh-hrĕng tơhngam-jĭt rơbâu 'nu linh chĕp hơmăt tơmam tơblah hơdai hăm Sư.

English: These served the king, besides those the king put in the fortified cities throughout all Judah.
Bahnar: Lu đe âu bơ̆jang tơgŭm pơtao, 'nguaih kơ lu sư pơtao kư̆m dan lu bơngai nai lăm lu pơlei tih kơjăp tơ jơ̆p lăm dêh char Juđa.

English: Jehoshaphat had riches and honor in abundance; and by marriage he allied himself with Ahab.
Bahnar: Jêhôsaphat mơdrŏng tih đei đe ư-ang pơyom, năm pơm pô̆ 'băn ăn băl kon hăm Ahap.

English: After some years he went down to visit Ahab in Samaria; and Ahab killed sheep and oxen in abundance for him and the people who were with him, and persuaded him to go up with him to Ramoth Gilead.
Bahnar: Dang 'bar pêng năr đơ̆ng rŏng sư jur năm ngôi tơ Ahap tơ pơlei Samari, Ahap đei 'bet sa lơ triu rơmo et sa hăm Jêhôsaphat hăm lu bơngai kiơ̆ sư, na pơthơr sư tŏk blah lu kon pơlei Ramôt Gileat.

English: So Ahab king of Israel said to Jehoshaphat king of Judah, “Will you go with me against Ramoth Gilead?” And he answered him, “I am as you are, and my people as your people; we will be with you in the war.”
Bahnar: Ahap pơtao đe Isơrael khan kơ Jêhôsaphat pơtao đe Juđa: “Ih hăm wă năm hăm inh tŏk blah pơlei Ramôt Gileat ưh?” Sư drơ̆ng: “Inh kư̆m thoi ih; kon pơlei inh kư̆m thoi kon pơlei ih; nhôn gô năm hơdai ih tŏk blah.”

English: Also Jehoshaphat said to the king of Israel, “Please inquire for the word of the LORD today.”
Bahnar: Jêhôsaphat kư̆m đei khan hăm pơtao Isơrael: “Mă-lei athei krao apinh Kră Yang adrol 'mơ̆i.”

English: Then the king of Israel gathered the prophets together, four hundred men, and said to them, “Shall we go to war against Ramoth Gilead, or shall I refrain?” So they said, “Go up, for God will deliver it into the king’s hand.”
Bahnar: Pơtao Isơrael krao akŭm lu 'bok khan lê̆ adrol, đei puăn-hrĕng 'nu, na jet lu sư: “Lu bơ̆n hăm gơh năm blah pơlei Ramôt tơ Gileat dah ưh?” Lu sư tơl: “Năm tŏk blah bĕ; Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei gô pơjao pơlei noh lăm ti ih, pơtao.”

English: But Jehoshaphat said, “Is there not still a prophet of the LORD here, that we may inquire of Him?”
Bahnar: Jêhôsaphat jet dơ̆ng: “Tơ âu hăm pă đei bu dơ̆ng 'bok khan lê̆ adrol Kră Yang wă kơ bơ̆n apinh sư?”

English: So the king of Israel said to Jehoshaphat, “There is still one man by whom we may inquire of the LORD; but I hate him, because he never prophesies good concerning me, but always evil. He is Micaiah the son of Imla.” And Jehoshaphat said, “Let not the king say such things!”
Bahnar: Pơtao Isơrael tơl Jêhôsaphat khan: “Oei đei pă minh 'nu anăn sư Mikaia kon drŏ-nglo Imla, apinh sư krao khan apinh Kră Yang; mă-lei inh areh dêh kơ sư, yua kơ sư ưh kơ đei khan lê̆ adrol 'lơ̆ng gah inh tă kơ khan lê̆ adrol kơnê̆ ngăl gah inh.” Jêhôsaphat khan: “Apinh ih 'nĕ pơma thoi noh!”

English: Then the king of Israel called one of his officers and said, “Bring Micaiah the son of Imla quickly!”
Bahnar: Pơtao Isơrael krao minh 'nu yŏng linh păng khan: “Năm krao Mikaia kon drŏ-nglo Imla năm tơ âu mă tĕnh.”

English: The king of Israel and Jehoshaphat king of Judah, clothed in their robes, sat each on his throne; and they sat at a threshing floor at the entrance of the gate of Samaria; and all the prophets prophesied before them.
Bahnar: Kơplah noh pơtao Isơrael păng Jêhôsaphat pơtao Juđa, bre sư hrŭk hơbĕn ao pơtao sư, hơ-oei 'bơ̆t anih tang-dŏ pơtao sư, tơ anih đe pơjuă 'bơ̆t 'măng dur pơlei Samari; lu 'bok khan lê̆ adrol oei pơma khan lê̆ adrol đĭ 'bơ̆t anăp bre pơtao.

English: Now Zedekiah the son of Chenaanah had made horns of iron for himself; and he said, “Thus says the LORD: ‘With these you shall gore the Syrians until they are destroyed.’ ”
Bahnar: Sêđekia kon drŏ-nglo Kênaana sư đei pơm hơke hăm mam păng khan: “'Nâu Kră Yang khan: ‘Hăm hơke 'nâu lu iĕm gô tơ̆m bơngai Siri dĭng truh tơ lu sư lôch răm đĭ.’ ”

English: And all the prophets prophesied so, saying, “Go up to Ramoth Gilead and prosper, for the LORD will deliver it into the king’s hand.”
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng lu 'bok khan lê̆ adrol kư̆m khan lê̆ adrol thoi noh mơ̆n: “Tŏk năm blah bĕ pơlei Ramôt Gileat gô jei ih. Kră Yang gô jao pơlei noh lăm ti ih, pơtao.”

English: Then the messenger who had gone to call Micaiah spoke to him, saying, “Now listen, the words of the prophets with one accord encourage the king. Therefore please let your word be like the word of one of them, and speak encouragement.”
Bahnar: Bơngai năm krao Mikaia khan kơ sư; Âu, lu 'bok khan lê̆ adrol lu sư pơma minh pôm nơ̆r, gô jei ih, pơtao; apinh ih kư̆m pơma 'lơ̆ng thoi lu sư kơ pơtao.

English: And Micaiah said, “As the LORD lives, whatever my God says, that I will speak.”
Bahnar: Mă-lei Mikaia khan: “Kiơ̆ kơ thoi Kră Yang arih ling-lang, Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei inh khan liơ, inh gô pơma thoi noh.”

English: Then he came to the king; and the king said to him, “Micaiah, shall we go to war against Ramoth Gilead, or shall I refrain?” And he said, “Go and prosper, and they shall be delivered into your hand!”
Bahnar: Wă sư truh tơ pơtao, pơtao apinh sư: “Ơ Mikaia lu bơ̆n hăm gơh năm blah Ramôt tơ Gileat, dah ưh?” Sư tơl: “Năm blah bĕ, gô jei ih; sư gô jao pơlei noh lăm ti ih.”

English: So the king said to him, “How many times shall I make you swear that you tell me nothing but the truth in the name of the LORD?”
Bahnar: Pơtao khan kơ sư: “Hơdôm wơ̆t inh đei athei ih pơma tơpăt hăm inh păng anăn Kră Yang?”

English: Then he said, “I saw all Israel scattered on the mountains, as sheep that have no shepherd. And the LORD said, ‘These have no master. Let each return to his house in peace.’ ”
Bahnar: Mikaia tơl: “Inh 'bôh lu bơngai Isơrael tơklah tơklang tơ kơpal kông groi thoi khŭl triu mă ưh kơ đei bơngai wei; păng Kră Yang đei khan: ‘Lu bơngai noh ưh kơ đei tơ'ngla, lê̆ lu sư wih brŏk tơ hnam lu sư kơdih hiôk-hian bĕ.’ ”

English: And the king of Israel said to Jehoshaphat, “Did I not tell you he would not prophesy good concerning me, but evil?”
Bahnar: Pơtao Isơrael khan kơ Jêhôsaphat: “Inh hăm roi kơ ih khan bơngai noh ưh kơ đei pơma khan 'lơ̆ng gah inh, tă khan tơdrong kơnê̆ ngăl?”

English: Then Micaiah said, “Therefore hear the word of the LORD: I saw the LORD sitting on His throne, and all the host of heaven standing on His right hand and His left.
Bahnar: Mikaia pơma dơ̆ng: “Thoi ei mơ̆ng bĕ nơ̆r Kră Yang khan: Inh 'bôh Kră Yang hơ-oei tơ kơpal tang-dŏ pơtao Sư, lu linh jang đĭ-đăng dơ̆ng kơkuh 'bar pah gah 'ma păng gah 'ngiĕo.

English: And the LORD said, ‘Who will persuade Ahab king of Israel to go up, that he may fall at Ramoth Gilead?’ So one spoke in this manner, and another spoke in that manner.
Bahnar: Kră Yang jet: ‘Bu gô năm pơhlŭ Ahap, pơtao Isơrael, năm tŏk blah Ramôt tơ Gileat na gô lôch tơ noh?’ Đei mơ'nah pơma thoi âu mơ'nah khan thoi noh.

English: Then a spirit came forward and stood before the LORD, and said, ‘I will persuade him.’ The LORD said to him, ‘In what way?’
Bahnar: Blư đei minh 'nu yang lĕch năm dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang khan: ‘Inh năm pơhlŭ sư.’ Kră Yang jet. ‘Ih pơhlŭ liơ?’

English: So he said, ‘I will go out and be a lying spirit in the mouth of all his prophets.’ And the LORD said, ‘You shall persuade him and also prevail; go out and do so.’
Bahnar: Yang noh tơl: “Inh gô năm pơm thoi minh 'nu yang pơma hơlĕnh lăm 'bơ̆r lu 'bok khan lê̆ adrol sư.” Kră Yang khan: “Trŏ boih, ih gơh năm pơhlŭ sư. Năm bĕ pơm thoi nơ̆r ih khan.”

English: Therefore look! The LORD has put a lying spirit in the mouth of these prophets of yours, and the LORD has declared disaster against you.”
Bahnar: “Thoi noh Kră Yang ăn yang hơlĕnh pơma lăm 'bơ̆r lu bơngai khan lê̆ adrol pơtao păng Kră Yang kư̆m đei pơkă wă ăn tơdrong răm truh kơ pơtao.”

English: Then Zedekiah the son of Chenaanah went near and struck Micaiah on the cheek, and said, “Which way did the spirit from the LORD go from me to speak to you?”
Bahnar: Sêdêkia, kon drŏ-nglo Kênaana, năm jê̆ tap tơ'bŏk Mikaia păng jet: “Trong ayơ Yang Bơhngol Kră Yang lĕch đơ̆ng inh năm roi kơ ih?”

English: And Micaiah said, “Indeed you shall see on that day when you go into an inner chamber to hide!”
Bahnar: Mikaia tơl: “Ih gô 'bôh 'bơ̆t năr ih kơdâu mơ̆t tơ lăm anih hlơp wă ôn,”

English: Then the king of Israel said, “Take Micaiah, and return him to Amon the governor of the city and to Joash the king’s son
Bahnar: Pơtao Isơrael athei đe rôp Mikaia ba sư tơ Ammôn bơngai pơgơ̆r pơlei păng ăn kơ Jôas, kon drŏ-nglo pơtao

English: and say, ‘Thus says the king: “Put this fellow in prison, and feed him with bread of affliction and water of affliction, until I return in peace.” ’ ”
Bahnar: na khan: “Pơtao khan thoi âu: ‘Athei phak bơngai âu păng ăn kơ sư lăp 'bĕng sa đak nhă đĕch dĭng truh tơ inh wih brŏk hiôk-hian.’ ”

English: But Micaiah said, “If you ever return in peace, the LORD has not spoken by me.” And he said, “Take heed, all you people!”
Bahnar: Mikaia khan: “Tơdah pơtao wih brŏk hiôk-hian, lei Kră Yang ưh kơ đei wă yua inh khan.” Sư khan dơ̆ng: “Ơ kon pơlei, đĭ-đăng iĕm mơ̆ng nơ̆r inh.”

English: So the king of Israel and Jehoshaphat the king of Judah went up to Ramoth Gilead.
Bahnar: Na pơtao Isơrael păng Jêhôsaphat pơtao Juđa tŏk năm tơ pơlei Ramôt Gileat.

English: And the king of Israel said to Jehoshaphat, “I will disguise myself and go into battle; but you put on your robes.” So the king of Israel disguised himself, and they went into battle.
Bahnar: Pơtao Isơrael khan kơ Jêhôsaphat: “Inh gô hrŭk ao pha pơm thoi bơngai hmă na năm tŏk blah; gah ih athei hrŭk ao pơtao ih.” Pơtao Isơrael hrŭk hơbĕn ao hmă, dơ̆ng noh na bre sư năm tơblah.

English: Now the king of Syria had commanded the captains of the chariots who were with him, saying, “Fight with no one small or great, but only with the king of Israel.”
Bahnar: Pơtao Siri pơkă tơtă kơ lu yŏng linh hao gre aseh sư: “'Nĕ kơ blah bu hŏ mă 'lơ̆p, dah 'lŏ, mă-lei blah rĕng kơ minh 'nu pơtao Isơrael đĕch.”

English: So it was, when the captains of the chariots saw Jehoshaphat, that they said, “It is the king of Israel!” Therefore they surrounded him to attack; but Jehoshaphat cried out, and the LORD helped him, and God diverted them from him.
Bahnar: Wă lu yŏng linh hao gre aseh 'bôh Jêhôsaphat, na khan: “Noh boih pơtao Isơrael.” Na lu sư dăr wă blah sư. Jêhôsaphat krao ôr, Kră Yang dŏng pơklaih sư păng Kră Yang ăn kơ lu đe noh weh ataih đơ̆ng sư.

English: For so it was, when the captains of the chariots saw that it was not the king of Israel, that they turned back from pursuing him.
Bahnar: Wă lu yŏng linh hao gre aseh 'bôh boih noh ưh kơ trŏ kơ pơtao Isơrael, na lu sư kơdŭn tơ rŏng ưh pă druh blah dơ̆ng.

English: Now a certain man drew a bow at random, and struck the king of Israel between the joints of his armor. So he said to the driver of his chariot, “Turn around and take me out of the battle, for I am wounded.”
Bahnar: Mă-lei đei minh 'nu iŏk hră chă prah kư̆ kă tă kơ 'bơm pơtao Isơrael 'bơ̆t kơtơh sơlam ao bơsei; Ahap khan kơ linh chĕp ba gre aseh sư: “Wih bơkuĕch tơ rŏng năm chơ ba inh lĕch đơ̆ng anih tơblah âu, inh 'bơm 'brơ̆m boih.

English: The battle increased that day, and the king of Israel propped himself up in his chariot facing the Syrians until evening; and about the time of sunset he died.
Bahnar: Lăm năr noh tơdrong tơblah rai dêh; na pơtao Isơrael oei lăm gre aseh sư muh măt sư tơwih tơ khŭl linh Siri dĭng truh kơsơ̆ măng; sư lôch 'bơ̆t 'năr mơ̆t boih.

English: Then Jehoshaphat the king of Judah returned safely to his house in Jerusalem.
Bahnar: Jêhôsaphat, pơtao Juđa wih brŏk hiôk-hian tơ hnam pơtao sư tơ pơlei Jêrusalem.

English: And Jehu the son of Hanani the seer went out to meet him, and said to King Jehoshaphat, “Should you help the wicked and love those who hate the LORD? Therefore the wrath of the LORD is upon you.
Bahnar: Jêhu kon drŏ-nglo Hanani, bơngai 'bôh adrol, lĕch năm sơng pơtao Jêhôsaphat păng khan: “Ih tơgŭm kơ lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆ păng 'mêm kơ lu bơngai areh kơ Kră Yang hă? Yua kơ noh, Kră Yang hil kơ ih.

English: Nevertheless good things are found in you, in that you have removed the wooden images from the land, and have prepared your heart to seek God.”
Bahnar: Mă-lei lăm ih kư̆m đei tơdrong 'lơ̆ng, ih đei pơrăm lê̆ boih lu gơ̆ng rup yang Asêra đơ̆ng lăm char ih păng ih kư̆m đei pơkă wă chă Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei!”

English: So Jehoshaphat dwelt at Jerusalem; and he went out again among the people from Beersheba to the mountains of Ephraim, and brought them back to the LORD God of their fathers.
Bahnar: Jêhôsaphat oei tơ pơlei Jêrusalem, đơ̆ng noh sư năm chă dăr lăng lu kon pơlei đơ̆ng pơlei Bêrsêba truh tơ tơring kông groi Êphraim chông ba lu sư wih brŏk tơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei 'bok lu sư.

English: Then he set judges in the land throughout all the fortified cities of Judah, city by city
Bahnar: Sư pôk lu 'bok sek tơlang lăm rim pơlei kơjăp lăm dêh char Juđa.

English: and said to the judges, “Take heed to what you are doing, for you do not judge for man but for the LORD, who is with you in the judgment.
Bahnar: Sư khan kơ lu 'bok sek tơlang: “Iĕm athei bơ̆jang mă pơ'lơ̆ng, yua kơ iĕm sek tơlang ưh kơ sĭ kơ sek kơ kon bơngai ôh, mă-lei kơ Kră Yang; Sư gô oei hơdai lu iĕm tơ rim wơ̆t wă sek tơlang.

English: Now therefore, let the fear of the LORD be upon you; take care and do it, for there is no iniquity with the LORD our God, no partiality, nor taking of bribes.”
Bahnar: Thoi noh, na hli yom bĕ kơ Kră Yang athei sek tơlang mă 'lơ̆ng, yua kơ Kră Yang lu bơ̆n Sư tơpăt, ưh kơ mơ̆t minh pah, ưh kơ đei pơdê bu kư̆m ưh kơ đei iŏk jên đe răt.”

English: Moreover in Jerusalem, for the judgment of the LORD and for controversies, Jehoshaphat appointed some of the Levites and priests, and some of the chief fathers of Israel, when they returned to Jerusalem.
Bahnar: Lăm pơlei tih Jêrusalem Jêhôsaphat kư̆m chă rơih iŏk đơ̆ng lăm lu bơngai Lêwi, lu 'bok soi păng yŏng kơdră Isơrael wă kơ sek tơlang lu tơdrong pơjah pơjăng băl kiơ̆ tơdrong juăt Kră Yang. Lu sư oei bơ̆jang lăm pơlei tih Jêrusalem.

English: And he commanded them, saying, “Thus you shall act in the fear of the LORD, faithfully and with a loyal heart
Bahnar: Sư tơtă kơ lu sư: “Lu iĕm athei hli yom kơ Kră Yang, iŏk jơhngơ̆m 'lơ̆ng tơpăt hơnơ̆ng păng bơ̆jang hăm đĭ jơhngơ̆m.

English: Whatever case comes to you from your brethren who dwell in their cities, whether of bloodshed or offenses against law or commandment, against statutes or ordinances, you shall warn them, lest they trespass against the LORD and wrath come upon you and your brethren. Do this, and you will not be guilty.
Bahnar: Tơdah đei lu 'nhŏng oh kon pơlei pơla đơ̆ng lăm pơlei nai năm tơkan tơ iĕm đei tơdrong truh, pơlôch bơngai dah pơm glăi kơ khôi juăt, nơ̆r tơtă, tơdrong juăt, nơ̆r tơbăt lu iĕm athei bơtho khan kơ lu sư 'nĕ kơ pơm yoch hăm Kră Yang, kơnh Kră Yang hil mĭl phak lu iĕm păng lu 'nhŏng oh iĕm: Pơm thoi ei na lu iĕm huay kơ đei yoch.”

English: And take notice: Amariah the chief priest is over you in all matters of the LORD; and Zebadiah the son of Ishmael, the ruler of the house of Judah, for all the king’s matters; also the Levites will be officials before you. Behave courageously, and the LORD will be with the good.”
Bahnar: Pơtao pôk ăn Amaria 'bok soi tơm pơm yŏng sek tơlang kơ tơdrong pơm glăi hăm khôi juăt Kră Yang păng Sêbadia kon drŏ-nglo Ismael, pơm yŏng kơdră bơngai Juđa, Sư pơm yŏng sek tơlang tơdrong glăi hăm teh đak pơtao păng kư̆m iŏk lu bơngai Lêwi pơm 'bok sek tơlang tơgŭm.” Pơtao kư̆m đei pơkă dơ̆ng: “Lu iĕm athei mă nuih na bơ̆jang! Kră Yang oei hơdai hăm lu bơngai pơm 'lơ̆ng tơpăt.”

English: It happened after this that the people of Moab with the people of Ammon, and others with them besides the Ammonites, came to battle against Jehoshaphat.
Bahnar: Klaih kơ noh đei lu bơngai Môap, Ammôn păng kư̆m đei bơngai Mêunit năm hơdai blah Jêhôsaphat.

English: Then some came and told Jehoshaphat, saying, “A great multitude is coming against you from beyond the sea, from Syria; and they are in Hazazon Tamar” (which is En Gedi).
Bahnar: Đei bơngai năm roi tơbăt ăn kơ Jêhôsaphat thoi âu: “Đei minh khŭl linh lơ tơpă đơ̆ng char Eđôm pah to dơsĭ lu sư năm wă tơblah hăm ih; to lu sư oei lăm pơlei Hasasôn Tamar, (kư̆m anăn pơlei Êngêđi)

English: And Jehoshaphat feared, and set himself to seek the LORD, and proclaimed a fast throughout all Judah.
Bahnar: Jêhôsaphat hli, na hơmet jơhngơ̆m sư chă Kră Yang, na kư̆m roi tơbăt jơ̆p kơ dêh char athei ơ̆t kơ sŏng sa.

English: So Judah gathered together to ask help from the LORD; and from all the cities of Judah they came to seek the LORD.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai Juđa akŭm băl wă krao chă Kră Yang dŏng tơgŭm; lu Sư năm đơ̆ng jơ̆p pơlei oei lăm dêh char Juđa krao chă Kră Yang.

English: Then Jehoshaphat stood in the assembly of Judah and Jerusalem, in the house of the LORD, before the new court
Bahnar: Jêhôsaphat dơ̆ng tŏk-bŏk akŭm hơdai lu bơngai Juđa đơ̆ng rim pơlei păng pơlei Jêrusalem 'bơ̆t cham 'nao anăp hnam akŭm tơm Kră Yang.

English: and said: “O LORD God of our fathers, are You not God in heaven, and do You not rule over all the kingdoms of the nations, and in Your hand is there not power and might, so that no one is able to withstand You?
Bahnar: Sư krao khan: “Ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei 'bok lu nhôn Ih hăm Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei oei kơpal plĕnh? Ih boih Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei wei pơgơ̆r đĭ kon bơngai păng đĭ kơ teh đak Lăm tơpang ti Ih đei tơdrong mơsêh pran kơtang ưh kơ đei bu kĕ tơblah hăm Ih.

English: Are You not our God, who drove out the inhabitants of this land before Your people Israel, and gave it to the descendants of Abraham Your friend forever?
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu nhôn Hăm trŏ Ih boih pơpuh tơweh lu kon pơlei oei lăm tơring âu 'bơ̆t anăp bơngai Isơrael Ih, na jao ăn dêh char kơ adrĕch adrung Abraham, buăl juăt Ih, oei jang sa tơ âu ling-lang hlŏng hloi?

English: And they dwell in it, and have built You a sanctuary in it for Your name, saying
Bahnar: Lu sư oei lăm dêh char 'nâu păng pơdơ̆ng pơjing hnam akŭm 'lơ̆ng rơgoh kơ Anăn Ih păng khan

English: ‘If disaster comes upon us—sword, judgment, pestilence, or famine—we will stand before this temple and in Your presence (for Your name is in this temple), and cry out to You in our affliction, and You will hear and save.’
Bahnar: ‘Dah đei tơdrong kơnê̆ truh kơ lu nhôn, đao gưm, phak pơmat, dah lôch hơbuh, pơngot rơwĕt, lu nhôn gô năm dơng 'bơ̆t anăp hnam 'nâu, na lu nhôn krao apinh Ih lăm năr pơmat-tat, Ih mơ̆ng păng dŏng pơklaih nhôn.’

English: And now, here are the people of Ammon, Moab, and Mount Seir—whom You would not let Israel invade when they came out of the land of Egypt, but they turned from them and did not destroy them
Bahnar: 'Nâu to lu bơngai Ammôn, kon pơlei Môap păng lu bơngai oei kơpal Kông Sêir; lu bơngai mă kơplah kon pơlei Isơrael lĕch đơ̆ng Êyiptơ Kră Yang ưh kơ ăn lu sư blah, na lu sư weh ưh kơ pơrăm đe noh ôh.

English: here they are, rewarding us by coming to throw us out of Your possession which You have given us to inherit.
Bahnar: Lăng to, lu sư pơm plơ̆ kơ lu nhôn, 'maih wă puh tơweh lu nhôn đơ̆ng lăm teh jang sa mă đơ̆ng Ih ăn kơ lu nhôn boih

English: O our God, will You not judge them? For we have no power against this great multitude that is coming against us; nor do we know what to do, but our eyes are upon You.”
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu nhôn, lei Ih ưh kơ phak lu sư hă? Tơpă, lu nhôn ưh pă đei jơhngơ̆m pran wă blah hăm lu linh lơ kơdrâ̆m noh mă oei wă wang blah lu nhôn păng lu nhôn kư̆m đĭ pă băt wă pơm liơ; mă-lei măt lu nhôn lăng chang gô Ih đĕch.”

English: Now all Judah, with their little ones, their wives, and their children, stood before the LORD.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng bơngai Juđa hăm lu kon akăn lu sư dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang.

English: Then the Spirit of the LORD came upon Jahaziel the son of Zechariah, the son of Benaiah, the son of Jeiel, the son of Mattaniah, a Levite of the sons of Asaph, in the midst of the assembly.
Bahnar: Kơplah noh, Yang Bơhngol 'lơ̆ng Kră Yang jur mơ̆t lăm Jahasiêl, kon drŏ-nglo Sachari, sâu Bênaia, sâu i Jêiêl, sâu ach Matania, bơngai Lêwi adrĕch adrung Asap; sư dơ̆ng tŏk-bŏk lu bơngai tơpôl oei akŭm.

English: And he said, “Listen, all you of Judah and you inhabitants of Jerusalem, and you, King Jehoshaphat! Thus says the LORD to you: ‘Do not be afraid nor dismayed because of this great multitude, for the battle is not yours, but God’s.
Bahnar: Sư khan: “Ơ pơtao Jêhôsaphat, bơngai Juđa đơ̆ng jơ̆p pơlei păng kon pơlei oei lăm pơlei Jêrusalem, mơ̆ng bĕ! Kră Yang khan: ‘Lu iĕm 'nĕ kơ hli, 'nĕ tơrơ kơ lu linh lơ kơdrâ̆m 'nâu, yua kơ tơdrong tơblah 'nâu ưh kơ sĭ kơ lu iĕm ôh, 'nâu kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei.’

English: Tomorrow go down against them. They will surely come up by the Ascent of Ziz, and you will find them at the end of the brook before the Wilderness of Jeruel.
Bahnar: Pơgê dơning jur năm tơblah lu sư; to, lu sư tŏk rok trong kuĕl Sis, lu iĕm gô tơ'bơ̆p lu sư tơ tôch kơ thŭng, lăm tơmăn glă Jeruel.

English: You will not need to fight in this battle. Position yourselves, stand still and see the salvation of the LORD, who is with you, O Judah and Jerusalem!’ Do not fear or be dismayed; tomorrow go out against them, for the LORD is with you.”
Bahnar: Lu iĕm huay kơ kăl kơ tơblah; săp bĕ, lu linh oei hreh tơ noh, na lăng tơdrong Kră Yang, Tơ'ngla oei hơdai iĕm gô dŏng pơklaih iĕm. Ơ bơngai Juđa păng kon pơlei Jêrusalem 'nĕ kơ hli 'nĕ kơ tơrơ. Dơning năm tơ'bơ̆p lu sư bĕ! Kră Yang oei hơdai iĕm.”

English: And Jehoshaphat bowed his head with his face to the ground, and all Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem bowed before the LORD, worshiping the LORD.
Bahnar: Jêhôsaphat kŭp kơ̆l drap tơ teh; đĭ-đăng bơngai Juđa păng bơngai oei lăm pơlei Jêrusalem kư̆m kŭp kơ̆l drap tơ teh 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang păng kơkuh kơ Kră Yang.

English: Then the Levites of the children of the Kohathites and of the children of the Korahites stood up to praise the LORD God of Israel with voices loud and high.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai Lêwi gah adrĕch Kôhat păng lu adrĕch Kôra lu sư iung dơ̆ng pơma 'bơ̆r re păng khan bơnê kơkuh kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Isơrael.

English: So they rose early in the morning and went out into the Wilderness of Tekoa; and as they went out, Jehoshaphat stood and said, “Hear me, O Judah and you inhabitants of Jerusalem: Believe in the LORD your God, and you shall be established; believe His prophets, and you shall prosper.”
Bahnar: Truh pơgê đơ̆ng rŏng, lu sư iung đơ̆ng hrôih lĕch năm tơ tơmăn glă Têkôa; kơplah lu sư oei yak, Jêhôsaphat dơ̆ng tơ noh, khan: “Ơ lu bơngai Juđa păng kon pơlei oei lăm pơlei Jêrusalem mơ̆ng bĕ inh: Lui gơnang bĕ kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm, na lu iĕm pran kơjăp; lui bĕ kơ 'bok khan lê̆ adrol Kră Yang, lei na lu iĕm kĕ jei,”

English: And when he had consulted with the people, he appointed those who should sing to the LORD, and who should praise the beauty of holiness, as they went out before the army and were saying: “Praise the LORD, For His mercy endures forever.”
Bahnar: Đang kơ sư đei pơma pơđâu hăm kon pơlei pơla boih, na sư rơih iŏk đei khŭl hơri wă ư-ang kơ Kră Yang rang rŏ hơri bơnê ư-ang Kră Yang 'lơ̆ng rơgoh rang rŏ, lu sư yak adrol kơ khŭl linh, ôr khan: “Bơnê bĕ kơ Kră Yang. Tơdrong Sư 'mêm mơnat oei oei ling-lang.”

English: Now when they began to sing and to praise, the LORD set ambushes against the people of Ammon, Moab, and Mount Seir, who had come against Judah; and they were defeated.
Bahnar: Kơplah lu sư oei hơri kơkuh bơnê, Kră Yang hơmet minh khŭl răp blah bơngai Ammôn, bơngai Môap păng lu bơngai oei 'bơ̆t Kông Sêir oei năm blah bơngai Juđa ră na păng lu sư thuơ đĭ.

English: For the people of Ammon and Moab stood up against the inhabitants of Mount Seir to utterly kill and destroy them. And when they had made an end of the inhabitants of Seir, they helped to destroy one another.
Bahnar: Kon pơlei Ammôn păng kon pơlei Môap năm blah kon pơlei oei 'bơ̆t Kông Sêir, wă pơlôch pơrăm đĭ lê̆ lu sư; dang kơ lu sư blah pơlôch kon pơlei oei 'bơ̆t Kông Sêir boih, na lu sư wih tơblah pơlôch băl tơduă.

English: So when Judah came to a place overlooking the wilderness, they looked toward the multitude; and there were their dead bodies, fallen on the earth. No one had escaped.
Bahnar: Wă kon pơlei Juđa truh tơ anih kơjung, tơmang 'bôh lăm thŭng glă đei khŭl tơpôl linh lơlang lơlap, na kư̆m 'bôh lu akâu bơngai lôch sơ̆k glơch glach kơpal teh ưh kơ đei bu arih.

English: When Jehoshaphat and his people came to take away their spoil, they found among them an abundance of valuables on the dead bodies, and precious jewelry, which they stripped off for themselves, more than they could carry away; and they were three days gathering the spoil because there was so much.
Bahnar: Jêhôsaphat păng lu kon pơlei sư năm wă iŏk tơmam, 'bôh đei tơmam păng akâu bơngai lôch lơ tơpă păng đei tơmam gĭt lơ tơpă dônh iŏk mah pă kĕ đĭ; lu sư dônh mah pêng năr, yua kơ tơmam lơ tơpă.

English: And on the fourth day they assembled in the Valley of Berachah, for there they blessed the LORD; therefore the name of that place was called The Valley of Berachah until this day.
Bahnar: Truh năr mă puăn lu sư akŭm băl tơ lăm Thŭng Bêraka, tơ noh lu sư hơri kơkuh ư-ang kơ Kră Yang; yua kơ thoi noh na đe krao anih noh thŭng Bêraka truh tơ dang ei.

English: Then they returned, every man of Judah and Jerusalem, with Jehoshaphat in front of them, to go back to Jerusalem with joy, for the LORD had made them rejoice over their enemies.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh pơtao Jêhôsaphat yak adrol kơ đĭ-đăng bơngai Juđa păng lu bơngai oei lăm pơlei Jêrusalem chơt hiôk wih tơ pơlei Jêrusalem; Kră Yang ăn kơ lu sư chơt hiôk, yua kơ Kră Yang blah pơrăm đĭ boih linh ayăt.

English: So they came to Jerusalem, with stringed instruments and harps and trumpets, to the house of the LORD.
Bahnar: Lu sư brŏk truh mơ̆t lăm pơlei Jêrusalem, năm truh tơ hnam akŭm tơm Kră Yang reh brŏ dung, tĭng-nĭng păng hlôm keng.

English: And the fear of God was on all the kingdoms of those countries when they heard that the LORD had fought against the enemies of Israel.
Bahnar: Wă lu kon pơlei pơla kơtơ̆ng kơ tơdrong Kră Yang blah pơrăm lu ayăt kơ bơngai Isơrael, na lu sư hli tơpă kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: Then the realm of Jehoshaphat was quiet, for his God gave him rest all around.
Bahnar: Thoi noh, dêh char pơtao Jêhôsaphat hiôk-hian rơnŭk rơnua, yua kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ sư pơdơh hiôk-hian puăn pah.

English: So Jehoshaphat was king over Judah. He was thirty-five years old when he became king, and he reigned twenty-five years in Jerusalem. His mother’s name was Azubah the daughter of Shilhi.
Bahnar: Thoi noh Jêhôsaphat pơm pơtao pơgơ̆r dêh char Juđa iŏk đơ̆ng sư 'nao pêng-jĭt pơđăm sơnăm pơgơ̆r oei lăm pơlei tih Jêrusalem 'bar-jĭt pơđăm sơnăm mĕ sư anăn Asuba kon drŏ-kăn Silhi.

English: And he walked in the way of his father Asa, and did not turn aside from it, doing what was right in the sight of the LORD.
Bahnar: Sư yak pơm kiơ̆ trong 'bă sư Asa, sư ưh kơ weh yak trong nai ôh; sư pơm 'lơ̆ng trŏ 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang.

English: Nevertheless the high places were not taken away, for as yet the people had not directed their hearts to the God of their fathers.
Bahnar: Mă-lei sư ưh tam mă pơrăm ôh anih kơjung păng kon pơlei ưh tam mă jao jơhngơ̆m kơ Kră Yang 'bok lu sư.

English: Now the rest of the acts of Jehoshaphat, first and last, indeed they are written in the book of Jehu the son of Hanani, which is mentioned in the book of the kings of Israel.
Bahnar: Dôm tơdrong jang nai Jêhôsaphat pơm đơ̆ng blŭng-a truh tơ tôch đei chih răk lăm sơ̆p hla bơar hơ'mon Jêhu, kon drŏ-nglo Hanani, tơdrong hơ'mon noh đei chih răk boih lăm sơ̆p hla bơar lu pơtao Isơrael.

English: After this Jehoshaphat king of Judah allied himself with Ahaziah king of Israel, who acted very wickedly.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ noh Jêhôsaphat pơtao Juđa pơgơ̆p hăm Ahasia pơtao Isơrael, bơngai mă pơm kơnê̆.

English: And he allied himself with him to make ships to go to Tarshish, and they made the ships in Ezion Geber.
Bahnar: Bre sư pơgơ̆p băl pơm duk tơ Êsiôn Gêber wă năm tơ pơlei Tarsis.

English: But Eliezer the son of Dodavah of Mareshah prophesied against Jehoshaphat, saying, “Because you have allied yourself with Ahaziah, the LORD has destroyed your works.” Then the ships were wrecked, so that they were not able to go to Tarshish.
Bahnar: Kơplah noh Êliêser kon drŏ-nglo Dôdawahu đơ̆ng pơlei Marêsa khan lê̆ adrol gah Jêhôsaphat khan; “Yua kơ ih đei pơgơ̆p boih hăm Ahasia, Kră Yang gô pơrăm lê̆ tơdrong jang mă ih đei pơm boih.” Duk mă lu sư pơm noh pơchah, lei na duk noh ưh kơ gơh năm truh tơ Tarsis ôh.

English: And Jehoshaphat rested with his fathers, and was buried with his fathers in the City of David. Then Jehoram his son reigned in his place.
Bahnar: Jêhôsaphat lôch năm oei hơdai hăm lu 'bok sư, đe 'bŭ sư hơdai hăm lu 'bok sư lăm Pơlei Đawit; Jêhôram kon drŏ-nglo sư iung pơgơ̆r pơtrơp sư.

English: He had brothers, the sons of Jehoshaphat: Azariah, Jehiel, Zechariah, Azaryahu, Michael, and Shephatiah; all these were the sons of Jehoshaphat king of Israel.
Bahnar: Sư đei lu oh sư, kon drŏ-nglo Jêhôsaphat noh Asaria, Jêhiêl, Secharia, Asariahu, Michael păng Sêphatia; đĭ-đăng lu đe noh kon drŏ-nglo Jêhôsaphat pơtao Isơrael.

English: Their father gave them great gifts of silver and gold and precious things, with fortified cities in Judah; but he gave the kingdom to Jehoram, because he was the firstborn.
Bahnar: 'Bă sư pơtao đei ăn boih kơ lu sư lơ mŭk tơmam, hu maih, lu mŭk tơmam gĭt păng jao ăn lu pơlei kơjăp lăm char Juđa; mă-lei jao ăn kơ Jêhôram pơm pơtao, yua kơ sư kon kơdră.

English: Now when Jehoram was established over the kingdom of his father, he strengthened himself and killed all his brothers with the sword, and also others of the princes of Israel.
Bahnar: Kơplah Jêhôram tŏk pơm pơtao pơtrơp đơ̆ng 'bă sư, wă sư pran kơjăp boih sư iŏk đao gưm pơlôch đĭ lu oh sư hăm lu yŏng pơgơ̆r Isơrael.

English: Jehoram was thirty-two years old when he became king, and he reigned eight years in Jerusalem.
Bahnar: Jêhôram 'nao pêng-jĭt 'bar sơnăm kơplah sư tŏk pơm pơtao păng sư pơgơ̆r đei tơhngam sơnăm lăm pơlei tih Jêrusalem.

English: And he walked in the way of the kings of Israel, just as the house of Ahab had done, for he had the daughter of Ahab as a wife; and he did evil in the sight of the LORD.
Bahnar: Sư yak kiơ̆ trong lu pơtao Isơrael, kiơ̆ thoi Ahap đei pơm boih, yua kơ sư iŏk oei kơ kon adruh Ahap pơm akăn; sư pơm tơdrong kơnê̆ dêh 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang.

English: Yet the LORD would not destroy the house of David, because of the covenant that He had made with David, and since He had promised to give a lamp to him and to his sons forever.
Bahnar: Lei ră Kră Yang ưh kơ wă pơlôch Sư adrĕch pơm pơtao, yua kơ Sư đei pơgơ̆p boih hăm Đawit, Sư đei pơkă boih wă ăn minh pôm ŭnh kơđeng kơ adrĕch Đawit kon sâu sư ling-lang, hlŏng hloi.

English: In his days Edom revolted against Judah’s authority, and made a king over themselves.
Bahnar: Lăm chăl Jêhôram pơgơ̆r, char Eđôm iung blah lu bơngai Juđa păng pôk pơtao kơdih lu sư.

English: So Jehoram went out with his officers, and all his chariots with him. And he rose by night and attacked the Edomites who had surrounded him and the captains of the chariots.
Bahnar: Jêhôram hăm lu yŏng pơgơ̆r linh păng lu gre aseh sư, năm blah Eđôm mă-lei linh Eđôm đĭ wang tăp kơ sư păng lu linh hao gre aseh sư mă-lei lu sư iung kơdâu lĕch hlôi kơmăng.

English: Thus Edom has been in revolt against Judah’s authority to this day. At that time Libnah revolted against his rule, because he had forsaken the LORD God of his fathers.
Bahnar: Lei na bơngai Eđôm iung blah Juđa dĭng truh dang ei. Kŭm lăm kơplah noh kon pơlei Lipna kư̆m iung blah Jêhôram dơ̆ng, yua kơ sư achăng lê̆ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu 'bok sư.

English: Moreover he made high places in the mountains of Judah, and caused the inhabitants of Jerusalem to commit harlotry, and led Judah astray.
Bahnar: Sư kư̆m pơm ming lu anih kơjung tơ kơpal groi char Juđa, pơhlŭ pơtơm kon pơlei mă oei lăm pơlei tih Jêrusalem pơm kơnê̆ oei sa kư̆ kă pơm kơ Juđa wơ̆l jrok.

English: And a letter came to him from Elijah the prophet, saying, Thus says the LORD God of your father David: Because you have not walked in the ways of Jehoshaphat your father, or in the ways of Asa king of Judah
Bahnar: Êli bơngai khan lê̆ adrol chih hla bơar ăn kơ Jêhôram, khan: “Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Đawit, 'bok ih, khan: ‘Yua kơ ih ưh kơ yak kiơ̆ kơ trong Jêhôsaphat 'bă ih păng kư̆m ưh kơ kiơ̆ trong Asa, pơtao Juđa

English: but have walked in the way of the kings of Israel, and have made Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem to play the harlot like the harlotry of the house of Ahab, and also have killed your brothers, those of your father’s household, who were better than yourself
Bahnar: Na đĭ kiơ̆ trong lu pơtao bơngai Isơrael, pơhlŭ pơtơm kon pơlei Juđa păng kon pơlei lăm Jêrusalem ngôi kư̆ kă kơkuh kơ rup Yang thoi adrĕch Ahap đei pơm boih păng kư̆m pơlôch boih lu oh ih đơ̆ng hnam 'bă ih, lu sư arih sa 'lơ̆ng hloh kơ ih

English: behold, the LORD will strike your people with a serious affliction—your children, your wives, and all your possessions
Bahnar: Lăng âu Kră Yang gô ăn tơdrong truh pơmat lu kon pơlei ih, lu kon sâu ih, truh tơ lu akăn ih, kư̆m pơrăm truh lu mŭk tơmam ih.

English: and you will become very sick with a disease of your intestines, until your intestines come out by reason of the sickness, day by day.
Bahnar: Gah ih gô jĭ pơmat dêh rim năr rai dêh dĭng mah klơm klak ih ôm lĕch tơ 'nguaih.’ ”

English: Moreover the LORD stirred up against Jehoram the spirit of the Philistines and the Arabians who were near the Ethiopians.
Bahnar: Kră Yang kư̆m pơm ăn jơhngơ̆m lu bơngai Philistin păng kon pơlei Arâp mă oei jê̆ kon pơlei Êthiôpi, iung blah Jêhôram.

English: And they came up into Judah and invaded it, and carried away all the possessions that were found in the king’s house, and also his sons and his wives, so that there was not a son left to him except Jehoahaz, the youngest of his sons.
Bahnar: Lu sư wang blah iŏk char Juđa, blah iŏk đĭ hloi mŭk tơmam lăm hnam pơtao, rôp ba pơm bơnă đĭ lu kon drŏ-nglo lu akăn sư, oei lê̆ pă minh 'nu kon hơdruch sư Ahasia.

English: After all this the LORD struck him in his intestines with an incurable disease.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ lu tơdrong noh, Kră Yang pơm kơ sư jĭ lăm klak ưh kơ layơ klaih.

English: Then it happened in the course of time, after the end of two years, that his intestines came out because of his sickness; so he died in severe pain. And his people made no burning for him, like the burning for his fathers.
Bahnar: Lăm khei 'năr ei, 'bơ̆t wă jê̆ đĭ sơnăm mă 'bar klơm klak sư ôm lĕch tơ 'nguaih, sư lôch pơmat dêh; kon pơlei kư̆m ưh pă đei soh 'long 'bâu phu thoi 'bă sư.

English: He was thirty-two years old when he became king. He reigned in Jerusalem eight years and, to no one’s sorrow, departed. However they buried him in the City of David, but not in the tombs of the kings.
Bahnar: Sư pơm pơtao kơplah sư 'nao pêng-jĭt 'bar sơnăm sư pơgơ̆r đei tơhngam sơnăm lăm pơlei tih Jêrusalem; sư lôch ưh kơ đei bu 'mêm kơ sư, đe 'bŭ sư lăm Pơlei Đawit, mă-lei ưh kơ đei 'bŭ hơdai lăm bơsat lu pơtao ôh.

English: Then the inhabitants of Jerusalem made Ahaziah his youngest son king in his place, for the raiders who came with the Arabians into the camp had killed all the older sons. So Ahaziah the son of Jehoram, king of Judah, reigned.
Bahnar: Lu kon pơlei oei lăm Jêrusalem pôk Ahasia kon adruch Jêhôram, pơm pơtao đe Juđa pơtrơp 'bă sư yua kơ khŭl linh hơdai hăm linh Arâp mơ̆t blah lăm kơđông linh sư, na pơlôch đĭ lu kon drŏ-nglo 'nhŏng kơ sư, thoi noh Ahasia kon drŏ-nglo hơdruch Jêhôram iung pơm pơtao đe Juđa.

English: Ahaziah was forty-two years old when he became king, and he reigned one year in Jerusalem. His mother’s name was Athaliah the granddaughter of Omri.
Bahnar: Ahasia 'nao lăp 'bar-jĭt 'bar sơnăm năr sư iung pơm pơtao; sư pơgơ̆r minh sơnăm lăm pơlei tih Jêrusalem; mĕ sư anăn Athalia, Sâu drŏ-kăn Ômri.

English: He also walked in the ways of the house of Ahab, for his mother advised him to do wickedly.
Bahnar: Sư kư̆m pơm kiơ̆ trong Ahap; yua kơ mĕ sư pơhlŭ sư pơm tơdrong kơnê̆.

English: Therefore he did evil in the sight of the LORD, like the house of Ahab; for they were his counselors after the death of his father, to his destruction.
Bahnar: Sư pơm lơ tơdrong kơnê̆ 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang, kư̆m thoi adrĕch Ahap đei pơm boih yua kơ đơ̆ng rŏng kơ 'bă sư lôch, Kon Sâu Ahap chă đon hơlĕnh pơhlŭ sư, wă pơm kơ sư răm.

English: He also followed their advice, and went with Jehoram the son of Ahab king of Israel to war against Hazael king of Syria at Ramoth Gilead; and the Syrians wounded Joram.
Bahnar: Sư kư̆m hlŭ kiơ̆ kơ đe noh na yak kiơ̆ Jôram kon drŏ-nglo Ahap, pơtao Isơrael, năm blah tơ pơlei Ramôt Gileat, wă tơblah hăm Hasael pơtao Siri; kon pơlei Siri blah Jôram rơka.

English: Then he returned to Jezreel to recover from the wounds which he had received at Ramah, when he fought against Hazael king of Syria. And Azariah the son of Jehoram, king of Judah, went down to see Jehoram the son of Ahab in Jezreel, because he was sick.
Bahnar: Na sư wih brŏk tơ pơlei Jesreel, wă ming rơka sư đơ̆ng tơblah 'bơ̆t pơlei Rama, tơblah hăm Hasael, pơtao Siri, Ahasia kon drŏ-nglo Jêhôram pơtao Juđa jur tơ Jêsreel wă năm lăng Jôram kon drŏ-nglo Ahap.

English: His going to Joram was God’s occasion for Ahaziah’s downfall; for when he arrived, he went out with Jehoram against Jehu the son of Nimshi, whom the LORD had anointed to cut off the house of Ahab.
Bahnar: Tơdrong Ahasia năm lăng Jôram jĭ rơka noh đơ̆ng Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn wă phak sư; wă sư năm truh tơ noh, kiơ̆ Jôram năm tơ'bơ̆p Jêhu kon drŏ-nglo Nimsi, bơngai mă Kră Yang rơih, wă kơ sư năm blah pơrăm adrĕch Ahap.

English: And it happened, when Jehu was executing judgment on the house of Ahab, and found the princes of Judah and the sons of Ahaziah’s brothers who served Ahaziah, that he killed them.
Bahnar: Kơplah Jêhu năm blah adrĕch Ahap, tơ'bơ̆p lu yŏng bơngai Juđa, păng lu kon drŏ-nglo lu 'nhŏng oh Ahasia, lu bơngai mă tơgŭm Ahasia, na sư pơlôch đĭ lu sư hloi.

English: Then he searched for Ahaziah; and they caught him (he was hiding in Samaria), and brought him to Jehu. When they had killed him, they buried him, “because,” they said, “he is the son of Jehoshaphat, who sought the LORD with all his heart.” So the house of Ahaziah had no one to assume power over the kingdom.
Bahnar: Sư kư̆m chă Ahasia oei kơdâu ôn lăm pơlei Samari; đe rôp, chông ba sư tơ Jêhu, đơ̆ng noh pơlôch sư. Đe 'bŭ sư; “Yua kơ đe khan, sư kon drŏ-nglo Jêhôsaphat, bơngai mă chă Kră Yang hăm đĭ jơhngơ̆m. “Lăm adrĕch Ahasia ưh pă đei bu dơ̆ng pơgơ̆r pơtrơp pơm pơtao lăm char sư.

English: Now when Athaliah the mother of Ahaziah saw that her son was dead, she arose and destroyed all the royal heirs of the house of Judah.
Bahnar: Wă Athalia, mĕ Ahasia 'bôh kon drŏ-nglo sư đe pơlôch, na sư iung blah pơrăm adrĕch pơm pơtao Juđa.

English: But Jehoshabeath, the daughter of the king, took Joash the son of Ahaziah, and stole him away from among the king’s sons who were being murdered, and put him and his nurse in a bedroom. So Jehoshabeath, the daughter of King Jehoram, the wife of Jehoiada the priest (for she was the sister of Ahaziah), hid him from Athaliah so that she did not kill him.
Bahnar: Mă-lei Jêhôseba, kon adruh pơtao Jêhôram, rôp ôn lê̆ Jôas, kon drŏ-nglo Ahasia đơ̆ng tŏk-bŏk lu kon drŏ-nglo pơtao mă đe wă pơlôch đĭ na ôn lê̆ sư lăm anih tep hơdai hăm drŏ-kăn rong sư. Thoi noh Jêhôseba, kon drŏ-kăn pơtao Jêhôram, akăn 'bok soi Jêhôiada yua kơ sư oh drŏ-kăn Ahasia, ôn lê̆ Jôas đơ̆ng Athalia, lei na Athalia ưh kơ gơh pơlôch

English: And he was hidden with them in the house of God for six years, while Athaliah reigned over the land.
Bahnar: Jôas đe ôn lê̆ sư lăm tơdrâu sơnăm tơ lăm hnam akŭm Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei kơplah yă Athalia pơgơ̆r char noh.

English: In the seventh year Jehoiada strengthened himself, and made a covenant with the captains of hundreds: Azariah the son of Jeroham, Ishmael the son of Jehohanan, Azariah the son of Obed, Maaseiah the son of Adaiah, and Elishaphat the son of Zichri.
Bahnar: Lăm sơnăm mă tơpơh, Jêhôiada iung đei jơhngơ̆m nuih pran, pơgơ̆p hơdai hăm lu yŏng pơgơ̆r minh-hrĕng 'nu linh, noh Asaria kon drŏ-nglo Jêrôham, Ismael kon drŏ-nglo Jêhôhanan, Asaria kon drŏ-nglo Ôbet, Maaseia kon drŏ-nglo Ađaia păng Êlisaphat kon drŏ-nglo Sikri.

English: And they went throughout Judah and gathered the Levites from all the cities of Judah, and the chief fathers of Israel, and they came to Jerusalem.
Bahnar: Lu sư chă năm jơ̆p kơ dêh char Juđa lu sư akŭm lu bơngai Lêwi păng lu yŏng kơdră adrĕch bơngai Isơrael đơ̆ng jơ̆p pơlei lăm char Jut; na lu sư năm tơ pơlei Jêrusalem.

English: Then all the assembly made a covenant with the king in the house of God. And he said to them, “Behold, the king’s son shall reign, as the LORD has said of the sons of David.
Bahnar: Đĭ khŭl akŭm lu sư pơm tơdrong pơgơ̆p hăm pơtao lăm hnam Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei. Jêhôiada pơma hăm lu sư: “'Nâu kon drŏ-nglo pơtao sư gô pơgơ̆r kiơ̆ thoi nơ̆r Kră Yang đei khan lê̆ gah kon sâu Đawit.

English: This is what you shall do: One-third of you entering on the Sabbath, of the priests and the Levites, shall be keeping watch over the doors
Bahnar: 'Nâu tơdrong lu iĕm athei pơm: Minh lăm pêng 'nu lu iĕm, lu 'bok soi păng lu bơngai Lêwi, bơ̆jang lăm năr Sa'bat, athei lu wei 'măng jang

English: one-third shall be at the king’s house; and one-third at the Gate of the Foundation. All the people shall be in the courts of the house of the LORD.
Bahnar: minh lăm pêng lu iĕm gô gak lăm hnam pơtao păng minh lăm pêng dơ̆ng gô dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t 'Măng Jang Hơnă; păng đĭ-đăng lu kon pơlei gô dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t cham hnam Kră Yang.

English: But let no one come into the house of the LORD except the priests and those of the Levites who serve. They may go in, for they are holy; but all the people shall keep the watch of the LORD.
Bahnar: 'Nĕ ăn kơ minh 'nu bu mơ̆t lăm hnam Kră Yang ôh 'nguaih kơ lu 'bok soi păng lu bơngai Lêwi mă awih awăn; lu sư gô mơ̆t, yua kơ lu sư 'lơ̆ng rơgoh; đĭ-đăng kon pơlei athei wei răk nơ̆r Kră Yang tơtă.

English: And the Levites shall surround the king on all sides, every man with his weapons in his hand; and whoever comes into the house, let him be put to death. You are to be with the king when he comes in and when he goes out.”
Bahnar: Lu bơngai Lêwi dơ̆ng tăp dăr kơ pơtao, rim 'nu chĕp khêl đao; bơngai bu mơ̆t lăm hnam Kră Yang gô pơlôch; lu iĕm athei bơwei pơtao mă sư mơ̆t dah sư lĕch.”

English: So the Levites and all Judah did according to all that Jehoiada the priest commanded. And each man took his men who were to be on duty on the Sabbath, with those who were going off duty on the Sabbath; for Jehoiada the priest had not dismissed the divisions.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai Lêwi păng đĭ-đăng lu kon pơlei bơngai Juđa pơm kiơ̆ nơ̆r Jêhôiada 'bok soi đei athei tơtă; rim 'nu lu sư athei pơkeh rim tơdrong jang năr Sa'bat hơdai hăm lu bơngai mă oei wă mơ̆t jang lăm năr Sa'bat, yua kơ Jêhôiada 'bok soi ưh kơ ăn kơ minh 'nu bu pơdơh.

English: And Jehoiada the priest gave to the captains of hundreds the spears and the large and small shields which had belonged to King David, that were in the temple of God.
Bahnar: Jêhôiada 'bok soi đei asong ăn kơ lu yŏng pơgơ̆r minh-hrĕng 'nu linh chĕp tơju, khêl tih iĕ đơ̆ng Đawit tah lê̆ lăm hnam Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: Then he set all the people, every man with his weapon in his hand, from the right side of the temple to the left side of the temple, along by the altar and by the temple, all around the king.
Bahnar: Sư ăn kơ lu linh noh chĕp khêl đao dơ̆ng tăp dăr kơ pơtao, iŏk đơ̆ng gah yă-nơ̆m kơ hnam akŭm truh tơ gah gơal kơ hnam akŭm jê̆ chơnang soi.

English: And they brought out the king’s son, put the crown on him, gave him the Testimony, and made him king. Then Jehoiada and his sons anointed him, and said, “Long live the king!”
Bahnar: Jêhôiada hăm lu kon drŏ-nglo Sư chông kon pơtao lĕch, pơyơ̆l ăn kơ sư môk pơtao păng ăn kơ sư sơ̆p hla bơar khôi juăt, na pôk sư pơm pơtao; sư tuh đak rơmă tơ kơ̆l Jôas păng khan: “Pơtao arih ling-lang!”

English: Now when Athaliah heard the noise of the people running and praising the king, she came to the people in the temple of the LORD.
Bahnar: Wă Athalia kơtơ̆ng jơwa kon pơlei kơdâu, ôr kơkuh ư-ang kơ pơtao, sư năm tơ kon pơlei tơ hnam Kră Yang.

English: When she looked, there was the king standing by his pillar at the entrance; and the leaders and the trumpeters were by the king. All the people of the land were rejoicing and blowing trumpets, also the singers with musical instruments, and those who led in praise. So Athaliah tore her clothes and said, “Treason! Treason!”
Bahnar: Sư 'bôh pơtao dơ̆ng jê̆ jrăng 'bơ̆t trong wă mơ̆t; lu yŏng linh păng lu bơngai hlôm keng dơ̆ng jê̆ pơtao; đĭ-đăng kon pơlei oei lăm char chơt hiôk 'nă hal hlôm keng, kư̆m đei lu bơngai hơri pơtơm pôk pơư reh brŏ, na kơkuh bơnê ư-ang kơ pơtao. Athalia hơloh hek ao sư kơdih na ôr re khan: Blah blơ̆, blơ̆ boih.

English: And Jehoiada the priest brought out the captains of hundreds who were set over the army, and said to them, “Take her outside under guard, and slay with the sword whoever follows her.” For the priest had said, “Do not kill her in the house of the LORD.”
Bahnar: 'Bok soi Jêhôiada athei lu yŏng pơgơ̆r minh-hrĕng linh păng khan kơ lu sư: “Chông tơlĕch yă âu tơ 'nguaih bĕ, bơngai bu kiơ̆ sư gô pơlôch hăm đao gưm.” 'Bok soi đei khan boih: “'Nĕ kơ pơlôch sư tơ lăm hnam Kră Yang ôh.”

English: So they seized her; and she went by way of the entrance of the Horse Gate into the king’s house, and they killed her there.
Bahnar: Na đe rôp yă ei 'bơ̆t 'Măng Jang Aseh, na đe pơlôch hloi sư tơ noh.

English: Then Jehoiada made a covenant between himself, the people, and the king, that they should be the LORD’s people.
Bahnar: Jêhôiada pơgơ̆p hăm lu kon pơlei păng pơtao, wă kơ lu sư jing kon pơlei pơla Kră Yang.

English: And all the people went to the temple of Baal, and tore it down. They broke in pieces its altars and images, and killed Mattan the priest of Baal before the altars.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng lu kon pơlei năm tơ hnam yang Baal, pơrăm lê̆ lu chơnang soi păng rup man sư păng pơlôch Matan 'bok soi kơ yang Baal 'bơ̆t anăp chơnang soi.

English: Also Jehoiada appointed the oversight of the house of the LORD to the hand of the priests, the Levites, whom David had assigned in the house of the LORD, to offer the burnt offerings of the LORD, as it is written in the Law of Moses, with rejoicing and with singing, as it was established by David.
Bahnar: Jêhôiada jao kơ lu 'bok soi bơngai Lêwi wei-lăng hnam akŭm Kră Yang, wă pơyơ̆r tơmam soi 'buh kơ Kră Yang, rok thoi lăm sơ̆p hla bơar Khôi Juăt Môis đei chih boih, hơdai hăm hơri ư-ang chơt hiôk kiơ̆ kơ Đawit đei pơkă boih.
