English: And he set the gatekeepers at the gates of the house of the LORD, so that no one who was in any way unclean should enter.
Bahnar: Sư kư̆m pơjao ăn kơ lu bơngai gak wei-lăng lu 'măng jang hnam Kră Yang, wă ưh kơ đei bơngai bu 'mê̆-'mach kơnê̆ mơ̆t tơ noh.

English: Then he took the captains of hundreds, the nobles, the governors of the people, and all the people of the land, and brought the king down from the house of the LORD; and they went through the Upper Gate to the king’s house, and set the king on the throne of the kingdom.
Bahnar: Sư pơtơm lu yŏng pơgơ̆r minh-hrĕng linh, lu kră mă đe pơyom păng lu yŏng pơgơ̆r kon pơlei, hăm kon pơlei lăm tơring char, năm ba pơtao lĕch đơ̆ng lăm hnam Kră Yang jur năm tơ hnam pơtao mơ̆t rok trong 'Măng Jang Kơpal, wă ăn kơ sư hơ-oei 'bơ̆t tang-dŏ pơtao pơgơ̆r dêh char.

English: So all the people of the land rejoiced; and the city was quiet, for they had slain Athaliah with the sword.
Bahnar: Thoi noh đĭ-đăng kon pơlei oei lăm char ei chơt hiôk chhôk 'nă hal păng lăm pơlei tih Jêrusalem hiôk-hian, đang kơ pơlôch lê̆ Athalia hăm đao gưm.

English: Joash was seven years old when he became king, and he reigned forty years in Jerusalem. His mother’s name was Zibiah of Beersheba.
Bahnar: Jôas 'nao tơpơh sơnăm năr sư pơm pơtao; sư pơgơ̆r puăn-jĭt sơnăm lăm pơlei tih Jêrusalem; mĕ sư anăn Sibia đơ̆ng pơlei Bêrsêba

English: Joash did what was right in the sight of the LORD all the days of Jehoiada the priest.
Bahnar: Jôas pơm tơdrong 'lơ̆ng tơpăt 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang lăm đĭ sơnăm Jêhôiada pơm 'bok soi.

English: And Jehoiada took two wives for him, and he had sons and daughters.
Bahnar: Jêhôiada chă ăn kơ Jôas 'bar 'nu akăn, sư đei kon hơ'lơ̆p drŏ-nglo drŏ-kăn.

English: Now it happened after this that Joash set his heart on repairing the house of the LORD.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ noh, Jôas wă pơdơ̆ng ming Hnam Kră Yang.

English: Then he gathered the priests and the Levites, and said to them, “Go out to the cities of Judah, and gather from all Israel money to repair the house of your God from year to year, and see that you do it quickly.” However the Levites did not do it quickly.
Bahnar: Sư krao akŭm lu 'bok soi păng lu bơngai Lêwi, na khan: “Năm tơ jơ̆p-jang kơ pơlei Juđa bĕ, ra pơpôi jên kăk đơ̆ng lu bơngai Isơrael 'măn rim sơnăm wă hơmet ming Hnam Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm; pơm bĕ tơdrong 'nâu mă kuăng.” Mă-lei lu bơngai Lêwi pơhiơ̆ dêh.

English: So the king called Jehoiada the chief priest, and said to him, “Why have you not required the Levites to bring in from Judah and from Jerusalem the collection, according to the commandment of Moses the servant of the LORD and of the assembly of Israel, for the tabernacle of witness?”
Bahnar: Pơtao krao Jêhôiada 'bok soi tơm păng khan: “Yua kơ kiơ ih ưh kơ pơkă kơ lu bơngai Lêwi chĕp ba jên lu bơngai Juđa păng lu bơngai oei lăm pơlei Jêrusalem ra ăn kiơ̆ kơ Môis đĭch đam Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei mă đei pơkă boih hăm lu kon pơlei Isơrael athei pơyơ̆r ăn kơ Bơsŭn Roi Tơbăt?”

English: For the sons of Athaliah, that wicked woman, had broken into the house of God, and had also presented all the dedicated things of the house of the LORD to the Baals.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng lu kon drŏ-nglo Athalia yă pơm kơnê̆ dêh noh, teh 'măng mơ̆t tơtông lăm hnam Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu sư kư̆m iŏk đĭ tơmam rơgoh đơ̆ng Hnam Kră Yang pơyơ̆r ăn kơ yang Baal.

English: Then at the king’s command they made a chest, and set it outside at the gate of the house of the LORD.
Bahnar: Thoi noh pơtao athei đe pơ̆ng minh pôm hom, lê̆ 'bơ̆t 'măng jang Hnam Kră Yang.

English: And they made a proclamation throughout Judah and Jerusalem to bring to the LORD the collection that Moses the servant of God had imposed on Israel in the wilderness.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh năm roi tơbăt tơ jơ̆p lăm char Juđa păng pơlei Jêrusalem rim 'nu athei năm pơyơ̆r jên ăn kơ Kră Yang kiơ̆ thoi Môis đĭch đam Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei đei pơkă ăn boih kơ lu bơngai Isơrael tơ lăm tơmăn glă.

English: Then all the leaders and all the people rejoiced, brought their contributions, and put them into the chest until all had given.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng lu yŏng pơgơ̆r păng lu kon pơlei chơt hiôk năm pơyơ̆r ba jên tah lăm hom noh mah 'bĕnh.

English: So it was, at that time, when the chest was brought to the king’s official by the hand of the Levites, and when they saw that there was much money, that the king’s scribe and the high priest’s officer came and emptied the chest, and took it and returned it to its place. Thus they did day by day, and gathered money in abundance.
Bahnar: Rim wơ̆t lu bơngai Lêwi tung tơmơ̆t hom, na năm ba ăn kơ lu bơngai yŏng bơ̆jang kơ pơtao, lu Sư 'bôh jên 'bĕnh, bơngai chih hla bơar lăm hnam pơtao păng lu bơngai bơ̆jang kơ 'bok soi tơm năm tuh jên đơ̆ng lăm hom noh, đơ̆ng noh năm dan 'măn lê̆ 'bơ̆t anih đêl dơ̆ng. Rim năr lu sư pơm thoi noh, na đei ra pơpôi jên lơ tơpă.

English: The king and Jehoiada gave it to those who did the work of the service of the house of the LORD; and they hired masons and carpenters to repair the house of the LORD, and also those who worked in iron and bronze to restore the house of the LORD.
Bahnar: Pơtao păng Jêhôiada jao jên noh ăn kơ lu bơngai wei-lăng bơ̆jang lăm Hnam Kră Yang; lu sư apah lu bơngai jang man păng lu bơngai ot 'long, wă pơdơ̆ng ming Hnam Kră Yang; păng wă apah lu bơngai hơjơ̆m bơsei păng kong wă hơmet ming Hnam Kră Yang.

English: So the workmen labored, and the work was completed by them; they restored the house of God to its original condition and reinforced it.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai wei-lăng bơ̆jang, pơtơm bơ̆jang, Tơdrong jang rai 'lơ̆ng đơ̆ng lu sư pơm hơmet. Lu Sư hơmet ming hnam Kră Yang kiơ̆ thoi so păng pơm ming kơjăp hloh.

English: When they had finished, they brought the rest of the money before the king and Jehoiada; they made from it articles for the house of the LORD, articles for serving and offering, spoons and vessels of gold and silver. And they offered burnt offerings in the house of the LORD continually all the days of Jehoiada.
Bahnar: Đang kơ lu sư pơm keh boih lu sư năm ba lu jên mă rơkah noh kơ pơtao păng Jêhôiada; lu sư yua lu jên noh pơm tơmam wă yua lăm Hnam Kră Yang, thoi wă pơyơ̆r tơmam soi 'buh, lu pơnhan chhĕr păng lu tơmam đe pơm păng hu maih. Đĭ lăm chăl Jêhôiada đe năm pơyơ̆r tơmam soi lăm Hnam Kră Yang ling-lang.

English: But Jehoiada grew old and was full of days, and he died; he was one hundred and thirty years old when he died.
Bahnar: Jêhôiada đĭ kră sơnăm đĭ lơ, sư arih đei minh-hrĕng pêng-jĭt sơnăm na Sư lôch.

English: And they buried him in the City of David among the kings, because he had done good in Israel, both toward God and His house.
Bahnar: Đe 'bŭ sư hơdai hăm lu pơtao lăm Pơlei Đawit, yua kơ sư jang 'lơ̆ng tơgŭm lu bơngai Isơrael, bơ̆jang kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei păng đei pơdơ̆ng hơmet ming hnam akŭm Tơm Sư.

English: Now after the death of Jehoiada the leaders of Judah came and bowed down to the king. And the king listened to them.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ Jêhôiada lôch boih, lu yŏng pơgơ̆r bơngai Juđa năm kơkuh pơtơm pơtao. Na pơtao lui kiơ̆ nơ̆r lu sư pơhlŭ.

English: Therefore they left the house of the LORD God of their fathers, and served wooden images and idols; and wrath came upon Judah and Jerusalem because of their trespass.
Bahnar: Lu sư achăng lê̆ Hnam Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei 'bok lu sư, na kơkuh kơ yang Asêra păng kơkuh kơ lu rup man; đơ̆ng tơdrong yoch 'nâu, na đei Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei hil mĭl kơ lu bơngai Juđa păng kon pơlei Jêrusalem.

English: Yet He sent prophets to them, to bring them back to the LORD; and they testified against them, but they would not listen.
Bahnar: Kră Yang wơh lu 'bok khan lê̆ adrol năm tơ lu sư, wă dui lu sư wih brŏk tơ Kră Yang; mă-lei lu sư ưh kơ wă mơ̆ng.

English: Then the Spirit of God came upon Zechariah the son of Jehoiada the priest, who stood above the people, and said to them, “Thus says God: ‘Why do you transgress the commandments of the LORD, so that you cannot prosper? Because you have forsaken the LORD, He also has forsaken you.’ ”
Bahnar: Yang Bơhngol 'lơ̆ng đơ̆ng Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei pơdrŭt Sachari, kon drŏ-nglo Jêhôiada 'bok soi, sư iung dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t anăp lu kon pơlei na khan: “Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei khan thoi âu: ‘Yua kơ kiơ lu iĕm ưh kơ kiơ̆ nơ̆r Kră Yang tơtă? Thoi noh lu iĕm ưh kơ đei pŭn hiôk ôh. Yua kơ lu iĕm achăng lê̆ Kră Yang boih păng Sư kư̆m achăng lê̆ lu iĕm.’ ”

English: So they conspired against him, and at the command of the king they stoned him with stones in the court of the house of the LORD.
Bahnar: Lu sư hil plơ̆ kơ Sachari, kiơ̆ đơ̆ng pơtao athei klơ̆m pơlôch hăm tơmo 'bơ̆t cham Hnam Kră Yang.

English: Thus Joash the king did not remember the kindness which Jehoiada his father had done to him, but killed his son; and as he died, he said, “The LORD look on it, and repay!”
Bahnar: Thoi noh, pơtao Jôas đĭ hiơt boih kơ Jêhôiada 'bă Sachari đei pơm 'lơ̆ng kơ sư, mă-lei sư pơlôch lê̆ kon Jêhôiada. 'Bơ̆t Sachari wă jê̆ lôch sư khan. “Hơpơi apinh Kră Yang lăng păng iung kơting.”

English: So it happened in the spring of the year that the army of Syria came up against him; and they came to Judah and Jerusalem, and destroyed all the leaders of the people from among the people, and sent all their spoil to the king of Damascus.
Bahnar: Lăp sơnăm noh wă jê̆ tôch, đei lu linh char Siri iung blah Jôas; lu bơngai năm blah truh tơ char Juđa păng pơlei Jêrusalem, pơlôch đĭ lu yŏng pơgơ̆r lăm kon pơlei păng chơ ba dôm tơmam mă đêl lu sư blah iŏk ăn kơ pơtao lu sư tơ Đamas.

English: For the army of the Syrians came with a small company of men; but the LORD delivered a very great army into their hand, because they had forsaken the LORD God of their fathers. So they executed judgment against Joash.
Bahnar: Khŭl linh Siri năm blah lăp tŏ sĕt đĕch ră, mă-lei Kră Yang jao boih lu linh lơ noh lăm ti lu sư, yua kơ lu bơngai Juđa achăng lê̆ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei 'bok lu sư. Na lu sư rôp sek tơlang Jôas.

English: And when they had withdrawn from him (for they left him severely wounded), his own servants conspired against him because of the blood of the sons of Jehoiada the priest, and killed him on his bed. So he died. And they buried him in the City of David, but they did not bury him in the tombs of the kings.
Bahnar: Wă lu linh Siri weh tơ nai boih, lê̆ Jôas đei rơka jrŭ dêh. Lu Yŏng bơ̆jang kơ sư pơđâu wă pơm kơnê̆ kơ sư, wă tơiung kơting pơm 'mong pham kơ kon drŏ-nglo Jêhôiada 'bok soi, na đe pơlôch hloi Jôas 'bơ̆t kơpal giơng tep sư; đe 'bŭ sư tơ lăm Pơlei Đawit, mă-lei ưh kơ 'bŭ hơdai lu pơtao.

English: These are the ones who conspired against him: Zabad the son of Shimeath the Ammonitess, and Jehozabad the son of Shimrith the Moabitess.
Bahnar: Lu đe mă iung blah sư noh: Sabat kon drŏ-nglo yă Simêa bơngai Ammôn, Jêhôsabat, kon drŏ-nglo yă Simrit bơngai Môap.

English: Now concerning his sons, and the many oracles about him, and the repairing of the house of God, indeed they are written in the annals of the book of the kings. Then Amaziah his son reigned in his place.
Bahnar: Roi tơdrong lu kon drŏ-nglo sư, đei nơ̆r khan lê̆ adrol gah sư păng roi kơ tơdrong wă kơ pơm hơmet ming hnam Kră Yang, đei chih răk lăm sơ̆p hla bơar hơ'mon lu pơtao. Amasia kon drŏ-nglo sư pơgơ̆r pơtrơp đơ̆ng sư.

English: Amaziah was twenty-five years old when he became king, and he reigned twenty-nine years in Jerusalem. His mother’s name was Jehoaddan of Jerusalem.
Bahnar: Amasia pơm pơtao sư 'nao lăp 'bar-jĭt pơđăm sơnăm, sư pơgơ̆r 'bar-jĭt tơsĭn sơnăm lăm pơlei Jêrusalem; mĕ sư anăn Jêhôadin, pơlei Jêrusalem.

English: And he did what was right in the sight of the LORD, but not with a loyal heart.
Bahnar: Sư bơngai pơm 'lơ̆ng 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang, mă-lei ưh kơ đĭ jơhngơ̆m.

English: Now it happened, as soon as the kingdom was established for him, that he executed his servants who had murdered his father the king.
Bahnar: Wă sư pơgơ̆r dêh char sư kơjăp, sư pơlôch đĭ lu bơngai yŏng mă đêl pơlôch 'bă sư.

English: However he did not execute their children, but did as it is written in the Law in the Book of Moses, where the LORD commanded, saying, “The fathers shall not be put to death for their children, nor shall the children be put to death for their fathers; but a person shall die for his own sin.”
Bahnar: Mă-lei sư ưh kơ pơlôch ôh kon drŏ-nglo đe noh, kiơ̆ thoi đei chih lăm sơ̆p hla bơar khôi juăt Môis. Lăm khôi juăt Kră Yang đei khan: “'Bă huay kơ lôch yua kơ kon, kon huay kơ lôch yua kơ đơ̆ng 'bă pơm yoch; mă-lei rim 'nu gô lôch yua kơ tơdrong yoch Sư kơdih.”

English: Moreover Amaziah gathered Judah together and set over them captains of thousands and captains of hundreds, according to their fathers’ houses, throughout all Judah and Benjamin; and he numbered them from twenty years old and above, and found them to be three hundred thousand choice men, able to go to war, who could handle spear and shield.
Bahnar: Amasia krao akŭm đĭ lu bơngai Juđa kiơ̆ kơ adrĕch adrung 'bok sư lăm Juđa păng Bênjamin, na pơjao ăn pơm yŏng pơgơ̆r kơ minh-rơbâu 'nu, minh-hrĕng 'nu; jô̆ iŏk đơ̆ng 'bar-jĭt sơnăm tơ kơpơ̆ng, đei pêng-hrĕng rơbâu 'nu lu bơngai mă gơh năm tơblah, chĕp khêl hơlă.

English: He also hired one hundred thousand mighty men of valor from Israel for one hundred talents of silver.
Bahnar: Sư kư̆m mưng minh-hrĕng rơbâu 'nu linh nuih kơtang dơ̆ng đơ̆ng lăm lu bơngai Isơrael, apah minh-hrĕng talâng jên hu.

English: But a man of God came to him, saying, “O king, do not let the army of Israel go with you, for the LORD is not with Israel—not with any of the children of Ephraim.
Bahnar: Mă-lei bơngai Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei yua năm khan kơ sư: “Ơ pơtao 'nĕ ăn kơ lu linh bơngai Isơrael năm hơdai ih, yua kơ Kră Yang ưh kơ oei hơdai hăm lu bơngai Isơrael ôh, kư̆m ưh kơ oei hơdai hăm lu kon sâu Êphraim mơ̆n.

English: But if you go, be gone! Be strong in battle! Even so, God shall make you fall before the enemy; for God has power to help and to overthrow.”
Bahnar: Dah ih kiơ̆ trong 'nâu mă tơblah pran kơtang Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei gô ăn kơ ih thuơ 'bơ̆t anăp lu ayăt kơ ih yua kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei gơh tơgŭm kĕ jei, kư̆m gơh ăn thuơ.”

English: Then Amaziah said to the man of God, “But what shall we do about the hundred talents which I have given to the troops of Israel?” And the man of God answered, “The LORD is able to give you much more than this.”
Bahnar: Amasia jet bơngai Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei: “Bĕ gah minh-hrĕng talâng jên inh apah linh Isơrael noh thoi yơ?” Bơngai Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei tơl: “Kră Yang gơh ăn kơ ih đei lơ hloh kơ noh dơ̆ng.”

English: So Amaziah discharged the troops that had come to him from Ephraim, to go back home. Therefore their anger was greatly aroused against Judah, and they returned home in great anger.
Bahnar: Thoi noh Amasia tơbrŏk lê̆ lu linh đơ̆ng khŭl Êphraim mă năm truh tơ sư boih, lu sư hil dêh kơ bơngai Juđa, na wih brŏk tơ hnam jơhngơ̆m blĕk kơŭl.

English: Then Amaziah strengthened himself, and leading his people, he went to the Valley of Salt and killed ten thousand of the people of Seir.
Bahnar: Amasia iŏk tơiung pơm jơhngơ̆m nuih, chông ba lu kon pơlei năm truh tơ Thŭng 'Boh, tơblah păng pơlôch mơjĭt-rơbâu 'nu bơngai Sêir.

English: Also the children of Judah took captive ten thousand alive, brought them to the top of the rock, and cast them down from the top of the rock, so that they all were dashed in pieces.
Bahnar: Linh Juđa kư̆m đei rôp arih mơjĭt-rơbâu 'nu ba lu sư tŏk tơ kơpal kông tơmo, na tơlơ̆ lu sư đơ̆ng kơpal kông noh tơ ala, lu sư lôch akâu pơchah hĕch đĭ.

English: But as for the soldiers of the army which Amaziah had discharged, so that they would not go with him to battle, they raided the cities of Judah from Samaria to Beth Horon, killed three thousand in them, and took much spoil.
Bahnar: Gah lu linh mă Amasia tơbrŏk, ưh kơ ăn năm tơblah hơdai sư noh, mơ̆t blah lăm lu pơlei Juđa đơ̆ng pơlei Samari truh tơ pơlei Bêt Hôrôn, na pơlôch pêng-rơbâu 'nu kon pơlei tơ noh păng blah tơgar iŏk lơ mŭk tơmam.

English: Now it was so, after Amaziah came from the slaughter of the Edomites, that he brought the gods of the people of Seir, set them up to be his gods, and bowed down before them and burned incense to them.
Bahnar: Kơplah Amasia brŏk đơ̆ng tơblah bơngai Eđôm, sư chĕp ba rup yang lu bơngai Sêir pơm yang sư kơdih, kơkuh păng pơyơ̆r tơmam soi kơ rup yang noh.

English: Therefore the anger of the LORD was aroused against Amaziah, and He sent him a prophet who said to him, “Why have you sought the gods of the people, which could not rescue their own people from your hand?”
Bahnar: Kră Yang hil kơ Amasia na wơh minh 'nu bơngai khan lê̆ adrol năm khan kơ sư: “Yua kơ kiơ ih kơkuh gơnang kơ rup yang mă ưh kơ gơh dŏng pơklaih đơ̆ng ti kon pơlei mă kơkuh gơnang kơ sư?”

English: So it was, as he talked with him, that the king said to him, “Have we made you the king’s counselor? Cease! Why should you be killed?” Then the prophet ceased, and said, “I know that God has determined to destroy you, because you have done this and have not heeded my advice.”
Bahnar: Mă-lei kơplah 'bok khan lê̆ adrol oei pơma, pơtao khan plơ̆: “Nhôn hăm đei pôk ih chă đon kơ inh? Weh bĕ, ih 'maih lôch hă?” 'Bok khan lê̆ adrol noh ngăn na khan: “Inh băt Kră Yang wă pơlôch pơrăm ih, yua kơ ih đei pơm boih tơdrong noh păng ưh kơ wă mơ̆ng nơ̆r inh.”

English: Now Amaziah king of Judah asked advice and sent to Joash the son of Jehoahaz, the son of Jehu, king of Israel, saying, “Come, let us face one another in battle.”
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ Amasia pơtao đe Juđa chă đon, na athei đe năm truh tơ Jêhôasa kon drŏ-nglo Jêhôahas sâu Jêhu, pơtao đe Isơrael khan: “Năm bĕ tơ âu wă kơ bơ̆n tơ'bơ̆p 'bôh băl muh măt.”

English: And Joash king of Israel sent to Amaziah king of Judah, saying, “The thistle that was in Lebanon sent to the cedar that was in Lebanon, saying, ‘Give your daughter to my son as wife’; and a wild beast that was in Lebanon passed by and trampled the thistle.
Bahnar: Jêhôas, pơtao đe Isơrael tơl Amasia pơtao đe Juđa: “'Long jơla oei tơ char Liban đei pơtruh nơ̆r ăn kơ 'long hơngo tơ char Liban khan: ‘Ăn bĕ kơ kon adruh ih oei pơm akăn kơ kon tơdăm inh.’ Na đei sem bri đơ̆ng char Liban rok noh, na pơjuă lê̆ đĭ 'long jơla noh.

English: Indeed you say that you have defeated the Edomites, and your heart is lifted up to boast. Stay at home now; why should you meddle with trouble, that you should fall—you and Judah with you?”
Bahnar: Ih khan: Lăm to inh blah iŏk boih char Eđôm na jơhngơ̆m ih pơrŏ pơang pơư kơdih akâu. Dang ei oei bĕ hnam, liơ wă pơrăm kơdih akâu păng dêh char Juđa kư̆m răm kiơ̆?”

English: But Amaziah would not heed, for it came from God, that He might give them into the hand of their enemies, because they sought the gods of Edom.
Bahnar: Mă-lei Amasia ưh kơ wă mơ̆ng, yua kơ tơdrong âu đơ̆ng Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei wă pơjao lu sư lăm ti Jêhôas, yua kơ đơ̆ng lu sư chơchă kơkuh kơ yang bơngai Eđôm.

English: So Joash king of Israel went out; and he and Amaziah king of Judah faced one another at Beth Shemesh, which belongs to Judah.
Bahnar: Jêhôas pơtao Isơrael tŏk blah sư păng Amasia pơtao Juđa tơblah băl tơ pơlei Bêt Sêmes lăm dêh char Juđa.

English: And Judah was defeated by Israel, and every man fled to his tent.
Bahnar: Khŭl linh Isơrael druh blah khŭl linh Juđa, khŭl linh Juđa kơdâu brŏk tơ anih lu sư kơdih kơdih.

English: Then Joash the king of Israel captured Amaziah king of Judah, the son of Joash, the son of Jehoahaz, at Beth Shemesh; and he brought him to Jerusalem, and broke down the wall of Jerusalem from the Gate of Ephraim to the Corner Gate—four hundred cubits.
Bahnar: Tơ Bêt Sêmes Jêhôas pơtao Isơrael rôp Amasia pơtao đe Juđa kon drŏ-nglo Jôas, sâu Ahasia, chông ba sư tơ pơlei Jêrusalem; lu sư teh tơlơ̆ pơrăm lê̆ dur pơlei Jêrusalem iŏk đơ̆ng 'Măng Jang Êphraim dĭng truh tơ 'Măng Jang Mum, minh chăl să kơjung 'bar-hrĕng hlok.

English: And he took all the gold and silver, all the articles that were found in the house of God with Obed-Edom, the treasures of the king’s house, and hostages, and returned to Samaria.
Bahnar: Sư iŏk đĭ hu, maih păng lu tơmam yua lăm hnam Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, mă Ôbêt Eđôm bơngai wei tơmam noh; kư̆m iŏk dôm lu tơmam gĭt đơ̆ng lăm hnam pơtao hai; kư̆m đei rôp ba wă pơkơ̆ng lu bơngai nai, na lu sư wih brŏk tơ pơlei Samari.

English: Amaziah the son of Joash, king of Judah, lived fifteen years after the death of Joash the son of Jehoahaz, king of Israel.
Bahnar: Amasia, kon drŏ-nglo Jôas, pơtao đe Juđa, oei arih mơjĭt-pơđăm sơnăm dơ̆ng đơ̆ng rŏng kơ Jêhôas kon drŏ-nglo Jêhôahas pơtao Isơrael lôch.

English: Now the rest of the acts of Amaziah, from first to last, indeed are they not written in the book of the kings of Judah and Israel?
Bahnar: Lu tơdrong jang nai Amasia đei pơm iŏk đơ̆ng blŭng-a truh tơ tôch đe đei chih lăm sơ̆p hla bơar lu pơtao Juđa păng Isơrael?

English: After the time that Amaziah turned away from following the LORD, they made a conspiracy against him in Jerusalem, and he fled to Lachish; but they sent after him to Lachish and killed him there.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng chăl Amasia achăng lê̆ Kră Yang, đơ̆ng noh na đei đe pơđâu wă pơm kơnê̆ kơ sư tơ pơlei Jêrusalem, sư kơdâu ôn tơ pơlei Lakis; đe druh sư păng pơlôch hloi sư tơ noh.

English: Then they brought him on horses and buried him with his fathers in the City of Judah.
Bahnar: Đe chơ ba akâu sư hăm aseh, 'bŭ sư lăm Pơlei Đawit lăm char Juđa hơdai lu 'bok sư.

English: Now all the people of Judah took Uzziah, who was sixteen years old, and made him king instead of his father Amaziah.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng kon pơlei Juđa pôk Usia pơm pơtao pơgơ̆r pơtrơp 'bă sư Amasia, sư 'nao lăp mơjĭt-tơdrâu sơnăm.

English: He built Elath and restored it to Judah, after the king rested with his fathers.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ 'bă sư lôch pơdơh wih hơdai lu 'bok sư, sư pơjing ming pơlei Êlat wă tơwih ăn kơ char Juđa.

English: Uzziah was sixteen years old when he became king, and he reigned fifty-two years in Jerusalem. His mother’s name was Jecholiah of Jerusalem.
Bahnar: Usia 'nao lăp mơjĭt-tơdrâu sơnăm 'bơ̆t sư pơm pơtao, sư pơgơ̆r pơđăm-jĭt 'bar sơnăm tơ pơlei Jêrusalem; mĕ sư anăn Jêkôlia đơ̆ng pơlei Jêrusalem.

English: And he did what was right in the sight of the LORD, according to all that his father Amaziah had done.
Bahnar: Sư pơm tơdrong 'lơ̆ng tơpăt 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang, rok thoi 'bă sư Amasia đei pơm boih.

English: He sought God in the days of Zechariah, who had understanding in the visions of God; and as long as he sought the LORD, God made him prosper.
Bahnar: Sư chă Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei đĭ lăm chăl Sachari, bơngai bơtho sư băt hli yom kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei. Sư chă Kră Yang dang yơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ sư đei hiôk jơnap dang noh.

English: Now he went out and made war against the Philistines, and broke down the wall of Gath, the wall of Jabneh, and the wall of Ashdod; and he built cities around Ashdod and among the Philistines.
Bahnar: Sư iung tơblah hăm lu bơngai Philistin, blah tơlơ̆ dur pơlei Gat, blah pơchah dur Japnê păng dur Asdôt: Sư man pơdơ̆ng ming lơ pơlei lăm tơring Asdôt păng tơ anih nai lăm teh đak Philistin.

English: God helped him against the Philistines, against the Arabians who lived in Gur Baal, and against the Meunites.
Bahnar: Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei tơgŭm sư kĕ jei blah lu kon pơlei Philistin, bơngai Arâp oei tơ lăm pơlei Gur Baal, klaih kơ noh lu bơngai Mêunit.

English: Also the Ammonites brought tribute to Uzziah. His fame spread as far as the entrance of Egypt, for he became exceedingly strong.
Bahnar: Kon pơlei Ammôn kư̆m athei ra ăn jên kơ Usia; đe pơư kơ sư jơ̆p-jang đe ang kơ sư jơ̆p truh tơ dêh Êyiptơ, yua kơ sư rai pran kơtang tơpă.

English: And Uzziah built towers in Jerusalem at the Corner Gate, at the Valley Gate, and at the corner buttress of the wall; then he fortified them.
Bahnar: Usia kư̆m pơm tơiung lu hnam thôt lăm pơlei Jêrusalem, 'bơ̆t 'Măng Jang Mum, 'Măng Jang Thŭng, 'bơ̆t dur suăn pơm kơjăp hloh.

English: Also he built towers in the desert. He dug many wells, for he had much livestock, both in the lowlands and in the plains; he also had farmers and vinedressers in the mountains and in Carmel, for he loved the soil.
Bahnar: Sư kư̆m pơm lơ hnam thôt tơ lăm tơmăn glă păng đei sir sơlŭng đak, yua kơ sư đei sem dơrong tơ kơpal groi tơ lăm thŭng glă; kư̆m đei lơ bơngai pơm mir, pơgar hơmu tơ kơpal kông groi păng tơ teh mơ̆r, pơtao sư 'maih jang mir 'ba.

English: Moreover Uzziah had an army of fighting men who went out to war by companies, according to the number on their roll as prepared by Jeiel the scribe and Maaseiah the officer, under the hand of Hananiah, one of the king’s captains.
Bahnar: Usia đei khŭl linh hơmet pơhrăm gơh năm tơblah, asong kơ khŭl năm kiơ̆ thoi bre Jêiêl bơngai chih hla bơar păng Maaseia yŏng jô̆ linh bơ̆jang ala kơ Hanania pơgơ̆r. Sư minh 'nu lăm yŏng pơgơ̆r bơ̆jang kơ pơtao.

English: The total number of chief officers of the mighty men of valor was two thousand six hundred.
Bahnar: Jô̆ đĭ-đăng lu yŏng kơdră adrĕch 'bă, wă khan lu bơngai nuih pran đei 'bar-rơbâu tơdrâu-hrĕng 'nu.

English: And under their authority was an army of three hundred and seven thousand five hundred, that made war with mighty power, to help the king against the enemy.
Bahnar: Lu sư pơgơ̆r khŭl linh đei pêng-hrĕng tơpơh-rơbâu pơđăm-hrĕng 'nu, lu bơngai nuih ngăl, wă tơgŭm pơtao tơblah hăm lu bơngai ayăt.

English: Then Uzziah prepared for them, for the entire army, shields, spears, helmets, body armor, bows, and slings to cast stones.
Bahnar: Usia hơmet pơchĕp ăn kơ khŭl linh, khêl, đao tơju, môk mam, ao lŏ mam, hră păng 'brơ̆m tơmo wă prah.

English: And he made devices in Jerusalem, invented by skillful men, to be on the towers and the corners, to shoot arrows and large stones. So his fame spread far and wide, for he was marvelously helped till he became strong.
Bahnar: Lăm pơlei Jêrusalem pơtao athei lu bơngai hơgei hơjơ̆m pơm kơmăi wă prah 'brơ̆m păng prah tơmo tih, tah tơ rim hnam thôt păng tơ rim mum pơlei. Đe ư-ang kơ sư tơ jơ̆p dêh char tơ tơring ataih; yua kơ sư đei Kră Yang tơgŭm sư hlĭch chrơp tơpă dĭng sư pran kơtang tơpă.

English: But when he was strong his heart was lifted up, to his destruction, for he transgressed against the LORD his God by entering the temple of the LORD to burn incense on the altar of incense.
Bahnar: Wă sư pran kơtang boih jơhngơ̆m sư pơang truh tơ sư pơm yoch, pơm glăi hăm Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei sư kơdih; sư mơ̆t lăm hnam Kră Yang, soh tơmam 'bâu phu 'bơ̆t chơnang 'bok soi juăt kơ soh tơmam 'bâu phu.

English: So Azariah the priest went in after him, and with him were eighty priests of the LORD—valiant men.
Bahnar: 'Bok soi Asaria hơdai hăm tơhngam-jĭt 'nu 'bok soi Kră Yang bơngai nuih kơtang mơ̆t kiơ̆ Sư.

English: And they withstood King Uzziah, and said to him, “It is not for you, Uzziah, to burn incense to the LORD, but for the priests, the sons of Aaron, who are consecrated to burn incense. Get out of the sanctuary, for you have trespassed! You shall have no honor from the LORD God.”
Bahnar: Lu sư găn pơma kơ pơtao Usia: “Ơ pơtao Usia, ih ưh kơ trŏ gơh soh ôh tơmam 'bâu phu ăn kơ Kră Yang, 'nâu tơdrong jang lu 'bok soi pơm, lu kon sâu Arôn, đei 'măn lê̆ lu sư phara rơgoh wă kơ lu sư soh tơmam 'bâu phu. Lĕch bĕ đơ̆ng lăm anih rơgoh 'nâu, ih pơm yoch boih, yua kơ ih pơm 'nâu ih ưh pă đei ư-ang đơ̆ng Kră Yang boih.”

English: Then Uzziah became furious; and he had a censer in his hand to burn incense. And while he was angry with the priests, leprosy broke out on his forehead, before the priests in the house of the LORD, beside the incense altar.
Bahnar: Usia hil, ti sư oei chĕp get wă soh tơmam 'bâu phu; kơplah sư hil dêh kơ lu 'bok soi, đei hloi jĭ chin lĕch 'bơ̆t klĕng sư tơm măt lu 'bok soi, lăm hnam Kră Yang 'bơ̆t jê̆ chơnang soh tơmam 'bâu phu.

English: And Azariah the chief priest and all the priests looked at him, and there, on his forehead, he was leprous; so they thrust him out of that place. Indeed he also hurried to get out, because the LORD had struck him.
Bahnar: Asaria 'bok soi tơm păng đĭ-đăng lu 'bok soi nai lăng tơ sư, 'bôh sư đei jĭ chin 'bơ̆t klĕng na tơlĕch hloi sư đơ̆ng lăm noh păng kơdih akâu sư kư̆m 'maih lĕch, yua kơ Kră Yang phak sư.

English: King Uzziah was a leper until the day of his death. He dwelt in an isolated house, because he was a leper; for he was cut off from the house of the LORD. Then Jotham his son was over the king’s house, judging the people of the land.
Bahnar: Usia jĭ chin dĭng truh tơ sư lôch hloi; mưh jĭ chin athei oei hnam hơdrô̆ pha, ưh pă gơh mơ̆t lăm hnam Kră Yang dơ̆ng boih. Jôthan kon drŏ-nglo sư wei hnam pơtao păng pơgơ̆r kon pơlei pơla lăm char sư.

English: Now the rest of the acts of Uzziah, from first to last, the prophet Isaiah the son of Amoz wrote.
Bahnar: Dôm tơdrong jang nai pơtao Usia đơ̆ng blŭng-a truh tơ tôch đei Êsai 'bok khan lê̆ adrol kon drŏ-nglo Amôt chih răk.

English: So Uzziah rested with his fathers, and they buried him with his fathers in the field of burial which belonged to the kings, for they said, “He is a leper.” Then Jotham his son reigned in his place.
Bahnar: Pơtao Usia lôch oei hơdai hăm 'bok yă, đe 'bŭ sư tơ bơsat lu pơtao jê̆ lu 'bok yă sư, đe khan; “sư jĭ chin.” Kon tơdăm sư Jôtham pơm pơtao pơtrơp sư.

English: Jotham was twenty-five years old when he became king, and he reigned sixteen years in Jerusalem. His mother’s name was Jerushah the daughter of Zadok.
Bahnar: Jôtham 'nao 'bar-jĭt pơđăm sơnăm sư pơm pơtao, sư pơgơ̆r mơjĭt-tơdrâu sơnăm lăm pơlei Jêrusalem; mĕ sư anăn Jêrusa kon drŏ-kăn Sadok.

English: And he did what was right in the sight of the LORD, according to all that his father Uzziah had done (although he did not enter the temple of the LORD). But still the people acted corruptly.
Bahnar: Sư đei pơm lơ tơdrong 'lơ̆ng 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang thoi 'bă sư Usia đei pơm boih, mă-lei sư ưh kơ đei mơ̆t lăm hnam Kră Yang lu kon pơlei oei răm kiơ̆ trong kơnê̆.

English: He built the Upper Gate of the house of the LORD, and he built extensively on the wall of Ophel.
Bahnar: Sư man ming 'Măng Jang Kơpal hnam Kră Yang păng kư̆m đei man pơdơ̆ng ming dur tơ groi Ôphel.

English: Moreover he built cities in the mountains of Judah, and in the forests he built fortresses and towers.
Bahnar: Sư kư̆m đei man pơjing lu pơlei lăm tơring groi kông char Juđa păng pơm pơjing lu kơđông linh lu hnam thôt tơ lăm 'long kơdrơ̆ng.

English: He also fought with the king of the Ammonites and defeated them. And the people of Ammon gave him in that year one hundred talents of silver, ten thousand kors of wheat, and ten thousand of barley. The people of Ammon paid this to him in the second and third years also.
Bahnar: Sư tơblah hăm pơtao bơngai Ammôn jei sư. Lăm sơnăm noh kon pơlei Ammôn ra ăn kơ sư pêng tơ̆n puăn-hrĕng ki jên hu, mơjĭt-rơbâu kora 'ba tơ'bâu păng mơjĭt-rơbâu kor 'ba mi. Lăm sơnăm mă 'bar mă pêng, kon pơlei Ammôn kư̆m ra ăn kơ sư lei-lăi dôm noh.

English: So Jotham became mighty, because he prepared his ways before the LORD his God.
Bahnar: Thoi noh Jôtham jing pran kơtang, yua kơ sư năm kiơ̆ trong tơpăt 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei sư.

English: Now the rest of the acts of Jotham, and all his wars and his ways, indeed they are written in the book of the kings of Israel and Judah.
Bahnar: Dôm tơdrong jang nai mă Jôtham đei pơm, dôm tơdrong tơblah wang păng trong mă sư yak, chih răk pơđĭ tơ lăm sơ̆p hla bơar lu pơtao Isơrael păng pơtao Juđa.

English: He was twenty-five years old when he became king, and he reigned sixteen years in Jerusalem.
Bahnar: Sư 'nao lăp 'bar-jĭt pơđăm sơnăm 'bơ̆t sư pơm pơtao păng sư pơgơ̆r đei mơjĭt-tơdrâu sơnăm lăm Jêrusalem.

English: So Jotham rested with his fathers, and they buried him in the City of David. Then Ahaz his son reigned in his place.
Bahnar: Sư lôch pơdơh hơdai lu 'bok sư, đe 'bŭ sư lăm pơlei Đawit; đơ̆ng noh Ahas kon drŏ-nglo sư iung pơgơ̆r pơm pơtao pơtrơp sư.

English: Ahaz was twenty years old when he became king, and he reigned sixteen years in Jerusalem; and he did not do what was right in the sight of the LORD, as his father David had done.
Bahnar: Ahas sư 'nao 'bar-jĭt sơnăm 'bơ̆t sư pơm pơtao; sư pơgơ̆r mơjĭt-tơdrâu sơnăm lăm pơlei Jêrusalem, sư ưh kơ đei pơm 'lơ̆ng 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang thoi 'bok sư Đawit đei pơm

English: For he walked in the ways of the kings of Israel, and made molded images for the Baals.
Bahnar: Sư kiơ̆ lu pơtao Isơrael, na kư̆m pơm tuh man rup yang Baal.

English: He burned incense in the Valley of the Son of Hinnom, and burned his children in the fire, according to the abominations of the nations whom the LORD had cast out before the children of Israel.
Bahnar: Sư soh pơyơ̆r tơmam 'bâu phu lăm Thŭng Ben Hinôm păng 'buh pơyơ̆r lu kon drŏ-nglo sư kơdih lăm ŭnh pơm tơmam soi, kiơ̆ kơ tơdrong kơnê̆ krưp dêh tơpă lu kon pơlei mă Kră Yang puh tơweh lê̆ lu sư đơ̆ng anăp lu bơngai Isơrael.

English: And he sacrificed and burned incense on the high places, on the hills, and under every green tree.
Bahnar: Lu sư pơyơ̆r tơmam soi păng soh 'long 'bâu phu tơ lu anih kơjung, tơ kơpal groi păng tơ ala tơnơm 'long đei yơ̆p Să.

English: Therefore the LORD his God delivered him into the hand of the king of Syria. They defeated him, and carried away a great multitude of them as captives, and brought them to Damascus. Then he was also delivered into the hand of the king of Israel, who defeated him with a great slaughter.
Bahnar: Yua kơ thoi noh Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Sư jao sư tơ lăm ti pơtao char Siri; khŭl linh Siri blah rôp lu sư lơ pơm bơnă păng chông ba tơ pơlei Đamas. Kră Yang kư̆m jao sư tơ lăm ti pơtao Isơrael, lu sư thuơ tih tơpă

English: For Pekah the son of Remaliah killed one hundred and twenty thousand in Judah in one day, all valiant men, because they had forsaken the LORD God of their fathers.
Bahnar: lăm minh năr Pêka kon drŏ-nglo Rêmalia, đei pơlôch minh-hrĕng 'bar-jĭt rơbâu 'nu linh bơngai Juđa, tă kơ lu linh mă nuih kơtang ngăl, yua kơ lu sư achăng lê̆ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei 'bok lu sư.

English: Zichri, a mighty man of Ephraim, killed Maaseiah the king’s son, Azrikam the officer over the house, and Elkanah who was second to the king.
Bahnar: Sikri minh 'nu bơngai nuih kơtang đơ̆ng char Êphraim pơlôch Maaseia, kon drŏ-nglo pơtao, Asrikam Yŏng wei hnam pơtao păng Êlkana, kơiĕng pơtao.

English: And the children of Israel carried away captive of their brethren two hundred thousand women, sons, and daughters; and they also took away much spoil from them, and brought the spoil to Samaria.
Bahnar: Khŭl linh Isơrael rôp 'bar-hrĕng rơbâu 'nu lu 'nhŏng oh lu sư pơm bơnă, drŏ-kăn, kon hơ'lơ̆p drŏ-nglo, drŏ-kăn păng kư̆m đei blah iŏk lu mŭk tơmam chĕp ba tơ pơlei Samari.

English: But a prophet of the LORD was there, whose name was Oded; and he went out before the army that came to Samaria, and said to them: “Look, because the LORD God of your fathers was angry with Judah, He has delivered them into your hand; but you have killed them in a rage that reaches up to heaven.
Bahnar: Tơ noh, đei minh 'nu 'bok khan lê̆ adrol Kră Yang anăn sư Ôdet, năm sơng lu linh brŏk tơ pơlei Samari păng khan: “'Nâu yua kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei 'bok lu iĕm hil kơ lu bơngai Juđa, na Sư đei pơjao đe Juđa lăm ti iĕm; mă-lei lu iĕm pơlôch lu sư lăm năr iĕm hil blĕk dêh mah truh tơ plĕnh.

English: And now you propose to force the children of Judah and Jerusalem to be your male and female slaves; but are you not also guilty before the LORD your God?
Bahnar: Dang ei iĕm wă 'maih rôp lu bơngai Juđa păng lu bơngai lăm pơlei Jêrusalem pơm đĭch drŏ-nglo pơm đam drŏ-kăn kơ lu iĕm hă? Bĕ lu iĕm ưh kơ pơm yoch hăm Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm hă?

English: Now hear me, therefore, and return the captives, whom you have taken captive from your brethren, for the fierce wrath of the LORD is upon you.”
Bahnar: Na dang ei mơ̆ng bĕ inh, tơbrŏk đĭ-đăng lu bơnă mă đêl lu iĕm rôp noh lu 'nhŏng oh iĕm kơdih 'mơ̆i. Kră Yang oei hil mĭl kơ lu iĕm.”

English: Then some of the heads of the children of Ephraim, Azariah the son of Johanan, Berechiah the son of Meshillemoth, Jehizkiah the son of Shallum, and Amasa the son of Hadlai, stood up against those who came from the war
Bahnar: Kơplah noh đei lu bơngai yŏng pơgơ̆r đơ̆ng lăm lu bơngai Êphraim, Asaria kon drŏ-nglo Jôhanan, Bêrekia kon drŏ-nglo Mêsilemôt, Jêhiskia kon drŏ-nglo Sallum păng Amasa kon drŏ-nglo Hatlai, iung găn lu bơngai mă 'nao brŏk đơ̆ng tơblah

English: and said to them, “You shall not bring the captives here, for we already have offended the LORD. You intend to add to our sins and to our guilt; for our guilt is great, and there is fierce wrath against Israel.”
Bahnar: Na lu sư khan: “Iĕm 'nĕ kơ tơmơ̆t lu bơnă tơ âu; Kơnh lu bơ̆n gô pơm yoch hăm Kră Yang, lu iĕm wă pơklăm thim tơdrong yoch lu bơ̆n rai dêh, yua kơ tơdrong yoch bơ̆n tih dêh boih na Kră Yang hil mĭl tơtŏ dêh truh kơ bơngai Isơrael.”

English: So the armed men left the captives and the spoil before the leaders and all the assembly.
Bahnar: Thoi noh lu linh achăng lê̆ lu bơnă păng lu tơmam đêl lu sư blah iŏk 'bơ̆t anăp lu yŏng pơgơ̆r păng lu tơpôl kon pơlei oei akŭm.

English: Then the men who were designated by name rose up and took the captives, and from the spoil they clothed all who were naked among them, dressed them and gave them sandals, gave them food and drink, and anointed them; and they let all the feeble ones ride on donkeys. So they brought them to their brethren at Jericho, the city of palm trees. Then they returned to Samaria.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai drŏ-nglo mă đei anăn lu sư adrol hei iung chông lu bơnă lĕch păng iŏk hơbĕn ao đơ̆ng blah iŏk noh pơhrŭk ăn kơ lu bơnă yua kơ đei lu mơ'nah akâu hoh păng tơ'bot ăn kơ lu sư chơkhŏ, ăn sŏng sa păng pik ăn pơgang păng chơ ba lu bơngai rơmơ̆n pă kĕ yak hăm aseh iĕ, đơ̆ng noh ba lu sư wih brŏk tơ 'nhŏng oh lu sư tơ pơlei Jêrikô, pơlei 'long gol; đơ̆ng noh lu sư wih brŏk tơ pơlei Samari.

English: At the same time King Ahaz sent to the kings of Assyria to help him.
Bahnar: Kơplah noh pơtao Ahas wơh bơngai năm apinh pơtao Asiri dŏng tơgŭm

English: For again the Edomites had come, attacked Judah, and carried away captives.
Bahnar: yua kơ kon pơlei Eđôm iung blah kon pơlei Juđa dơ̆ng, đei rôp ba lơ bơngai pơm bơnă.

English: The Philistines also had invaded the cities of the lowland and of the South of Judah, and had taken Beth Shemesh, Aijalon, Gederoth, Sochoh with its villages, Timnah with its villages, and Gimzo with its villages; and they dwelt there.
Bahnar: Kon pơlei Philistin kư̆m iung blah lu pơlei lăm tơring kông groi păng tơring tơ gah gơal lăm char Juđa. Kŭm blah iŏk pơlei Bêt Sêmes, Aijalôn, Gêđêrôt, Sôkô hăm lu pơlei jê̆ noh, Timna păng lu pơlei jê̆ sư, Gimsô păng lu pơlei kiơ̆ jê̆ sư, na lu bơngai Philistin oei hloi tơ noh.

English: For the LORD brought Judah low because of Ahaz king of Israel, for he had encouraged moral decline in Judah and had been continually unfaithful to the LORD.
Bahnar: Yua kơ đơ̆ng Ahas, pơtao đe Isơrael,a na Kră Yang tơhuŏng lu bơngai Juđa, yua kơ Ahas pơm kơnê̆ lăm Juđa, ưh kơ chu Kră Yang.

English: Also Tiglath-Pileser king of Assyria came to him and distressed him, and did not assist him.
Bahnar: Tiglat Philêser pơtao Asiri năm pơgŏ pơđep Ahas, tơplih kơ tơgŭm sư.

English: For Ahaz took part of the treasures from the house of the LORD, from the house of the king, and from the leaders, and he gave it to the king of Assyria; but he did not help him.
Bahnar: Ahas iŏk tơmam đơ̆ng lăm hnam akŭm Kră Yang, đơ̆ng lăm hnam pơtao păng kư̆m iŏk đơ̆ng lu yŏng pơgơ̆r ra ăn kơ pơtao Asiri; mă-lei kư̆m ưh kơ đei tơgŭm sư kiơ.

English: Now in the time of his distress King Ahaz became increasingly unfaithful to the LORD. This is that King Ahaz.
Bahnar: Lăm kơplah đei tơdrong truh pơmat-tat, Ahas rai pơm yoch hăm Kră Yang

English: For he sacrificed to the gods of Damascus which had defeated him, saying, “Because the gods of the kings of Syria help them, I will sacrifice to them that they may help me.” But they were the ruin of him and of all Israel.
Bahnar: Sư kơkuh pơyơ̆r tơmam soi ăn kơ lu yang pơlei Đamas, kon pơlei mă blah sư; sư tơchĕng khan: “Yua kơ lu yang pơtao Asiri dŏng tơgŭm lu sư boih, na inh gô soi sơmah kơ lu yang noh, wă kơ lu yang noh kư̆m dŏng tơgŭm inh.” Mă tơpă lu yang noh rai pơrăm sư păng lu bơngai Isơrael.

English: So Ahaz gathered the articles of the house of God, cut in pieces the articles of the house of God, shut up the doors of the house of the LORD, and made for himself altars in every corner of Jerusalem.
Bahnar: Ahas iŏk lu tơmam yua lăm hnam Kră Yang, na teh pơchah lê̆ păng tang chĭt lê̆ 'măng hnam Kră Yang; na sư pơdơ̆ng chơnang soi tơ rim mum trong lăm pơlei Jêrusalem.

English: And in every single city of Judah he made high places to burn incense to other gods, and provoked to anger the LORD God of his fathers.
Bahnar: Tơ rim pơlei lăm char Juđa, sư pơjing pơdơ̆ng lu anih kơjung wă soh tơmam 'bâu phu ăn kơ lu yang nai, wă tơblĕk Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei 'bok sư.

English: Now the rest of his acts and all his ways, from first to last, indeed they are written in the book of the kings of Judah and Israel.
Bahnar: Dôm tơdrong jang sư pơm păng dôm trong sư yak lăm chăl arih sư, iŏk đơ̆ng blŭng-a truh tơ tôch, đe đei chih lăm sơ̆p hla bơar lu pơtao Juđa păng Isơrael.

English: So Ahaz rested with his fathers, and they buried him in the city, in Jerusalem; but they did not bring him into the tombs of the kings of Israel. Then Hezekiah his son reigned in his place.
Bahnar: Ahas lôch oei hơdai pơdơh hăm lu 'bok sư păng đe 'bŭ sư lăm pơlei Jêrusalem; mă-lei ưh kơ đei 'bŭ tah hơdai hăm bơsat lu pơtao Isơrael. Hesekia kon drŏ-nglo sư pơm pơtao pơgơ̆r pơtrơp sư.

English: Hezekiah became king when he was twenty-five years old, and he reigned twenty-nine years in Jerusalem. His mother’s name was Abijah the daughter of Zechariah.
Bahnar: Hesekia 'nao lăp 'bar-jĭt pơđăm sơnăm kơplah sư pơm pơtao; sư pơgơ̆r oei lăm pơlei Jêrusalem 'bar-jĭt tơsĭn sơnăm; mĕ sư anăn Abija kon drŏ-kăn Sachari.

English: And he did what was right in the sight of the LORD, according to all that his father David had done.
Bahnar: Sư pơm tơdrong 'lơ̆ng tơpăt 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang thoi Đawit 'bok sư đei pơm boih.

English: In the first year of his reign, in the first month, he opened the doors of the house of the LORD and repaired them.
Bahnar: Khei mônh sơnăm blŭng-a sư pơgơ̆r sư pơih 'măng hnam akŭm Kră Yang păng hơmet ming.

English: Then he brought in the priests and the Levites, and gathered them in the East Square
Bahnar: Sư krao lu 'bok soi păng bơngai Lêwi, akŭm lu sư tơ anih cham gah hơlĕch.

English: and said to them: “Hear me, Levites! Now sanctify yourselves, sanctify the house of the LORD God of your fathers, and carry out the rubbish from the holy place.
Bahnar: Sư khan: “Ơ bơngai Lêwi, mơ̆ng inh bĕ! Hơmet bĕ akâu iĕm kơdih rơgoh păng năm hơmet hnam Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei 'bok lu iĕm mă rơgoh păng hơmet hŭt lê̆ bĕ đĭ dôm tơmam kơnê̆ 'mê̆ brư̆ đơ̆ng hnam 'lơ̆ng rơgoh.

English: For our fathers have trespassed and done evil in the eyes of the LORD our God; they have forsaken Him, have turned their faces away from the dwelling place of the LORD, and turned their backs on Him.
Bahnar: Lu 'bok bơ̆n sơ̆ pơm glăi, pơm tơdrong kơnê̆ 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu bơ̆n; lu sư achăng hŭt lê̆ Kră Yang boih, đê̆ ưh pă 'maih lăng boih Anih Kră Yang oei păng tơwih rŏng kơ Sư.

English: They have also shut up the doors of the vestibule, put out the lamps, and have not burned incense or offered burnt offerings in the holy place to the God of Israel.
Bahnar: Lu sư kư̆m chĭt lê̆ 'măng kơdeng, tơpăt lê̆ ŭnh kơđeng, ưh pă soh tơmam 'bâu phu păng ưh pă pơyơ̆r tơmam soi 'buh tơ anih rơgoh Kră Yang Isơrael.

English: Therefore the wrath of the LORD fell upon Judah and Jerusalem, and He has given them up to trouble, to desolation, and to jeering, as you see with your eyes.
Bahnar: Thoi ei na Kră Yang hil mĭl kơ lu bơngai Juđa păng kon pơlei Jêrusalem, Sư pơm ăn kơ đe hli tơrơ păng ăn kơ đe hiĕk ăr, thoi lu iĕm đei 'bôh tơm măt boih.

English: For indeed, because of this our fathers have fallen by the sword; and our sons, our daughters, and our wives are in captivity.
Bahnar: Yua kơ thoi noh na 'bă 'bok bơ̆n lôch răm kơ đao gưm, lu kon drŏ-nglo drŏ-kăn akăn bơ̆n đe rôp ba pơm bơnă.

English: “Now it is in my heart to make a covenant with the LORD God of Israel, that His fierce wrath may turn away from us.
Bahnar: Dang ei jơhngơ̆m inh wă pơm tơdrong pơgơ̆p hăm Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Isơrael, wă kơ tơdrong hil mĭl Sư ngach.

English: My sons, do not be negligent now, for the LORD has chosen you to stand before Him, to serve Him, and that you should minister to Him and burn incense.”
Bahnar: Ơ lu đe kon inh 'nĕ pă pơhiơ̆, yua kơ Kră Yang đei rơih iŏk boih lu iĕm jing đĭch đam Sư, wă kơ dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t anăp Sư, bơ̆jang kơ Sư soh tơmam 'bâu phu kơ Sư.”

English: Then these Levites arose: Mahath the son of Amasai and Joel the son of Azariah, of the sons of the Kohathites; of the sons of Merari, Kish the son of Abdi and Azariah the son of Jehallelel; of the Gershonites, Joah the son of Zimmah and Eden the son of Joah
Bahnar: 'Nâu lu bơngai Lêwi iung jang: Đơ̆ng adrĕch Kôhat, đei Mahat kon drŏ-nglo Amasai, Jôel kon drŏ-nglo Asaria; đơ̆ng adrĕch Mêrari, đei Kis kon drŏ-nglo Apđi; Asaria kon drŏ-nglo Jêhalêlel; đơ̆ng adrĕch Gersôn, đei Jôa kon drŏ-nglo Simma, Êđen kon drŏ-nglo Jôa

English: of the sons of Elizaphan, Shimri and Jeiel; of the sons of Asaph, Zechariah and Mattaniah
Bahnar: đơ̆ng adrĕch Êlisaphan đei: Simri păng Jêuel, đơ̆ng adrĕch Asap đei: Sachari păng Matania.

English: of the sons of Heman, Jehiel and Shimei; and of the sons of Jeduthun, Shemaiah and Uzziel.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng adrĕch Hêman đei: Jêhiel păng Simei; đơ̆ng adrĕch Jêđuthun đei: Sêmaia păng Usiel.

English: And they gathered their brethren, sanctified themselves, and went according to the commandment of the king, at the words of the LORD, to cleanse the house of the LORD.
Bahnar: Lu sư akŭm lu 'nhŏng oh lu sư păng hơmet kơdih akâu rơgoh, na pơm kiơ̆ thoi pơtao đei bơtho khan kiơ̆ kơ nơ̆r Kră Yang hơmet rơgoh hnam Kră Yang.

English: Then the priests went into the inner part of the house of the LORD to cleanse it, and brought out all the debris that they found in the temple of the LORD to the court of the house of the LORD. And the Levites took it out and carried it to the Brook Kidron.
Bahnar: Lu 'bok soi mơ̆t lăm hnam Kră Yang wă hơmet rơgoh; dôm tơmam kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach 'bôh lăm hnam Kră Yang, lu sư iŏk tơlĕch lê̆ tơ đaih 'bơ̆t cham hnam Kră Yang; đơ̆ng noh lu bơngai Lêwi dônh iŏk, na năm tung klơ̆m hŭt lê̆ tơ thong Kidrôn.

English: Now they began to sanctify on the first day of the first month, and on the eighth day of the month they came to the vestibule of the LORD. So they sanctified the house of the LORD in eight days, and on the sixteenth day of the first month they finished.
Bahnar: Năr mônh lăm khei mônh, lu sư pơtơm hơmet hnam Kră Yang rơgoh, truh năr tơhngam lăm khei noh lu sư hơmet rơgoh cham truh tơ kơđeng hnam Kră Yang. Lăm tơhngam năr dơ̆ng lu sư hơmet rơgoh hnam Kră Yang; truh tơ năr mơjĭt-tơdrâu khei mônh dôm tơdrong jang pơm keh đĭ.

English: Then they went in to King Hezekiah and said, “We have cleansed all the house of the LORD, the altar of burnt offerings with all its articles, and the table of the showbread with all its articles.
Bahnar: Lu sư mơ̆t lăm hnam pơtao Hesekia păng khan: “Lu nhôn đei hơmet rơgoh đĭ boih hnam Kră Yang, chơnang soi pơyơ̆r tơmam soi 'buh păng đĭ tơmam yua, gô 'bang dan 'bĕng păng đĭ tơmam yua sư.

English: Moreover all the articles which King Ahaz in his reign had cast aside in his transgression we have prepared and sanctified; and there they are, before the altar of the LORD.”
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng lu tơmam mă đơ̆ng pơtao Ahas iŏk lê̆ 'bơ̆t Sư ưh kơchu Kră Yang lăm chăl sư pơgơ̆r, na lu nhôn dan hơmet păng pơm rơgoh; to, đĭ-đăng lu tơmam noh dan 'bơ̆t anăp chơnang soi Kră Yang.”

English: Then King Hezekiah rose early, gathered the rulers of the city, and went up to the house of the LORD.
Bahnar: Pơtao Hesekia iung đơ̆ng hrôih krao akŭm lu yŏng pơgơ̆r lăm pơlei, năm tŏk tơ hnam Kră Yang

English: And they brought seven bulls, seven rams, seven lambs, and seven male goats for a sin offering for the kingdom, for the sanctuary, and for Judah. Then he commanded the priests, the sons of Aaron, to offer them on the altar of the LORD.
Bahnar: lu Sư chĕp ba tơpơh tŏ rơmo tơno, tơpơh tŏ triu tơno, tơpơh tŏ triu kon păng tơpơh tŏ bơbe tơno wă pơm tơmam soi pơyơ̆r huai đơ̆ng yoch kơ char sư, kơ hnam rơgoh păng kơ kon pơlei Juđa. Pơtao athei lu 'bok soi kon sâu Arôn, soi pơyơ̆r lu kon sem noh tơ kơpal chơnang soi Kră Yang.

English: So they killed the bulls, and the priests received the blood and sprinkled it on the altar. Likewise they killed the rams and sprinkled the blood on the altar. They also killed the lambs and sprinkled the blood on the altar.
Bahnar: Lu sư 'bet rơmo tơno, 'bok soi mong iŏk pham sư na tơtreh tơ chơnang soi, 'bet triu tơno, mong pham tơtreh tơ kơpal chơnang; lu sư kư̆m pơlôch lu triu kon, kư̆m tơtreh pham tơ kơpal chơnang soi.

English: Then they brought out the male goats for the sin offering before the king and the assembly, and they laid their hands on them.
Bahnar: Lu sư kư̆m rôp iŏk bơbe tơno wă pơm tơmam soi huai đơ̆ng yoch năm tơ anăp pơtao păng lu kon pơlei akŭm, dan ti lu sư kơpal lu kon sem soi pơyơ̆r noh

English: And the priests killed them; and they presented their blood on the altar as a sin offering to make an atonement for all Israel, for the king commanded that the burnt offering and the sin offering be made for all Israel.
Bahnar: na 'bok soi pơlôch lu bơbe tơno noh păng mong pham tơtreh tơ kơpal chơnang soi noh wă pơm tơmam soi huai đơ̆ng yoch kơ đĭ-đăng kơ lu kon pơlei Isơrael, yua kơ pơtao đei athei khan pơyơ̆r tơmam soi 'buh wă huai đơ̆ng yoch kơ đĭ kon pơlei Isơrael.

English: And he stationed the Levites in the house of the LORD with cymbals, with stringed instruments, and with harps, according to the commandment of David, of Gad the king’s seer, and of Nathan the prophet; for thus was the commandment of the LORD by His prophets.
Bahnar: Pơtao sư dan 'măn lê̆ lu bơngai Lêwi lăm Hnam Kră Yang chĕp chhar, brŏ dung, tĭng-nĭng kiơ̆ kơ Đawit, Gat 'bok 'bôh adrol, jang kơ pơtao păng Nathan 'bok khan lê̆ adrol, pơkă noh đơ̆ng Kră Yang ăn kơ lu 'bok khan lê̆ adrol tơbăt.

English: The Levites stood with the instruments of David, and the priests with the trumpets.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai Lêwi chĕp brŏ đơ̆ng Đawit, lu 'bok soi chĕp keng

English: Then Hezekiah commanded them to offer the burnt offering on the altar. And when the burnt offering began, the song of the LORD also began, with the trumpets and with the instruments of David king of Israel.
Bahnar: Hesekia athei đe pơyơ̆r tơmam soi 'buh, kơplah đe oei pơyơ̆r tơmam soi 'buh; kư̆m đei hơri bơnê kơ Kră Yang, hlôm keng reh brŏ đơ̆ng Đawit pơtao đe Isơrael, hơdai.

English: So all the assembly worshiped, the singers sang, and the trumpeters sounded; all this continued until the burnt offering was finished.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng kon pơlei drap kơkuh kơplah lu bơngai oei hơri, oei hlôm keng truh tơ pơyơ̆r tơmam soi keh đang.

English: And when they had finished offering, the king and all who were present with him bowed and worshiped.
Bahnar: Wă đang kơ pơyơ̆r tơmam soi boih, pơtao păng đĭ-đăng lu bơngai oei hơdai pơtao kŭp kơ̆l drap kơkuh bơnê.

English: Moreover King Hezekiah and the leaders commanded the Levites to sing praise to the LORD with the words of David and of Asaph the seer. So they sang praises with gladness, and they bowed their heads and worshiped.
Bahnar: Pơtao Hesekia păng lu yŏng pơgơ̆r athei bơngai Lêwi hat hơri bơnê kơ Kră Yang hăm nơ̆r hơri đơ̆ng Đawit păng Asap pơm, Asap, 'bok mă juăt kơ 'bôh adrol; lu sư hat hơri chơt hiôk kŭp kơ̆l kơkuh.

English: Then Hezekiah answered and said, “Now that you have consecrated yourselves to the LORD, come near, and bring sacrifices and thank offerings into the house of the LORD.” So the assembly brought in sacrifices and thank offerings, and as many as were of a willing heart brought burnt offerings.
Bahnar: Hesekia khan: “Dang ei lu iĕm đei hơmet akâu kơdih rơgoh ăn kơ Kră Yang boih; lei na năm tơ âu, chĕp ba tơmam soi pơyơ̆r bơnê mơ̆t tơ lăm Hnam Kră Yang. Kon pơlei khŭl akŭm chĕp ba tơmam soi 'buh păng tơmam soi pơyơ̆r bơnê; lu bơngai đei jơhngơ̆m hiôk na chĕp ba năm pơyơ̆r lu tơmam soi 'buh noh.

English: And the number of the burnt offerings which the assembly brought was seventy bulls, one hundred rams, and two hundred lambs; all these were for a burnt offering to the LORD.
Bahnar: Dôm lu sem tơmam soi 'buh pơyơ̆r đơ̆ng lu bơngai tơpôl akŭm pơyơ̆r chĕp ba đei tơpơh-jĭt tŏ rơmo tơno, minh-hrĕng tŏ triu tơno păng đei 'bar-hrĕng tŏ triu kon; lu sư yua sem dơrong noh pơyơ̆r wă pơm tơmam soi 'buh ăn kơ Kră Yang.

English: The consecrated things were six hundred bulls and three thousand sheep.
Bahnar: Jô̆ tơmam soi rơgoh tơdrâu-hrĕng tŏ rơmo tơno păng pêng-rơbâu tŏ triu hăm bơbe.

English: But the priests were too few, so that they could not skin all the burnt offerings; therefore their brethren the Levites helped them until the work was ended and until the other priests had sanctified themselves, for the Levites were more diligent in sanctifying themselves than the priests.
Bahnar: Mă-lei lu 'bok soi lu sư tŏ sĕt dêh ưh kơ kĕ kơ tam lŏng đĭ akar kon sem tơmam soi 'buh ôh; na đei lu 'nhŏng oh sư bơngai Lêwi hơmet akâu lu sư rơgoh kư̆m wang tơgŭm tơdrong jang noh dĭng truh keh, yua kơ lu bơngai Lêwi đĭ jơhngơ̆m pơyơ̆r akâu lu Sư hloh kơ lu 'bok soi.

English: Also the burnt offerings were in abundance, with the fat of the peace offerings and with the drink offerings for every burnt offering. So the service of the house of the LORD was set in order.
Bahnar: Kŭm đei lơ tơmam soi 'buh hăm rơmă đơ̆ng tơmam soi 'blŏk bơnê păng tơmam soi huch hơdai hăm tơmam soi 'buh. Thoi ei, tơdrong soi pơyơ̆r 'buh ăn kơ Kră Yang đei pơm hơmet ming dơ̆ng lăm hnam Kră Yang.

English: Then Hezekiah and all the people rejoiced that God had prepared the people, since the events took place so suddenly.
Bahnar: Hesekia păng đĭ-đăng kon pơlei lu sư chơt hiôk kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei đei asong ăn kơ lu kon pơlei Sư na tơdrong jang âu tĕnh jah keh đang.

English: And Hezekiah sent to all Israel and Judah, and also wrote letters to Ephraim and Manasseh, that they should come to the house of the LORD at Jerusalem, to keep the Passover to the LORD God of Israel.
Bahnar: Hesekia đei gơih nơ̆r sư kơ đĭ-đăng bơngai Isơrael păng lu bơngai Juđa, sư kư̆m chih hla bơar gơih ăn kơ bơngai Êphraim păng lu adrĕch Manase, wă kơ lu sư năm tơ Hnam Kră Yang tơ pơlei Jêrusalem, wă wang pơm giĕng Năm Brih 'blŏk hơdơ̆r kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Isơrael.

English: For the king and his leaders and all the assembly in Jerusalem had agreed to keep the Passover in the second month.
Bahnar: Pơtao păng lu yŏng pơgơ̆r hăm đĭ-đăng lu kon pơlei akŭm lăm pơlei Jêrusalem pơđâu băl, pơkă wă năm pơm giĕng Năm brih lăm khei mă 'bar

English: For they could not keep it at the regular time, because a sufficient number of priests had not consecrated themselves, nor had the people gathered together at Jerusalem.
Bahnar: Lu sư ưh kơ gơh năm pơm giĕng Năm Brih kơplah noh, yua kơ lu 'bok soi hơmet akâu kơdih rơgoh ưh tam mă tôm mah păng lu kon pơlei kư̆m tam tôm akŭm băl tơ pơlei Jêrusalem.

English: And the matter pleased the king and all the assembly.
Bahnar: Pơtao păng đĭ-đăng lu kon pơlei lăng tơdă akŭm noh trŏ boih.

English: So they resolved to make a proclamation throughout all Israel, from Beersheba to Dan, that they should come to keep the Passover to the LORD God of Israel at Jerusalem, since they had not done it for a long time in the prescribed manner.
Bahnar: Lu sư tơtă pơkă wă chă roi tơbăt jơ̆p-jang kơ char Isơrael, iŏk đơ̆ng pơlei Bêrsêba truh tơ pơlei Đan, wă kơ kon pơlei năm pơm giĕng Năm Brih 'blŏk hơdơ̆r Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Isơrael tơ pơlei Jêrusalem; yua kơ lu sư ưh tam mă biơh năm pơm giĕng năm brih wă kơ 'blŏk hơdơ̆r kiơ̆ kơ tơdrong juăt đei pơkă sơ̆.

English: Then the runners went throughout all Israel and Judah with the letters from the king and his leaders, and spoke according to the command of the king: “Children of Israel, return to the LORD God of Abraham, Isaac, and Israel; then He will return to the remnant of you who have escaped from the hand of the kings of Assyria.
Bahnar: Thoi noh lu bơngai năm tơbăt tơ jơ̆p kơ dêh char Isơrael păng char Juđa năm ba hla bơar pơtao păng lu yŏng pơgơ̆r sư, kiơ̆ thoi pơtao đei pơkă khan: “Ơ kon sâu adrĕch Isơrael, wih brŏk bĕ tơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Abraham, Isăk păng Isơrael, wă kơ Sư kư̆m wih tơ lu iĕm bơngai mă oei hlot klaih đơ̆ng ti lu pơtao Asiri.

English: And do not be like your fathers and your brethren, who trespassed against the LORD God of their fathers, so that He gave them up to desolation, as you see.
Bahnar: 'Nĕ pă pơm thoi 'bok păng 'nhŏng oh lu iĕm đei pơm yoch hăm Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei 'bok lu sư, na Kră Yang pơrăm lu sư krưp tơpă thoi lu iĕm 'bôh.

English: Now do not be stiff-necked, as your fathers were, but yield yourselves to the LORD; and enter His sanctuary, which He has sanctified forever, and serve the LORD your God, that the fierceness of His wrath may turn away from you.
Bahnar: 'Nĕ pă arăng kơ̆l thoi lu 'bok iĕm; chu bĕ Kră Yang, năm tơ anih rơgoh Sư mă 'măn lê̆ pha rơgoh ling-lang. Kơkuh ư-ang bĕ kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm, wă kơ Sư huay pă hil mĭl

English: For if you return to the LORD, your brethren and your children will be treated with compassion by those who lead them captive, so that they may come back to this land; for the LORD your God is gracious and merciful, and will not turn His face from you if you return to Him.”
Bahnar: Tơdah lu iĕm wih brŏk tơ Kră Yang na 'nhŏng oh păng lu kon sâu iĕm gô đei mơnat 'bơ̆t anăp lu bơngai mă rôp lu sư pơm bơnă, lei na gô tơwih lu Sư brŏk tơ dêh char 'nâu, yua kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm Tơ'ngla găt băt 'mêm mơnat, huay pă tơwih rŏng kơ iĕm tơdah lu iĕm wih brŏk tơ Sư.”

English: So the runners passed from city to city through the country of Ephraim and Manasseh, as far as Zebulun; but they laughed at them and mocked them.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai mă năm ba hla bơar năm tơ jơ̆p-jang đơ̆ng pơlei âu truh tơ pơlei nai lăm teh đak Êphraim, Manase păng truh tơ teh đak Sabulôn, đei bơngai hiĕk ăr che bơle kơ lu sư.

English: Nevertheless some from Asher, Manasseh, and Zebulun humbled themselves and came to Jerusalem.
Bahnar: Mă-lei đei lu mơ'nah đơ̆ng lăm teh đak Aser, Manase, hăm teh đak Sabulôn chu tơjur akâu păng năm truh tơ pơlei Jêrusalem.

English: Also the hand of God was on Judah to give them singleness of heart to obey the command of the king and the leaders, at the word of the LORD.
Bahnar: Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei kư̆m tơgŭm lu bơngai Juđa pơm ăn kơ lu sư lăp đon 'maih wă pơm kiơ̆ nơ̆r pơtao păng yŏng pơgơ̆r đei tơtă, kiơ̆ thoi nơ̆r Kră Yang.

English: Now many people, a very great assembly, gathered at Jerusalem to keep the Feast of Unleavened Bread in the second month.
Bahnar: Lăm khei 'bar đei lơ bơngai năm akŭm tơ pơlei Jêrusalem, đei minh khŭl akŭm tih tơpă đei lơlang lơlap kon bơngai wă pơm giĕng 'Bĕng ưh kơ đei 'Buih Pông.

English: They arose and took away the altars that were in Jerusalem, and they took away all the incense altars and cast them into the Brook Kidron.
Bahnar: Lu sư iung iŏk hŭt lê̆ chơnang đe soi kơ yang nai lăm pơlei Jêrusalem păng chơnang soh 'long 'bâu phu, klơ̆m hŭt lê̆ đĭ tơ lăm thŭng Kidrôn.

English: Then they slaughtered the Passover lambs on the fourteenth day of the second month. The priests and the Levites were ashamed, and sanctified themselves, and brought the burnt offerings to the house of the LORD.
Bahnar: Lăm năr mơjĭt-puăn khei 'bar, đe 'bet triu pơm giĕng Năm Brih; gah lu 'bok soi păng bơngai Lêwi 'bôh mơlâu, na hơmet akâu kơdih rơgoh păng chĕp lu kon sem pơm tơmam soi 'buh tơ Hnam Kră Yang.

English: They stood in their place according to their custom, according to the Law of Moses the man of God; the priests sprinkled the blood received from the hand of the Levites.
Bahnar: Lu sư oei đơ̆ng 'bơ̆t anih lu sư kơdih, kiơ̆ thoi khôi juăt Môis bơngai Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei tơtă 'bok soi iŏk pham đơ̆ng bơngai Lêwi na tơtreh.

English: For there were many in the assembly who had not sanctified themselves; therefore the Levites had charge of the slaughter of the Passover lambs for everyone who was not clean, to sanctify them to the LORD.
Bahnar: Lăm khŭl akŭm đei lu mơ'nah tam mă hơmet akâu kơdih rơgoh, na bơngai Lêwi athei 'bet kon sem tơmam soi pơm giĕng Năm Brih ăn kơ lu sư, wă kơ lu Sư pơyơ̆r rơgoh ăn kơ Kră Yang.

English: For a multitude of the people, many from Ephraim, Manasseh, Issachar, and Zebulun, had not cleansed themselves, yet they ate the Passover contrary to what was written. But Hezekiah prayed for them, saying, “May the good LORD provide atonement for everyone
Bahnar: Mă khan đei lơ mơ'nah đơ̆ng adrĕch Êphraim, Manase, Isakar păng Sabulôn tam mă hơmet akâu rơgoh kư̆m sa 'nhĕm giĕng Năm brih, ưh kơ kiơ̆ tơdrong juăt mă đei chih răk; mă-lei Hesekia krao khan ăn kơ lu sư

English: who prepares his heart to seek God, the LORD God of his fathers, though he is not cleansed according to the purification of the sanctuary.”
Bahnar: “Hơpơi apinh Kră Yang Tơ'ngla dim, 'nĕ kơ jô̆ yo kơ lu bơngai mă đĭ jơhngơ̆m chă Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu 'bok sư, mă khan lu sư tam kiơ̆ hơmet akâu kơdih rơgoh kiơ̆ thoi tơdrong juăt hnam akŭm rơgoh.”

English: And the LORD listened to Hezekiah and healed the people.
Bahnar: Kră Yang kơtơ̆ng bơih nơ̆r Hesekia krao khan, na pơklaih kon pơlei.

English: So the children of Israel who were present at Jerusalem kept the Feast of Unleavened Bread seven days with great gladness; and the Levites and the priests praised the LORD day by day, singing to the LORD, accompanied by loud instruments.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai Isơrael oei tơ lăm pơlei Jêrusalem chơt hiôk pơm giĕng sa 'bĕng ưh kơ đei 'Buih Pông lăm tơpơh năr. Lu bơngai Lêwi păng lu 'bok soi rim năr reh brŏ hat hơri bơnê ư-ang kơ Kră Yang.

English: And Hezekiah gave encouragement to all the Levites who taught the good knowledge of the LORD; and they ate throughout the feast seven days, offering peace offerings and making confession to the LORD God of their fathers.
Bahnar: Hesekia pơma pơhiôk jơhngơ̆m lu bơngai Lêwi đei đon hlôh wao bơ̆jang kơ Kră Yang. Lu sư sŏng sa lăm tơpơh năr păng pơyơ̆r tơmam soi 'blŏk bơnê kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu 'bok lu sư.

English: Then the whole assembly agreed to keep the feast another seven days, and they kept it another seven days with gladness.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng lu tơpôl akŭm pơkă lăm đon wă pơm giĕng Năm Brih 'nâu pă tơpơh năr dơ̆ng; lei na lu sư ngôi chơt hiôk thim pă tơpơh năr dơ̆ng.

English: For Hezekiah king of Judah gave to the assembly a thousand bulls and seven thousand sheep, and the leaders gave to the assembly a thousand bulls and ten thousand sheep; and a great number of priests sanctified themselves.
Bahnar: Hesekia pơtao Juđa, đei asong ăn kơ tơpôl akŭm noh minh-rơbâu tŏ rơmo tơno păng tơpơh-rơbâu tŏ triu bơbe; lu yŏng pơgơ̆r kư̆m asong ăn kơ tơpôl akŭm minh-rơbâu tŏ rơmo tơno păng mơjĭt-rơbâu tŏ triu, bơbe. Đei lơ lu 'bok soi hơmet akâu lu sư rơgoh.

English: The whole assembly of Judah rejoiced, also the priests and Levites, all the assembly that came from Israel, the sojourners who came from the land of Israel, and those who dwelt in Judah.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng lu bơngai tơpôl akŭm bơngai Juđa, lu 'bok soi, bơngai Lêwi păng lu tơpôl bơngai Isơrael kư̆m đei lu bơngai tơmoi năm đơ̆ng Isơrael, Juđa wang chơt hiôk.

English: So there was great joy in Jerusalem, for since the time of Solomon the son of David, king of Israel, there had been nothing like this in Jerusalem.
Bahnar: Lăm pơlei Jêrusalem đei tơdrong chơt hiôk tih; đơ̆ng chăl Sôlômôn kon drŏ-nglo Đawit pơtao Isơrael, lăm pơlei Jêrusalem ưh tam biơh đei tơdrong chơt hiôk thoi noh.

English: Then the priests, the Levites, arose and blessed the people, and their voice was heard; and their prayer came up to His holy dwelling place, to heaven.
Bahnar: Lu 'bok soi păng lu bơngai Lêwi iung sơkat pŭn hiôk ăn kơ kon pơlei; nơ̆r sơkat nơ̆r lu sư krao khan kơtơ̆ng truh tơ anih rơgoh Kră Yang, truh tơ plĕnh na Kră Yang tơl tơwih ăn pŭn hiôk.

English: Now when all this was finished, all Israel who were present went out to the cities of Judah and broke the sacred pillars in pieces, cut down the wooden images, and threw down the high places and the altars—from all Judah, Benjamin, Ephraim, and Manasseh—until they had utterly destroyed them all. Then all the children of Israel returned to their own cities, every man to his possession.
Bahnar: Wă đĭ-đăng tơdrong noh đang boih, lu bơngai Isơrael mă oei tơ noh lu sư năm tơ lu pơlei lăm char Juđa teh pơchah lê̆ lu jrăng gơ̆ng, teh pơhĕch lê̆ lu rup yang Asêria, pơrăm đĭ lu anih kơjung păng lu chơnang soi tơ lăm jơ̆p char Juđa, Bênjamin, Êphraim păng Manase dĭng pơrăm đi boih. Đơ̆ng noh đĭ-đăng lu kon pơlei Isơrael wih brŏk tơ pơlei lu sư kơdih tơ anih hnam lu sư.

English: And Hezekiah appointed the divisions of the priests and the Levites according to their divisions, each man according to his service, the priests and Levites for burnt offerings and peace offerings, to serve, to give thanks, and to praise in the gates of the camp of the LORD.
Bahnar: Hesekia klah asong lu 'bok soi păng lu bơngai Lêwi, kiơ̆ kơ khŭl tơdrong jang lu sư, wă pơyơ̆r tơmam soi 'buh păng tơmam soi pơyơ̆r kơ 'blŏk bơnê, wă kơkuh bơnê păng hơri ư-ang tơ anih lu 'măng jang cham Hnam Kră Yang.

English: The king also appointed a portion of his possessions for the burnt offerings: for the morning and evening burnt offerings, the burnt offerings for the Sabbaths and the New Moons and the set feasts, as it is written in the Law of the LORD.
Bahnar: Pơtao ăn tơmam soi sư kơdih wă pơyơ̆r pơm tơmam soi 'buh kiơ̆ pơgê kiơ̆ kơsơ̆, lăm năr giĕng Sa'bat, năr khei tơ'bang blŭng-a păng lăm lu năr giĕng tih kiơ̆ thoi đei chih răk lăm sơ̆p hla bơar khôi juăt Kră Yang.

English: Moreover he commanded the people who dwelt in Jerusalem to contribute support for the priests and the Levites, that they might devote themselves to the Law of the LORD.
Bahnar: Sư kư̆m athei lu kon pơlei mă oei lăm pơlei Jêrusalem asong ăn tơmam kơ lu 'bok soi păng bơngai Lêwi, wă kơ lu sư gơh jao lu sư kơdih awih awăn kiơ̆ khôi juăt Kră Yang.

English: As soon as the commandment was circulated, the children of Israel brought in abundance the firstfruits of grain and wine, oil and honey, and of all the produce of the field; and they brought in abundantly the tithe of everything.
Bahnar: Mưh đei nơ̆r pơtao tơtă truh boih kon pơlei Isơrael năm ba tơmam pơyơ̆r plei blŭng-a lăm bơyan thoi 'ba hơ'bo, Sik hơmu, rơmă ôliwơ, đak sut păng lu tơmam plei đơ̆ng mir chŭn; lu sư kư̆m năm ba pơyơ̆r minh lăm mơjĭt đơ̆ng dôm tơmam, lơ tơpă.

English: And the children of Israel and Judah, who dwelt in the cities of Judah, brought the tithe of oxen and sheep; also the tithe of holy things which were consecrated to the LORD their God they laid in heaps.
Bahnar: Bơngai Isơrael păng lu bơngai Juđa oei tơ lăm lu pơlei lăm char Juđa, kư̆m đei năm ba pơyơ̆r minh lăm mơjĭt lu sem dơrong rơmo, triu, bơbe pơyơ̆r minh lăm mơjĭt đơ̆ng dôm tơmam mă đei klah lê̆ pha 'lơ̆ng rơgoh ăn kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu sư; na dan hơdrom lê̆ minh 'bôt.

English: In the third month they began laying them in heaps, and they finished in the seventh month.
Bahnar: Khei mă pêng lu sư pơtơm pơyơ̆r tơmam akŭm pơpôi minh 'bôt, đơ̆ng khei pêng truh tơ khei tơpơh.

English: And when Hezekiah and the leaders came and saw the heaps, they blessed the LORD and His people Israel.
Bahnar: Wă Hesekia păng lu yŏng pơgơ̆r truh, 'bôh lu pôi noh na bơnê ư-ang kơ Kră Yang păng kon pơlei Isơrael.

English: Then Hezekiah questioned the priests and the Levites concerning the heaps.
Bahnar: Hesekia apinh lu 'bok soi păng lu bơngai Lêwi gah pôi đe hơdrom lê̆ tơmam soi noh.

English: And Azariah the chief priest, from the house of Zadok, answered him and said, “Since the people began to bring the offerings into the house of the LORD, we have had enough to eat and have plenty left, for the LORD has blessed His people; and what is left is this great abundance.”
Bahnar: Asaria 'bok soi tơm, đơ̆ng adrĕch Sadok, tơl sư khan: “Đơ̆ng lu kon pơlei pơtơm pơyơ̆r tơmam tơ Hnam Kră Yang lu nhôn đei sŏng sa mah păng kư̆m oei rơkah lơ, yua kơ Kră Yang ăn boih kơ kon pơlei sư đei pŭn hiôk; na mă đei rơkah lơ 'nâu.

English: Now Hezekiah commanded them to prepare rooms in the house of the LORD, and they prepared them.
Bahnar: Hesekia athei đe hơmet lu anih mong tơ Hnam Kră Yang; na lu đe hơmet lu hnam noh.

English: Then they faithfully brought in the offerings, the tithes, and the dedicated things; Cononiah the Levite had charge of them, and Shimei his brother was the next.
Bahnar: Đei jơhngơ̆m tơpăt ba pơyơ̆r lu tơmam noh, gah tơmam minh lăm mơjĭt păng tơmam rơgoh tah tơmơ̆t. Kônania bơngai wei-lăng tơm hnam anih tah tơmam noh; oh sư Simei pơm kơiĕng sư, bre sư bơngai Lêwi.

English: Jehiel, Azaziah, Nahath, Asahel, Jerimoth, Jozabad, Eliel, Ismachiah, Mahath, and Benaiah were overseers under the hand of Cononiah and Shimei his brother, at the commandment of Hezekiah the king and Azariah the ruler of the house of God.
Bahnar: Pơtao Hesekia păng Asaria, 'bok soi wei-lăng tơm lăm Hnam Kră Yang jao ăn kơ đe Jêhiêl, Asaria, Nahat, Asahel, Jêrimôt, Jôsabat, Êliel, Ismakia, Mahat păng Bênaia lu sư kư̆m bơngai tơgŭm wei-lăng đơ̆ng rŏng kơ Kônania păng Simei oh sư

English: Kore the son of Imnah the Levite, the keeper of the East Gate, was over the freewill offerings to God, to distribute the offerings of the LORD and the most holy things.
Bahnar: Kôrê kon drŏ-nglo Imna, bơngai Lêwi bơngai wei 'Măng Jang Hơlĕch, sư yŏng wei-lăng tơmam đe pơyơ̆r kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei hăm jơhngơ̆m hiôk păng lu tơmam 'lơ̆ng rơgoh.

English: And under him were Eden, Miniamin, Jeshua, Shemaiah, Amariah, and Shecaniah, his faithful assistants in the cities of the priests, to distribute allotments to their brethren by divisions, to the great as well as the small.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ sư đei Êđen, Miniamin, Jêsua, Sêmaia, Amaria păng Sêkania, lu sư asong ăn tơmam noh kơ lăm lu pơlei 'bok soi lu 'bok soi asong kơ lu 'nhŏng oh sư, hơtŏ hơnơ̆ng mă 'lơ̆p mă 'lŏ, kiơ̆ kơ khŭl lu sư.

English: Besides those males from three years old and up who were written in the genealogy, they distributed to everyone who entered the house of the LORD his daily portion for the work of his service, by his division
Bahnar: Kŭm asong kơ lu drŏ-nglo đei chih tơmơ̆t boih anăn lu sư lăm sơ̆p hla bơar jô̆ kiơ̆ adrĕch 'bok lu sư iŏk đơ̆ng pêng sơnăm tơ kơpal, kiơ̆ kơ khŭl lu sư gô mơ̆t bơ̆jang rim năr lăm hnam Kră Yang kiơ̆ kơ khŭl đei asong.

English: and to the priests who were written in the genealogy according to their father’s house, and to the Levites from twenty years old and up according to their work, by their divisions
Bahnar: Lu sư kư̆m asong ăn kơ lu 'bok soi kiơ̆ kơ hnam dơnŏ 'bă lu sư păng lu bơngai Lêwi iŏk đơ̆ng 'bar-jĭt sơnăm tơ kơpal, asong kiơ̆ kơ tơdrong jang păng kiơ̆ kơ khŭl lu sư

English: and to all who were written in the genealogy—their little ones and their wives, their sons and daughters, the whole company of them—for in their faithfulness they sanctified themselves in holiness.
Bahnar: Lu 'bok soi đe kư̆m chih anăn lu sư hơdai hăm đĭ-đăng lu kon drŏ-nglo kon drŏ-kăn akăn lu sư, yua kơ lu sư tơpăt pơyơ̆r akâu kơdih.

English: Also for the sons of Aaron the priests, who were in the fields of the common-lands of their cities, in every single city, there were men who were designated by name to distribute portions to all the males among the priests and to all who were listed by genealogies among the Levites.
Bahnar: Gah lu 'bok soi kon sâu Arôn, mă oei tơ mir na, tơ jê̆ kơ pơlei lu sư, dah oei tơ lăm rim pơlei nai, lu sư jang asong tơmam kơ đĭ-đăng kon drŏ-nglo lăm lu 'bok soi păng lăm lu bơngai Lêwi chih jô̆ boih lăm adrĕch 'bok lu sư.

English: Thus Hezekiah did throughout all Judah, and he did what was good and right and true before the LORD his God.
Bahnar: Tơ jơ̆p lăm char Juđa, Hesekia pơm thoi noh, sư pơm tơdrong 'lơ̆ng tơpăt 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu sư.

English: And in every work that he began in the service of the house of God, in the law and in the commandment, to seek his God, he did it with all his heart. So he prospered.
Bahnar: Dôm tơdrong jang sư pơm, gah Hnam Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei gah tơdrong wei răk khôi juăt păng nơ̆r tơtă, gah tơdrong chă Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei sư jang đĭ jơhngơ̆m, na tơdrong jang sư rai tŏk keh 'lơ̆ng.

English: After these deeds of faithfulness, Sennacherib king of Assyria came and entered Judah; he encamped against the fortified cities, thinking to win them over to himself.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ lu tơdrong noh tơdrong mă Hesekia pơm 'lơ̆ng tơpăt noh, na Senacherip pơtao Asiri năm mơ̆t lăm char Juđa, wang lu pơlei tih kơjăp wă blah iŏk.

English: And when Hezekiah saw that Sennacherib had come, and that his purpose was to make war against Jerusalem
Bahnar: Wă Hesekia 'bôh Senacherip năm wă kơ blah iŏk pơlei Jêrusalem

English: he consulted with his leaders and commanders to stop the water from the springs which were outside the city; and they helped him.
Bahnar: na sư krao akŭm lu yŏng pơgơ̆r păng lu bơngai yŏng linh nuih kơtang wă bơ̆ tu đak tơ 'nguaih kơ pơlei; đe noh tơgŭm sư mơ̆n.

English: Thus many people gathered together who stopped all the springs and the brook that ran through the land, saying, “Why should the kings of Assyria come and find much water?”
Bahnar: Kon pơlei đei akŭm băl lơ tơpă, bơ̆ găn lê̆ lu tu đak ro rok tơring păng khan: “Liơ lu bơ̆n lê̆ lu pơtao Asiri năm chă 'bôh đak lơ dêh?”

English: And he strengthened himself, built up all the wall that was broken, raised it up to the towers, and built another wall outside; also he repaired the Millo in the City of David, and made weapons and shields in abundance.
Bahnar: Sư adrin, man tơiung ming dur mă đĭ păk hơlih lap gleh tơpă; hăm man lu hnam thôt kơpal noh! Sư kư̆m man minh tăl dur plơ̆ng tơ đaih kơ pơlei noh. Sư kư̆m man ming kơjăp Milô pơlei Đawit păng tuh hơjơ̆m lơ khêl đao tơmam tơblah.

English: Then he set military captains over the people, gathered them together to him in the open square of the city gate, and gave them encouragement, saying
Bahnar: Sư kư̆m pơjao ăn chă yŏng linh wă pơgơ̆r wei-lăng kon pơlei na pơpôi akŭm lu sư hơdai lăm cham să 'bơ̆t 'măng jang pơlei, pơma pơlung hơtŏk jơhngơ̆m lu sư khan

English: “Be strong and courageous; do not be afraid nor dismayed before the king of Assyria, nor before all the multitude that is with him; for there are more with us than with him.
Bahnar: “Athei chơ̆n jơhngơ̆m nuih pran, 'nĕ kơ hli, 'nĕ kơ tơrơ 'bơ̆t anăp pơtao Asiri păng 'bơ̆t anăp lu linh kiơ̆ sư yua kơ đei Kră Yang Tih Hloh oei hơdai bơ̆n pran hloh kơ lu bơngai oei hăm sư

English: With him is an arm of flesh; but with us is the LORD our God, to help us and to fight our battles.” And the people were strengthened by the words of Hezekiah king of Judah.
Bahnar: Oei hăm lu sư noh kon bơngai hmă đĕch; bĕ gah bơ̆n đei Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu bơ̆n wă tơgŭm păng tơblah tang lu bơ̆n.” Kon pơlei đei jơhngơ̆m nuih đơ̆ng nơ̆r Hesekia pơtao Juđa.

English: After this Sennacherib king of Assyria sent his servants to Jerusalem (but he and all the forces with him laid siege against Lachish), to Hezekiah king of Judah, and to all Judah who were in Jerusalem, saying
Bahnar: Đang kơ noh, Senacherip, pơtao Asiri, hơdai hăm lu linh sư oei wang blah pơlei Lakis, kư̆m đei wơh lu Yŏng linh sư năm tơ pơtao Hesekia păng kon pơlei Juđa tơ pơlei Jêrusalem păng khan

English: “Thus says Sennacherib king of Assyria: ‘In what do you trust, that you remain under siege in Jerusalem?
Bahnar: “Senacherip, pơtao Asiri, khan: ‘Lu iĕm gơnang kơ tơdrong kiơ, mă oei pơjăng pơlei Jêrusalem mă nhôn wang tăp boih thoi noh!

English: Does not Hezekiah persuade you to give yourselves over to die by famine and by thirst, saying, “The LORD our God will deliver us from the hand of the king of Assyria”?
Bahnar: Hăm trŏ Hesekia pơhlŭ pơlung wă jao iĕm pơngot rơhing na lôch dah kiơ? Sư khan: Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu bơ̆n gô dŏng pơklaih lu bơ̆n đơ̆ng ti pơtao Asiri noh.

English: Has not the same Hezekiah taken away His high places and His altars, and commanded Judah and Jerusalem, saying, “You shall worship before one altar and burn incense on it”?
Bahnar: Hăm trŏ kơ đơ̆ng Hesekia mă đei pơrăm lê̆ lu anih kơjung păng chơnang soi kơ Kră Yang păng krao pơtơm kon pơlei Juđa păng kon pơlei Jêrusalem khan: Lu iĕm athei kơkuh păng soh tơmam 'bâu phu 'bơ̆t anăp kơ minh pôm chơnang soi 'nâu đĕch?

English: Do you not know what I and my fathers have done to all the peoples of other lands? Were the gods of the nations of those lands in any way able to deliver their lands out of my hand?
Bahnar: Lu iĕm ưh kơ băt hă tơdrong inh păng lu 'bok inh đei pơm kơ đĭ-đăng kon pơlei dêh char nai? Yang lu sư hăm gơh pơklaih char lu sư đơ̆ng ti inh?

English: Who was there among all the gods of those nations that my fathers utterly destroyed that could deliver his people from my hand, that your God should be able to deliver you from my hand?
Bahnar: Lăng lăm lu yang dôm dêh char mă lu 'bok inh đei pơrăm đĭ boih, hăm đei yang bu mă gơh dŏng pơklaih kon pơlei sư đơ̆ng ti inh? Lei liơ mă iĕm hơmĕng dêh khan Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm gơh dŏng pơklaih lu iĕm đơ̆ng ti inh?

English: Now therefore, do not let Hezekiah deceive you or persuade you like this, and do not believe him; for no god of any nation or kingdom was able to deliver his people from my hand or the hand of my fathers. How much less will your God deliver you from my hand?’ ”
Bahnar: Thoi ei na, dang ei lê̆ pă ăn kơ Hesekia pơhlŭ lu iĕm, pơthơr chông lu iĕm, lu iĕm 'nĕ pă lui kơ sư, yua kơ ưh kơ đei yang char kiơ mă dêh ayơ gơh pơklaih kon pơlei sư đơ̆ng ti inh, dah đơ̆ng ti lu 'bok inh sơ̆; tơma kiơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm khan gơh dŏng pơklaih lu iĕm đơ̆ng ti inh!’ ”

English: Furthermore, his servants spoke against the LORD God and against His servant Hezekiah.
Bahnar: Lu Yŏng linh Senacherip kang pơma kơnê̆ kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei păng Hesekia đĭch đam sư.

English: He also wrote letters to revile the LORD God of Israel, and to speak against Him, saying, “As the gods of the nations of other lands have not delivered their people from my hand, so the God of Hezekiah will not deliver His people from my hand.”
Bahnar: Pơtao kư̆m chih hla bơar pơjăm Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Isơrael păng khan: “Lu yang lăm dêh char nai ưh kơ kĕ dŏng pơklaih kon pơlei char lu sư đơ̆ng ti inh kư̆m lei-lăi mơ̆n Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Hesekia kư̆m ưh kơ kĕ pơklaih kon pơlei sư đơ̆ng ti inh!”

English: Then they called out with a loud voice in Hebrew to the people of Jerusalem who were on the wall, to frighten them and trouble them, that they might take the city.
Bahnar: Lu sư ôr tơkĕch re hăm nơ̆r Hêbrơ khan kơ lu kon pơlei Jêrusalem oei tơ kơpal dur pơlei kơtơ̆ng, wă kơ lu sư hli tơrơ na blah iŏk pơlei.

English: And they spoke against the God of Jerusalem, as against the gods of the people of the earth—the work of men’s hands.
Bahnar: Lu sư khan kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei pơlei Jêrusalem thoi lu yang kon pơlei đơ̆ng ti kon bơngai pơm.

English: Now because of this King Hezekiah and the prophet Isaiah, the son of Amoz, prayed and cried out to heaven.
Bahnar: Pơtao Hesekia păng Êsai 'bok khan lê̆ adrol kon drŏ-nglo Amôt, krao khan kơ tơdrong 'nâu, krao khan ôr tŏk truh tơ plĕnh.
